Title: Graduate Business Intelligence Data Analyst
Description:
HP‚Äôs Industrial Business (IP) works to deliver large scale cloud solutions that enable on demand manufacturing of personalized goods around the world. Our products lead the market with a strong focus on technology, scalability, and security. We are working to disrupt industries such as publishing, by bringing to physical world, personalized content that today only exist in a digital way. As part of this disruption, we help Print Service Providers streamline the manufacture of books, business cards, packaging, photos, posters, signage and almost anything else that can be printed.

At HP, Business Intelligence activity, plays a critical role in enabling the right data to support business decisions and operations management.

We are looking for a Graduate Business Intelligence Data Analyst to support the WW Industrial Print Services organization (IPCS).

As a BI Developer and Data Analyst you will design, build, and maintain reports and dashboards to monitor company, product, and business performance and KPI's.

The BI developers work with other team members from across the world to develop BI solutions and provide support to the BI systems and ongoing analysis needs.

This includes understanding the data and where to get it, extracting the data, processing it, optimizations, and turning data into insights and graphical representation in the BI platform (Tableau/Power BI).

Job Responsibilities


Dashboard Development: Effectively tells stories with the data using visualization tools (Power BI/Tableau is a must) to demonstrate insight impact and business value.
Data Gathering and Analysis: Basic experience on working with multiple data sources and data transformation methods.
Requirement Gathering: Collaborate with stakeholders to understand their business needs and translate requirements into dashboard designs.
Dashboard Maintenance: Monitor dashboard performance and support with applying quality measures.
Documentation: Document data sources, methodologies, and dashboard specifications to ensure transparency and reproducibility.
Training and Support: Provide training and support to users on how to interpret and use dashboards effectively.
Maintains proficiency within the Business Intelligence domain by keeping up with technology and trend shifts.


Education And Experience Required


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science and/or Engineering, Information Systems, Statistics, or a related field.
Experience with Data bases, SQL & Python for data extraction and manipulation.
Experience with Power BI and Tableau (is a must).
Knowledge on data mining, machine learning, and predictive analytics algorithms, methodologies, and approaches ‚Äì is a plus
Knowledge or experience with MS Excel- is a plus
Experience with AWS and cloud-based solutions in general ‚Äì is a plus
Knowledge of data warehousing concepts and ETL processes.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, Fluent English is a must.
Strong attention to detail and ability to deliver high-quality work under tight deadlines.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams.
A self-motivated with the ability to learn quickly.

Title: Data Analyst Trainee
Description:
Ecolab Company has an opening for an Data Analyst Trainee in our Procurement Analytics and Digital Solutions (ADS) team located in Barcelona, Spain. If you are a passionate professional that is seeking opportunity, advancement, and a rewarding learning chance and career we invite you to apply. This is a fantastic opportunity to join a highly recognized global growth company offering competitive compensation and benefits in addition to career growth.

Job Overview

As a part of the Data Operations team in the Global Supply Chain Analytics and Digital Solutions group you will be responsible for continuous improvements in digital capabilities and advanced analytics. You will lead the development of new digital products providing critical insights that help solve business challenges. The successful candidate will lead efforts to improve the chemical data understanding across the organization through improved process, governance, and data management.

Candidates must display a passion for systems, data, operational reporting & advanced analytics. The strong performer can expect further career advancement opportunities with Ecolab and will have the chance to move into other roles within Procurement or the organization, with increasing leadership opportunities. This is an exciting opportunity to advance your career with a stable growing company!

Main Responsibilities


Serve as a liaison among stakeholders to analyze, document, and validate requirements for reporting and changes to business processes
Develop and maintain data products
Develop, test, and operationalize new standardized reporting
Develop and maintain business intelligence dashboards
Lead automation of processes and analyses
Train other teams in systems, tools, and processes owned by ADS
Proactively make recommendations and identify opportunities to solve business problems through new business intelligence reporting
Interface with IT to specify and implement improvements to our data pipelines


Basic Qualifications


Masters in Data Science or Statistics or Computer Science or equivalent advance degree.
Interest in an Artificial Intelligence (AI) and business intelligence (BI) role
Experience with AI and BI data modeling and presenting insights to key stakeholders.
Exceptional analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Proficient in Python, PySpark, SQL, Azure AI, Tenserflow, Streamlit, Flask, Power Apps, Power BI, Snowflake, Azure SQL Database.
Intermediate SQL skills, or willingness to learn.
Fluent English
Full-time availability.
To be eligible for the Traineeship contract you must have completed your bachelor's or master's degree studies.
Work permit in Barcelona.


Preferred Qualifications


Experience designing and building standard reports and dashboards
History of managing and delivering projects, tasks, and initiatives
Ability to create, implement, document, and continuously improve processes in a changing environment
Training or experience in data science areas such as time series analysis, forecasting, classification, and regression analysis
Experience with data analytics tools such as Python, R, SPSS, MATLAB, Stata, and SAS
Experience working with global cross-functional teams and demonstrated ability to work well with people from different disciplines with varying degrees of technical expertise
Microsoft PowerBI experience
Project management experience
Experience in the petrochemical industry a plus
Enrolled in or recently completed degree with emphasis in Chemistry, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Information Technology, or Engineering preferred

HTML:
Ecolab Company has an opening for an Data Analyst Trainee in our Procurement Analytics and Digital Solutions (ADS) team located in Barcelona, Spain. If you are a passionate professional that is seeking opportunity, advancement, and a rewarding learning chance and career we invite you to apply. This is a fantastic opportunity to join a highly recognized global growth company offering competitive compensation and benefits in addition to career growth.

Job Overview

As a part of the Data Operations team in the Global Supply Chain Analytics and Digital Solutions group you will be responsible for continuous improvements in digital capabilities and advanced analytics. You will lead the development of new digital products providing critical insights that help solve business challenges. The successful candidate will lead efforts to improve the chemical data understanding across the organization through improved process, governance, and data management.

Candidates must display a passion for systems, data, operational reporting & advanced analytics. The strong performer can expect further career advancement opportunities with Ecolab and will have the chance to move into other roles within Procurement or the organization, with increasing leadership opportunities. This is an exciting opportunity to advance your career with a stable growing company!

Main Responsibilities

  • Serve as a liaison among stakeholders to analyze, document, and validate requirements for reporting and changes to business processes
  • Develop and maintain data products
  • Develop, test, and operationalize new standardized reporting
  • Develop and maintain business intelligence dashboards
  • Lead automation of processes and analyses
  • Train other teams in systems, tools, and processes owned by ADS
  • Proactively make recommendations and identify opportunities to solve business problems through new business intelligence reporting
  • Interface with IT to specify and implement improvements to our data pipelines

Basic Qualifications

  • Masters in Data Science or Statistics or Computer Science or equivalent advance degree.
  • Interest in an Artificial Intelligence (AI) and business intelligence (BI) role
  • Experience with AI and BI data modeling and presenting insights to key stakeholders.
  • Exceptional analytical and problem-solving abilities.
  • Proficient in Python, PySpark, SQL, Azure AI, Tenserflow, Streamlit, Flask, Power Apps, Power BI, Snowflake, Azure SQL Database.
  • Intermediate SQL skills, or willingness to learn.
  • Fluent English
  • Full-time availability.
  • To be eligible for the Traineeship contract you must have completed your bachelor's or master's degree studies.
  • Work permit in Barcelona.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience designing and building standard reports and dashboards
  • History of managing and delivering projects, tasks, and initiatives
  • Ability to create, implement, document, and continuously improve processes in a changing environment
  • Training or experience in data science areas such as time series analysis, forecasting, classification, and regression analysis
  • Experience with data analytics tools such as Python, R, SPSS, MATLAB, Stata, and SAS
  • Experience working with global cross-functional teams and demonstrated ability to work well with people from different disciplines with varying degrees of technical expertise
  • Microsoft PowerBI experience
  • Project management experience
  • Experience in the petrochemical industry a plus
  • Enrolled in or recently completed degree with emphasis in Chemistry, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Information Technology, or Engineering preferred

Ecolab‚Äôs commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion (DE&I) reflects our longstanding value of working together to integrate diverse perspectives to challenge ourselves, reach our goals and do what‚Äôs right. Disability certificate will be an asset.

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Our Organization

Dow Jones is a global provider of news and business information, delivering content to consumers and organizations around the world across multiple formats, including print, digital, mobile and live events. Dow Jones has produced unrivaled quality content for more than 130 years and today has one of the world's largest news-gathering operations globally. It is home to leading publications and products including the flagship Wall Street Journal, America's largest newspaper by paid circulation; Barron's, MarketWatch, Mansion Global, Financial News, Investor's Business Daily, Factiva, Dow Jones Risk & Compliance, Dow Jones Newswires, OPIS and Chemical Market Analytics. Dow Jones is a division of News Corp (Nasdaq: NWS, NWSA; ASX: NWS, NWSLV).

About The Team

Our Technology team drives the evolution of our Technology, Engineering, Data, Product and User Experience functions. With a keen focus on delivering cutting-edge solutions, we shape the digital landscape for our customers, readers, and users. From revolutionizing visuals to optimizing tools and harnessing the power of data, mobile, video, and social platforms, our team is committed to providing a seamless and immersive experience across all touchpoints. Collaborating closely with our newsrooms and strategic partners, we spearhead the development of groundbreaking products and technologies.

About The Role

The B2C Analytics team focuses on developing analytics solutions to help the organization make better data driven decisions. Our team is passionate about enabling others to use data and analysis to measure and monitor performance, identify risks and opportunities and find ways to continually add value.

You will primarily support the Consumer side of the business, which includes WSJ, Barron's, MarketWatch and more; but may also include exposure to other areas of the business, such as advertising and the professional information business. The ideal candidate will have previous experience in developing datasets, dashboards and data solutions that drive core insights. You will report to the Senior Manager, B2C Analytics.

You Will

Develop Stakeholder Partnerships


Develop strong partnerships with Product, Marketing, Newsroom, Finance, Data Collection, Data Engineering and other B2C Stakeholder Business teams and work across all levels and areas of the organization.
Executie data project roadmaps based on Business teams' priorities.


Understand B2C Data


Build a deep understanding of all the B2C data sources that we leverage in our Analysis projects
Partner with data engineers and data collection colleagues to collect, cleanse and organize data.


Conduct Analysis, Create Dashboards, Improve Processes & Ensure Quality


Analyze large datasets to surface trends and deliver recommendations with tangible business outcomes.
Create intuitive reports, dashboards and data solutions using visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, Looker Studio)
Continuously identify ways to improve and streamline processes around data and reporting
Ensure the quality of data and reporting, and partner with teams to improve accuracy and consistency


Clearly Communicate


Communicate technical information clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences


You Have


Team oriented and collaborative with eagerness to help others, and aspiration to be challenged and learn
Self starter able to work independently, coordinate with multiple partners and complete projects start to finish
Detail oriented with focus on assuring quality, consistency and accuracy in data and processes
Undergraduate degree or equivalent in combination of training and experience, preferably in a quantitative field such as Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or related disciplines.
Experience working with large datasets in a fast-paced and fluid environment with the ability to understand and solve complex non-routine problems.
Experience with SQL and strong knowledge of Excel/Sheets required. Familiarity with Github, Python/R preferred.
Experience with web analytics tools (particularly Google Analytics 4 and Adobe Analytics) is a plus.
Experience with data visualizations tools and techniques, and using data to tell a story (e.g. Tableau, Looker)


Our Benefits


Comprehensive Healthcare Plans
Paid Time Off
Retirement Plans
Comprehensive Insurance Plans
Lifestyle programs & Wellness Resources
Education Benefits
Family Care Benefits & Caregiving Support
Commuter Transit Program
Subscription Discounts
Employee Referral Program


\

Reasonable accommodation: Dow Jones, Making Careers Newsworthy - We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. EEO/AA/M/F/Disabled/Vets. We strongly encourage applications from all qualified individuals, including women, people with disabilities, and those from underrepresented groups. Dow Jones is committed to providing reasonable accommodation for qualified individuals with disabilities, in our job application and/or interview process. If you need assistance or accommodation in completing your application, due to a disability, email us at talentresourceteam@dowjones.com. Please put "Reasonable Accommodation" in the subject line and provide a brief description of the type of assistance you need. This inbox will not be monitored for application status updates.

Business Area: Dow Jones - Data & AI

Job Category: Data Analytics/Warehousing & Business Intelligence

Union Status

Non-Union role

Title: Data Analyst (They/She/He)
Description:
If you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We‚Äôll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 25 countries.

Together we revolutionise the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

ü§ù Our culture and strong values.

üí™ Our career development philosophy.

ü§ù Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

THE JOURNEY


Work closely with multi-disciplinary teams to define the business roadmap and strategy, monitor and give visibility of operations metrics and KPIs.
Apply various advanced mathematical and statistical modeling techniques and analyses (experimentation, machine learning, causal inference, etc.) to solve for product and business problems that drive the highest impact.
Translate business questions and hypotheses into analysis and actionable insights.
Develop and maintain scalable and self-service visualization tools and storytelling dashboards.
Foster strong relationships with stakeholders acting as a strategic and supportive link between the technology, business, and product.


What You Will Bring To The Ride


3-5 years of professional experience outside of an academic and internship setting, in a quantitative analysis role.
A higher education in scientific discipline such as Physics, Statistics, Computer Science or Mathematics.
Knowledge or experience in digital product development.
Demonstrable experience with the application of statistical modeling and advanced analytics to provide strategy-shaping insights.
Mastery in SQL and statistical programming (Python/R) and experience working with popular tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R Markdown.
Demonstrated experience in designing and analyzing experiments in digital products (A/B test, multivariate, etc).
Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau, Looker, PowerBI.
Excellent spoken and written English.


Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves


üåü An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
üí™ Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
üí≥ Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
üèä Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
üë™ Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

YOUR MISSION

Support the optimization of logistics features, with a focus on delivery areas and supply/demand imbalances, by maintaining and improving settings, quantifying their impact, providing data-driven insights, coordinating feature rollouts, and measuring their effectiveness.

THE JOURNEY


Work closely with local/regional stakeholders, product teams and development teams, serving as a bridge between product and operations, to define how to best set up and enable products, monitor and give visibility of metrics and KPIs.
Deep-dive on business metrics, in order to explore areas of opportunity and enable data-driven decision-making, based on applied statistics and probability techniques
Develop and maintain scalable and self-service visualization tools and storytelling dashboards.
Build optimization processes to define the best tuning of every feature on each geography.
Build robust relationships with stakeholders acting as a strategic and supportive link between the technology, business and product.
Support recurrent processes within the team, enabling the adjustment of tools to business needs
Continuously explore and refine key operational metrics (delivery time, efficiency, costs), gaining a comprehensive understanding of Glovo‚Äôs logistics.


What You Will Bring To The Ride


1-3 years of professional experience outside of an academic and internship setting, in a quantitative analysis role
Excellent SQL and Excel/GoogleSheet skills
Solid proficiency in statistical programming (Python/R) and experience working with popular tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R Markdown.
Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau, Looker, PowerBI, ...
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
Great spoken and written English.


Individuals representing diverse profiles, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable

üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
üë™ Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.

  • üë™ Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
  • üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.

Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

Title: Internship, Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

We are looking for a Data Analyst Intern for our dynamic market Intelligence team.

Responsibilities


Search for opportunities for business development and increase of company's market share in different services
Regular analysis of the company's performance
Convert the information into knowledge in order to increase company's competitiveness
Develop and maintain regulatory databases
Create, update and organize database of potential international customers
Support regional teams across the globe
Attend meetings with sales and business development managers based internationally


Qualifications


Degree in Business Administration / Data Analysis / Economics/ International Business.
Knowledge in Big Data a plus.
Fluent in English, Intermediate in Spanish.
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft windows applications (Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint)
MI tools such as Power Bi, MACRO, Data Scrapping tools are preferred.
Able to communicate effectively at all levels.
Willing to learn.
Proactive, organized, and multitasking with great team spirit.
Mission: At UL, we know why we come to work. Shape the way we approach and deliver our solutions to have a meaningful contribution to society.
People: Be part of our global team and do your best work! Teamwork, open-feedback and our diversity are our drivers to reach our common mission.
Interesting work: The work that goes on inside UL is fuelling the future. It challenges you to try fresh approaches, work autonomously, drive change and gain in-depth experience in your field.
Grow & achieve: Growth and development are part of our DNA. Grow & achieve with targeted development, reward and recognition programs as well as your very own UL University.
This is our normal: Competitive remuneration, annual bonus, flexible hours, home office options, paid annual leave.


About Us

A global leader in applied safety science, UL Solutions (NYSE: ULS) transforms safety, security and sustainability challenges into opportunities for customers in more than 110 countries. UL Solutions delivers testing, inspection and certification services, together with software products and advisory offerings, that support our customers‚Äô product innovation and business growth. The UL Mark serves as a recognized symbol of trust in our customers‚Äô products and reflects an unwavering commitment to advancing our safety mission. We help our customers innovate, launch new products and services, navigate global markets and complex supply chains, and grow sustainably and responsibly into the future. Our science is your advantage.

Title: Data Analyst Intern
Description:
Smadex is a leading advertising technology company founded in Barcelona in 2011 and sold to American-based and stock-listed Entravision in 2018 (NYSE::EVC). We are a fully transparent platform built with top technology, countless programmatic management features and powerful machine learning algorithms to help advertisers grow their business at scale. We are currently considered one of the top mobile ad-tech companies in the world.

We are looking for a Data Analyst Intern¬†with experience in Python,¬†SQL, analytics and knowledge of statistics to join our team in Barcelona. Working alongside our Data Engineers, the candidate should be communicative and analytical, in order to answer the complex questions that Product and Campaign performance are facing. For this purpose we use tons of data available to get powerful insights to resolve them, creating effective strategies to help improve the Smadex platform!¬†

This is a 6 month full-time internship based in Barcelona!

Your tasks and responsibilities:

Analyze large, complex data sets containing the behaviour of millions of mobile users and Apps worldwide to address strategic questions
Obtain and Report insights from our Product¬¥s performance (ML, Audiences, Creatives, Supply, etc) in order to make decisions that will impact revenue.¬† Have one¬¥s say!
Develop automated dashboards and processes to ensure data influence decisions at all levels of the company
Working cross-functionally with business and technical teams to support product performance

Skills and requirements:

Knowledge of Python, SQL and large data sets, understanding of analytic methodologies for data evaluation
Bachelor's or Master's Degree in Engineering or Business
Knowledge of basic statistics concepts
Analytical skills with the ability to get insights
Outstanding communication and reporting skills
Excellent command of Microsoft Excel (Power Pivot & Power Query)¬†
Excellent communication skills in English both written and spoken are mandatory
Strong experience with SQL for data exploratory analysis
Experience with A/B testing
R, Superset, PowerBI experience is a plus
Knowledge of the ad-tech industry is a plus.

Please note that we do NOT provide VISA sponsorship. Candidates without a legal permit to work in Spain won't be considered.

What is in it for you:

Integrate a highly motivated and young team
Great compensation package
Top location at the heart of Barcelona with a rooftop terrace, Barbeque, and a fully stocked fridge
Great work-life balance: work from home (2 days per week), flexible hours
LinkedIn Learning and training opportunities
Meal vouchers - Ticket¬†Restaurant monthly allowance
Monthly gym allowance to use in up to 30 DIR gyms around the city
Monthly TGIF events
Regular team-building events
Fun and friendly work environment with talented marketers and engineers from over 28¬†countries
And more!

Title: Customer Data Analyst
Description:
Welcome to this recruitment process with Vueling!

Applying is your first step to having the opportunity to join the first Top Employer airline in Europe. We hope the information you find here encourages you to apply so we can get to know you and stay connected.

Let's start by getting to know us better!

At Vueling, we love things to happen. We always do our best to go one step further and do it better. We invite our people to celebrate their unique strengths, work as a team to overcome challenges and achieve their goals for the greater good.

Our team is made of great professionals. Great and passionate people who collaborate, support and complement each other's skills.

We are one of Europe's leading low-cost airlines, with special relevance in the Spanish domestic market, as well as in France and Italy.

Job Purpose

The Performance and Projects team drives key initiatives to improve customer experience and business performance through strategic insight. In this role, you'll turn complex data into meaningful insights, enabling better decision-making and measurable improvements across the customer journey. Your work will directly contribute to transforming how we understand and serve our customers.

Main Accountabilities


Deliver insights that improve customer experience and business performance.
Champion NPS across the business ‚Äî own its analysis, visibility, and impact.
Build and evolve dashboards that bring NPS and other key metrics to life for teams (e.g. Ops, Commercial, Customer).
Support strategic projects with clear, data-backed recommendations.
Help teams across the business become more data-driven in their decisions.
Continuously improve the quality, clarity, and actionability of performance reporting.


Main Responsibilities - Tasks


Analyse customer and operational data to uncover trends, patterns, and improvement opportunities.
Develop and maintain impactful dashboards and reports.
Produce recurring and ad-hoc reports to track performance metrics and support business decisions.
Translate complex findings into clear, actionable insights for business stakeholders.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams (Customer, Data, Commercial, Network, Strategy) to support project delivery.
Ensure consistent, high-quality reporting with a focus on automation and reusability.


Main Relationships


Customer Experience, Commercial, Network, and Strategy Teams
Data & Analytics Teams


Education


Higher education in a relevant field (e.g. Statistics, Engineering, Business, or similar)


Experience


Minimum 2 years of experience in data analysis


Competencies


Strong analytical skills and critical thinking
Advanced Excel
Proficient in data visualisation tools (Tableau or Power BI)
Working knowledge of R or Python is a plus
Understanding of data structures and modelling concepts
Skilled at creating clear reports and compelling presentations
Accuracy, attention to detail, and the ability to explain data to non-technical audiences
Self-motivated, curious, and comfortable managing multiple priorities


Languages

Spanish and English (minimum B2)

Location

Viladecans, Barcelona

Level

Individual Contributor 5

We are the only Top Employer airline in Europe

For the second year running, Vueling is the only European airline and the only low-cost airline in the world to obtain this certification. The Top Employers Institute programme certifies organisations based on the participation and results of their HR Best Practices Survey. This survey covers six HR domains consisting of 20 topics including People Strategy, Work Environment, Talent Acquisition, Learning, Diversity, Equity & Inclusion, Wellbeing and more.

üü° #FlyToYourFullPotential

Every single person who works with us is unique. Join us is accepting the invite to fly to your full potential through self-development and pursuing your professional passion. Our employee value proposition and benefits include staff travel, discounts, a flexible working model, and more! Want to learn more? Click here.

üü° Our Culture

We thrive on teamwork and collaboration. Joining our team means being part of a cohesive unit that works together, shares knowledge, and supports each other.

Our positive working atmosphere is unique and essential to our productivity and growth. You'll be surrounded by diverse and dynamic professionals. We are passionate about what we do: Connecting People and Places! Learn more about our Mission, Vision, & Values.

üü° Our Recruitment Process

Your experience as a candidate is critical for us. We firmly believe that understanding our process will alleviate anxiety and ignite your passion for this extraordinary experience! Please take a closer look at how our process works.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At Unimedia Technology, we're on the lookout for a Data Analyst to work on the next-gen digital signage and advertising platform used by major clients across Europe.




üéØ What You‚Äôll Do

As a Data Specialist, you‚Äôll be crucial to making sure the geographic and postal data is clean, accurate, and ready to go. Here's a taste of your day-to-day:

‚óè üåê Research and scrape geographic, postal data and point-of-interest sources, integrating them into the systems.

‚óè üßπ Perform data cleaning, validation, and integration into our PostgreSQL database.

‚óè üß© Collaborate on internal projects with the team to process and analyze data effectively.

‚óè üó∫ Work closely with the Product Owner and Development to ensure data accuracy and relevance.

‚óè üìù Document your workflows and processes to keep things running smoothly.




ü§π You‚Äôll Fit Right In If You...

‚óè Have strong proficiency in SQL and experience with PostgreSQL (you‚Äôre comfortable writing queries like a pro).

‚óè Know your way around data processing and automation (bonus if you‚Äôve automated workflows before).

‚óè Have excellent written and spoken English communication skills

‚óè Hold a Bachelor‚Äôs degree (or higher) in a relevant field.

‚óè Have a good handling of Python or similar







üí• Nice-to-Haves

‚óè Experience with GIS (Geographical Information Systems) tools like QGIS or similar platforms.

‚óè Some familiarity with bash scripting and Git for version control.

‚óè Hands-on knowledge of web scraping tools and techniques (because sometimes the best data is hiding on the web).

‚óè A basic understanding of PHP (for occasional integrations).

‚óè Fluency in additional languages, especially those useful in international postal systems.

Description:
Sobre nosotros:

En ORBIDI, somos pioneros en el uso de tecnolog√≠a avanzada, inteligencia artificial y modelos predictivos para propulsar el crecimiento de las peque√±as y medianas empresas (PYMEs). Nuestra pasi√≥n por la innovaci√≥n y el marketing nos motiva a buscar soluciones creativas que permitan a las empresas no solo competir, sino destacar en el mercado actual. Creemos firmemente en el poder de la digitalizaci√≥n y c√≥mo esta puede transformar los negocios para mejor. Buscamos talentos creativos y estrat√©gicos que compartan nuestra visi√≥n y deseo de hacer una diferencia tangible en el mundo empresarial.

El rol:

Estamos buscando un/a Data Analyst (con enfoque en Operaciones y Ventas) para unirse a nuestro equipo y liderar iniciativas clave en an√°lisis avanzado, forecasting y visualizaci√≥n de datos.

Tu trabajo ser√° fundamental para guiar decisiones estrat√©gicas en operaciones y ventas, mediante el dise√±o de modelos predictivos, reporting inteligente y an√°lisis profundo de datos.

¬øCu√°l ser√° tu misi√≥n?




Dise√±ar, implementar y optimizar modelos de aprendizaje autom√°tico enfocados en eficiencia operativa y predicci√≥n de ventas.
Explorar y procesar grandes vol√∫menes de datos, garantizando su calidad e integridad.
Crear dashboards interactivos y visualizaciones impactantes que ayuden a los equipos de operaciones y ventas a entender los datos y tomar mejores decisiones.
Colaborar de forma transversal con equipos de producto, ingenier√≠a, operaciones y ventas para entender sus retos y proponer soluciones basadas en datos.
Aplicar t√©cnicas estad√≠sticas avanzadas como regresi√≥n, pruebas de hip√≥tesis o an√°lisis de series temporales para prever tendencias y mejorar procesos.
Dise√±ar y analizar experimentos A/B para validar hip√≥tesis y optimizar resultados.
Trabajar con herramientas cloud (AWS, GCP, Azure) y tecnolog√≠as de Big Data para desarrollar soluciones escalables y eficientes.
Contribuir al desarrollo de una cultura de datos s√≥lida, participando en la definici√≥n de pol√≠ticas de gobernanza y buenas pr√°cticas.


Lo que te har√° triunfar:


+2 a√±os de experiencia en ciencia de datos, an√°lisis o machine learning, preferiblemente aplicados a operaciones y ventas.
Dominio de Python o R, junto con bibliotecas como Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn.

Familiaridad con plataformas cloud (AWS, GCP, Azure).
Habilidad para traducir resultados t√©cnicos en mensajes claros y accionables para stakeholders no t√©cnicos.
Mentalidad proactiva, enfoque en la colaboraci√≥n y pasi√≥n por resolver problemas complejos.

Title: DATA ANALYST
Description:
NDT Global is the leading provider of ultra-high-tech diagnostic inspection solutions, advanced data analysis and integrity assessment services for ensuring the safety and longevity of energy-sector infrastructure assets. Recognized as the forerunner in ultrasonic inspection technologies comprising Pulse Echo, Pitch-and-Catch and Phased Array, as well as Acoustic Resonance (ART Scan) methodologies, the company also deploys a range of non-ultrasonic technologies, such as Inertial Measurement Units, with more under development. NDT Global strategically applies its inspection technologies to detect, diagnose and model various types of threat‚Äîcircumferential or axial cracks, metal loss, geometry, mapping, and more‚Äîacross diverse classes of assets. By providing predictive, decision-ready insights driven by the world‚Äôs most accurate data, NDT Global enables the conditions for asset owners to optimize infrastructure health and drive operational efficiencies while reducing risk and minimizing their carbon footprint.

Purpose

The Data Analyst interprets data collected from Ultrasonic Shear Wave Technology for the purposes of detecting crack-like axial defects under the constant supervision of individuals qualified for the task(s) being performed.

Role And Responsibilities


Identifies and carries-out feature/anomaly recognition of pipeline data (identification, classification, and sizing)
Identifies girth welds, longitudinal seam welds, and spiral welds applicable to the data set
Identifies pipeline installations and appurtenances
Establishes and validates reference points
Identifies wall thickness changes
Correlates, aligns, and ties-in customer maps, logs, alignment sheets or PODs to the data and creates a tally register
Interprets Above Ground Markers (AGM) information ‚Äì applies, edits, and generates location reference listing for this data



Qualifications And Requirements


Must possess a High School Diploma
An associate degree from a technical college is required
Minimum of 2 year's working experience in a technical field is preferred



Skillset


Proficient in English, both spoken and written
Strong data interpretation and analysis skills
Ability to generate clear and concise reports
Detail-oriented approach to data validation and reference point establishment
Competence in establishing and validating reference points.
Capability to correlate and align customer maps, logs, and alignment sheets with collected data.
Knowledge in interpreting Above Ground Markers (AGM) information and generating location reference listings.



Benefits


Competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package: Health Insurance, pension Plan, Gym Flex, eyecare, 23 days Annual leave
Flexible & Hybrid working: Our flextime model allows you to design your working day as it suits your needs
We think about the future: Individual training and development opportunities and professional development schemes
Opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies and make a significant impact on our data strategy
International, intercultural and young working environment.
Great company culture and office environment



At NDT Global, we are committed to creating an inclusive and diverse workplace. We believe that equal opportunities for all employees are essential to our success.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are growing our teams and this is an opportunity for you to join our Barcelona office as a Data Scientist / Analyst within the Analytics Performance Marketing team.

You will collaborate closely with Data Analysts, Data Scientists, UA Managers and other Marketing roles to analyse and interpret data that drives our marketing strategies.

Your insights will play a key role in shaping campaign optimization, identifying growth opportunities, and ultimately contributing to the company's success in a competitive gaming market.

As a Data Scientist / Analyst you will have a key role in defining, extracting and actioning data from big and complex datasets from a variety of analytical solutions from simple to complex.

Key Responsibilities:
Data Analysis & Reporting:
Gather, clean, and analyze marketing data from multiple sources to provide actionable insights.
Produce ad hoc analyses to support decision-making for campaigns and product launches.
Monitor and evaluate the performance of marketing campaigns ( paid ads, organic TV, brand) and provide recommendations for optimisation.
Develop actionable insights from user data that inform marketing targeting, acquisition and retention strategies.
Data Modelling - Time Series forecasting, A/B Testing
Collaboration:
Collaborate with cross-functional teams including Data Science, Data Engineer, to integrate marketing data with overall product and business objectives.
Communicate findings and insights to non-technical stakeholders through clear and concise visualizations and presentations.
Data Quality & Governance:
Ensure the accuracy and integrity of all marketing data through regular data audits and validation processes.
Help set and maintain data tracking standards across marketing channels, ensuring consistency and reliability.







What We're Looking For

Required Qualifications:
3 to 5 years of experience as a Data Analyst / Scientist or in a similar analytical role, preferably within the gaming / tech / financial industry.
Strong proficiency in data analysis tools (SQL, Python, Excel, etc.).
Experience with data modelling, time series analysis, A/B testing, Difference in Difference
Ability to identify trends, extract insights, and communicate findings in a clear and actionable manner.
Strong attention to detail and ability to work with large datasets.
Ability to present complex data in an easy-to-understand format to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Nice-to-Have Skills:
Familiarity with game-related metrics, mobile apps such as daily active users (DAU), in-app purchases (IAPs), and retention/engagement metrics.


Why Product Madness?

As part of the Aristocrat family, we share their mission of bringing joy to life through the power of play, with a world-class team who creates top-grossing, leading titles in the social casino genre, including Heart of Vegas, Lightning Link, Cashman Casino.

With 800 team members across the globe, Product Madness is headquartered in London, with offices in Barcelona, Gda≈Ñsk, Lviv, Montreal and a remote team spanning the USA, making us a truly global powerhouse.

We live by our People First principle. Regardless of where, when, or how they work, our team members have opportunities to elevate their careers, and grow alongside us. We take pride in fostering an inclusive culture, where our people are encouraged to be their very best, every day.

But don‚Äôt just take our word for it. In 2024, we made the Global Inspiring Workplace Awards list, and won a bronze award at the Stevies for Great Employers in the ‚ÄòEmployer of the Year - Media and Entertainment‚Äô category.

So, what‚Äôs stopping you?

Our Values
People First
We have the deepest respect for our people and their well being. We know they are exceptionally talented and will always have a choice. We want them to re-choose us every day. We are committed to building a culture where each person's voice will always be heard and addressed.
MAD for More
Always improving, innovating and never settling for the existing. We push all boundaries with courage and ambition to become the world‚Äôs best games company.
Champion Together We excel at what we do but yet remain humble and helpful to our teammates. We champion one another and hold each other to high standards without any egos.
Globally Inclusive
We are all Equal - regardless of the language we speak, where we live, our gender, religion or culture we come from. We want to build a global home, where everyone has the equal opportunity to make an impact.
Customer Focused
We always think from the customer's perspective - be it players or internal customers.

Improving their experience and joy is what drives us. Every client's success is our big win!

Travel Expectations

None

Additional Information

At this time, we are unable to sponsor work visas for this position. Candidates must be authorized to work in the job posting location for this position on a full-time basis without the need for current or future visa sponsorship.

As a Product Analyst, you will join ID Finance to support the development and optimization of the company‚Äôs products. You will focus on ensuring the effective operation of the legal and support teams while working to improve customer service processes, making them more data-driven and efficient.




Primary Responsibilities

Perform deep analysis of user metrics to find key points of growth or potential problems in user journeys.
Develop data-marts prototypes and analytical reports with key product indicators.
Automation and setup of analytical tools like appsflyer, google analytics and etc.




Knowledge & Skills

3+ years of relevant experience in similar role of Senior Product analyst in fintech/banking or e-commerce company

Experience with google analytics setup or working with similar platform.
Knowledge of modern mobile marketing attribution platforms like appsflyer and etc.
Fluent in English
High attention to detail and ability to translate complex data into actionable insights.
Proactive, independent, and able to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced setting.

Experience with Clickhouse DB

Experience with airflow

As a Product Analyst, you will join ID Finance to support the development and optimization of the company‚Äôs products. You will focus on ensuring the effective operation of the legal and support teams while working to improve customer service processes, making them more data-driven and efficient.


Primary Responsibilities

  • Design, run, conclude AB tests in Product department.
  • Perform deep analysis of user metrics to find key points of growth or potential problems in user journeys.
  • Develop data-marts prototypes and analytical reports with key product indicators.
  • Automation and setup of analytical tools like appsflyer, google analytics and etc.


Knowledge & Skills

  • 3+ years of relevant experience in similar role of Senior Product analyst in fintech/banking or e-commerce company
  • Strong background in statistics and AB design and analysis
  • Strong knowledge of SQL, preferably column-oriented DBMS
  • Experience with google analytics setup or working with similar platform.
  • Knowledge of modern mobile marketing attribution platforms like appsflyer and etc.
  • Fluent in English
  • High attention to detail and ability to translate complex data into actionable insights.
  • Proactive, independent, and able to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced setting.


Nice to have:

  • Experience with Clickhouse DB
  • BI instruments like tableau, superset
  • Experience with airflow


Technological stack:

  • Clickhouse
  • Python
  • Git
  • Airflow
  • MySQL
  • Google cloud, google analytics, firebase
  • Appsflyer


Benefits

üí™ Private health and dental insurance.

üëü Discounted gym membership.

üíª Freedom to work from home two days a week.

üçé Kitchen with free coffee and fruit each Monday, Wednesday and Friday and snacks.

üåç Team building activities and work in an international and passionate environment.


Don‚Äôt miss the opportunity to be part of a company that values innovation and talent!

Join us and take your career to the next level üöÄ

Title: Master Data Analyst
Description:
Global Master Data Analyst

Global Master Data Analyst would be part of a team, in charge of code creation process, running enrichment processes and maintenance of master data for Coty worldwide on a global SAP platform.

Responsibilities

You would be responsible for ensuring that the Material Master Data is created on time and accurate as per briefing from Marketing/Initiative Leader. You are following the Global Data Standards provided by our Data Governance Team and contributing to adjust them to changing needs. As Coty‚Äôs growth builds on constant new product developments, this position plays a key role delivering ‚ÄúData Readiness‚Äù during different stages of the Innovation and leading the work across.

Your main focus:


Deliver Key Performance Indicators, making sure to reach the Service Level Agreement targets.
Understanding of the product creation cycles and basic data, whilst understanding the business impacts.
Identify systemic errors and trend analysis, being able to root cause, sharing a clear issue statement.
Tracking all new project status, with direct contact and communication across different workstreams, to guarantee the visibility and status of data readiness in SAP for all new initiative in the scope, giving priority based on business requirements.
Follow up with departments involved with Master Data functionality reporting clear issue statement, tackling business needs with clarity and structure.


Working for Coty means being part of one of the largest beauty companies with an iconic portfolio of brands across fragrance, color cosmetics, skin care and body care. We are a global leader in fragrance and number three in color cosmetics and our products are sold in over 150 countries around the world. COTY and its brands are committed to a range of social causes, embraces diversity as well as seeking to minimize its impact on the environment. You can work in a truly international and dynamic work environment, in a culture based on trust and cooperation with opportunities of continues improvement and learning with the freedom to be yourself.

The team consists today of five Master Data Analyst. You will work closely together with several departments such as Master Data Governance, Initiative leaders, Marketing, Planning, R&D, Quality and IT. All your colleagues are dedicated experts and ready to drive Coty to the next level. Working with a team environment with can do attitude, optimistic, focus on finding solutions. The team has a continuous improvement mindset, committed to resolving upcoming challenges and opportunities, to make processes more efficient. Master data community main characteristics are team spirit, collaboration and working together cohesively toward common goals. They willingly share knowledge and resources, help when needed, and celebrate each other's successes.

YOU ARE A COTY FIT

You like to focus on the results and be able to react to the business‚Äôs need with sensibility. As a/an experienced Master Data Analyst, you collaborate and work together with other teams, and you get energy from working in a fast-paced, diverse, and international environment.

Other than that, you:


Bachelor‚Äôs degree (Engineering, BA and/or similar academic background).
Good technical skills in Excel and SAP. Knowledge in Microsoft Access, Visual Basic will be considered.
Root Cause Analysis (RCA) mentality, with ability to propose and deliver improvements.
Team Player mindset.
Strong sense of individual accountability ‚Äì personal drive to improve and passionate ownership of performance.
Autonomous motivation to implement changes and challenge the current process / system to deliver improved results.
Good English level and communication skills.


Our Benefits

As our Master Data Analyst some of the benefits you will receive are:


A salary that matches your knowledge and experience
Omni-Working: Hybrid flexible working model enabling employees to balance remote and office-based work and promote work / life balance.
Flexible working hours
Meal voucher
Medical & Physiotherapy Service


RECRUITMENT PROCESS


A telephone/online introductory meeting.
A first online/in-person interview
A second interview
You will receive a proposal with the terms of employment.


About Coty

Coty is one of the world‚Äôs largest beauty companies with an iconic portfolio of brands across fragrance, color cosmetics, skincare, and body care. At Coty, we celebrate the entire human kaleidoscope and cultivate a culture of fearless kindness. Therefore, we are proud to be an equal opportunities employer. We do not discriminate against any candidate or employee and strive to be an open, inclusive and diverse workplace where all employees can be their authentic self. Join us in making over the world of beauty!

Title: Junior Data Analyst - Commercial Strategy (They/She/He)
Description:
If you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We‚Äôll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 23 countries.

Together we revolutionise the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

ü§ù Our culture and strong values.

üí™ Our career development philosophy.

ü§ù Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: Building the largest marketplace in your city, to give access to anything in minutes. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

You will be in charge of providing data for the main partner strategies of the Account Management team. Through analytics, you will be globally identifying and improving the experience of the customer in Glovo. You will be a direct contributor to key company initiatives, taking full ownership of data analysis and insight generation, automating data generation together with our Data teams, and driving reporting enhancements, while you will also contribute with recommendations to the initiatives you are part of for global implementation.

THE JOURNEY


Develop and apply analytical frameworks to evaluate partner performance across multiple countries.
Analyze partner behavior and lifecycle patterns and perform root-cause analysis to identify drivers of performance.
Build and run ad-hoc SQL queries to extract relevant data, prepare structured datasets, and support fast-turnaround analyses.
Automate recurring reports and build dashboards or ad-hoc reports to enable self-service access to key commercial metrics.
Calculate and track strategic KPIs such as retention and lifecycle targets, tailored by country and partner segment.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams (e.g., BI, commercial, data managers) to define analytical priorities, validate insights, and align on actions.
Lead the discovery phase of new analytical topics, shaping hypotheses, structuring analysis, and translating data into clear, actionable insights.


What You Will Bring To The Ride


A degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field.
1‚Äì2 years of experience turning data into actionable insights to support internal decision-making.
Strong analytical skills and solid command of SQL and Excel. Experience with BI tools (e.g., Looker, Tableau, Power BI) is a must.
Experience with Python and analytical libraries (Pandas, SciPy, Scikit-learn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks) or R is highly valued.
A strategic mindset with a deep understanding of business impact and prioritization.
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to turn complex data into clear recommendations.
Strong organizational and multitasking abilities‚Äîyou thrive in fast-paced environments and are comfortable managing several projects simultaneously.
A bias for action: you move fast, take ownership, and get things done with a hands-on attitude.
Team spirit and adaptability‚Äîyou collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and communicate clearly.
Professional level of English (written and spoken).


Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves


üåü An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
üí™ Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
üí≥ Discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
üèä Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
üë™ Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

  • Professional level of English (written and spoken).

Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves

  • üåü An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
  • üí™ Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
  • üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
  • üí≥ Discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
  • üèä Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
  • üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
  • üë™ Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
  • üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.

Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

Title: Logistics Data Analyst (They/She/He)
Description:
If you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We‚Äôll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 25 countries.

Together we revolutionize the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

ü§ù Our culture and strong values.

üí™ Our career development philosophy.

ü§ù Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

Support the optimization of logistics features, with a focus on delivery areas and supply/demand imbalances, by maintaining and improving settings, quantifying their impact, providing data-driven insights, coordinating feature rollouts, and measuring their effectiveness.

THE JOURNEY


Work closely with local/regional stakeholders, product teams and development teams, serving as a bridge between product and operations, to define how to best set up and enable products, monitor and give visibility of metrics and KPIs.
Deep-dive on business metrics, in order to explore areas of opportunity and enable data-driven decision-making, based on applied statistics and probability techniques
Develop and maintain scalable and self-service visualization tools and storytelling dashboards.
Build optimization processes to define the best tuning of every feature on each geography.
Build robust relationships with stakeholders acting as a strategic and supportive link between the technology, business and product.
Support recurrent processes within the team, enabling the adjustment of tools to business needs
Continuously explore and refine key operational metrics (delivery time, efficiency, costs), gaining a comprehensive understanding of Glovo‚Äôs logistics.


What You Will Bring To The Ride


1-3 years of professional experience outside of an academic and internship setting, in a quantitative analysis role
Excellent SQL and Excel/GoogleSheet skills
Solid proficiency in statistical programming (Python/R) and experience working with popular tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R Markdown.
Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau, Looker, PowerBI, ...
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
Great spoken and written English.


Individuals representing diverse profiles, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable


üí™ Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
üí≥ Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
üèä Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
üë™ Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. Title: Data Analyst Senior
Description:
As a Data Analyst Senior, you are in charge of building SQL, Qlik and PowerBI data models to support key business decisions. You will collaborate with our product owners, guide your team members and work closely with our clients on their challenges requiring Data Foundations, Data Analytics, and Data Science.

As a Data Analyst Senior, you work closely with data engineers, bi analysts and product owners to create fast, efficient, and scalable data intelligence solutions for Werfen employees.




Key Accountabilities

Among others, you will:

‚Ä¢ Between 2 to 3 years of experience in a similar role, managing a team or multiple projects. Preferably in the digital/tech and health/diagnostics/life science space.

‚Ä¢Work with the team and business stakeholders to identify requirements, define models, and kickstart new analytics initiatives.

‚Ä¢Build data models with SQL and automate them with Python. Have deep knowledge of all the datasets inside the data lake to be able to provide guidance to stakeholders.

‚Ä¢Apply the correct data models to the business problem at hand.

‚Ä¢Leverage creative solutions, analytics, and visualization/ reporting techniques to enhance knowledge and drive actionable insights that deliver ROI.







Networking/Key relationships

Critical to be able to build relationships based in trust within the organization as the function is to respond to the internal customer needs while taking into consideration the overall corporate strategy.




Minimum Knowledge & Experience required for the position:

We expect that you have experience with:

‚Ä¢ SQL advanced

‚Ä¢ Good knowledge of any programming language like Python

‚Ä¢ Power BI, Qlik or other dashboarding software

‚Ä¢ Statistical programming (Python/R) and experience working with popular libraries and tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R Markdown.




We will consider it an advantage if you also have familiarity with any of the following:

‚Ä¢ AWS

‚Ä¢ Microsoft Azure cloud computing

‚Ä¢ Familiarity with DataOps principles

‚Ä¢ Familiar with Agile methodologies

‚Ä¢ Git software versioning




Skills & Capabilities: We expect you to demonstrate proficiency in data analysis and have a keen interest in understanding various business domains. We will also need you to be able to communicate data concepts to non-technical colleagues.

‚Ä¢ You are fluent in English both orally and in writing.

‚Ä¢ You have good presentation skills.

‚Ä¢ You can communicate well within the team and with stakeholders.

‚Ä¢ You can analyze business requirements in dialogue with internal stakeholders.

‚Ä¢ You can collaborate directly with external consultants and vendors.

‚Ä¢ You are a team player willing to share knowledge, ideas, and banter.




Travel requirements: 5% of time

Title: Intern Global E-Commerce Data Analyst - English Speaker
Description:
About this Position Are you a curious, data driven and energetic individual willing to solve critical challenges with passion and innovation? Are you seeking to be the connection between our internal international teams and agencies? If this sounds like you, keep reading! Successful candidate will be part of our E-commerce Global team that defines, develops, and executes the eCommerce strategy for Henkel Consumer Adhesives.

What You¬¥ll Do


Support Ecom global team in the roll-out of data usage and strategies across countries.
Deliver high quality reports and analysis for our stakeholders (global teams)
Tracks, processes, analyses and verifies data in order to improve accuracy and quality.
Regular trend research and competitive analyses.
Own set of responsibilities for one or several projects.


What makes you a good fit


Degree in controlling, statistics, information science, mathematics or similar.
Excellent knowledge of English
Very good command of MS Office, specifically Excel & analytical skills is required
Hands-on experience with common visualization tools is a plus, such as Power BI, Tableau or others
Goal oriented working-style, reliable in project management
Initiative team player who enjoys working in a challenging and exciting environment
Good interpersonal and communication skills


Some perks of joining Henkel


Flexible work scheme with flexible hours, hybrid and work from anywhere policies
Diverse national and international growth opportunities
Meal Allowance for each worked day
Discounts on company products


At Henkel, we come from a broad range of backgrounds, perspectives, and life experiences. We believe the uniqueness of all our employees is the power in us. Become part of the team and bring your uniqueness to us! We welcome all applications across different genders, origins, cultures, religions, sexual orientations, disabilities, and generations.

Title: Data Analyst, Solutions and Innovation
Description:
What You'll Do:

As a member of our AXSI team, you'll be at the forefront of measurement and experimentation. Your role will be crucial in helping our clients understand and maximise their return on investment while driving innovation in the rapidly evolving digital advertising landscape.


Incrementality measurement: Enable advertisers to quantify and understand the true value of Criteo's solutions through sophisticated measurement methodologies
Client Consultations: Partner with advertisers to deeply understand their business objectives and define meaningful success metrics for their advertising investments
Experimentation Design: Craft and implement robust testing strategies tailored to each client's unique needs and business context
Analysis & Communication: Transform complex experimental data into clear, actionable insights and recommendations for clients
Measurement Innovation: Contribute to our suite of measurement tools, enabling teams across Criteo to evaluate and optimise their initiatives
Data-Driven Innovation: Leverage cutting-edge tech like Hadoop, Vertica, Tableau, Git, Python, and SQL to transform complex business challenges into groundbreaking solutions
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with commercial teams and clients to deliver insights that drive revenue and foster client success



Who You Are:


A problem-solver with a passion for analytics and a logical approach to challenges
Solid foundation in statistical inference methodologies and experience in designing and analysing A/B tests
Interested in solving data problems using Python & SQL, and enthusiastic about automating and scaling solutions
Business-minded with a goal to turn data insights into actionable strategies
Ability to synthesise complex information and present clear, actionable recommendations
Team player who thrives in a collaborative, inclusive, and vibrant workspace
Fluent in English and skilled at simplifying complex concepts for diverse audiences
Eligible to work in Spain with no restrictions



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we‚Äôd love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world‚Äôs marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

Title: BI Analyst Intern
Description:
What You'll Do:

The Global Reporting Team's mission is to identify, define, produce, and automate sales/business/finance performance reporting portfolio. As the scope of the GRT is so wide, this is a unique opportunity not only to develop your technical skills, but also to learn more about different areas of our business and make an impact, while working in a fast paced environment.

Criteo and our stakeholders are constantly finding new ways to innovate, and our reporting suite is critical for tracking progress. As an intern, alongside the rest of the team you will be responsible for :


Working with stakeholder to analyze and understand their business needs to translate them into technical requirements
Building, running and updating existing reports based on the company needs and transformations
Exploring, validating and fixing data issues to provide high quality service to Criteos
Maintaining and improving processes (specification, procedures, and user training material).



Our objective is that by the end of the internship, you have developed the skills and experience to work in data.

Who You Are:


Degree from a business or quantitative field
Excellent communication skills in English (spoken and written)
Must be eager to learn, proactive and analytical
You are versatile, self-driven, detail-oriented, and hands-on
You value teamwork and building rapport with individuals
You have a demonstrated interest in Internet and technology
Bonus: experience in Excel (pivot tables, vlookup, etc.), PowerPoint, SQL, and BI restitution tools such Power BI (or equivalent)



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we‚Äôd love to see your application!
