We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world‚Äôs marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

Title: Healthcare Research & Data Analyst (MedTech Insights)
Description:
We are looking for a Healthcare Researcher & Data Analyst to join our Medtech group in Barcelona.

In this role, you will build MedTech therapy expertise and translate market research data into high-quality syndicated and custom insights to our global MedTech customers. You will also actively develop and maintain relationships with internal and external stakeholders.

If you have passion for the dynamic MedTech landscape and are excited about the opportunity to work in our vibrant Life Sciences & Healthcare (LS&H) group, we would like to hear from you.

About You ‚Äì Experience, Education, Skills, And Accomplishments


PhD in relevant subject area (science or business)
2-5 years of industry experience relating to quantitative data analysis
Proficient in Microsoft Excel, including advanced functions
Excellent read and written Spanish (Native or C2) and excellent read, spoken and written English (Native or C1/C2)


It would be great if you also had . . .


Experience in building market forecast models and converting unstructured datasets into broadly usable data models
Relevant experience in the medical device, healthcare, market research or consulting sectors
Experience using SQL
You know how to deliver an effective presentation
Passionate about data and insights‚Äîyou have the intrinsic drive to push boundaries on how we leverage data.
You appreciate the freedom to make an impact that you can own.
You are solution-oriented‚Äîyou value ideas but understand the importance of execution.
Thrive in a rapidly changing business.
Respect deadlines and able to handle multiple projects at once.


What will you be doing in this role?


Author comprehensive market research reports that provide quantitative and qualitative insights on specific medical device markets around the world.
Build market models by leveraging Clarivate‚Äôs proprietary healthcare datasets, while incorporating public financial, regulatory, and government data.
Interview industry stakeholders and medical professionals to contextualize data and form insights.
Understand the worldview and pain points of Clarivate clients, working closely with them as a problem-solver. From Fortune 500 companies to smaller startups, you will converse with high-profile clients regularly and be expected to both present and defend conclusions to them.
Engage in cross-functional collaboration on initiatives and projects impacting multiple teams.
Contribute your vision; influence the evolution of our products, data models, and data usage strategy.


About The Team

Clarivate's Medtech Insights team harnesses real-world healthcare data, in-depth interviews, and our unique mix of in-house expertise to help medical device companies make some of their most important business decisions.

The Medtech Insights team, with members located in Canada, India, and Spain, is an essential part of the broader Medtech team's data-driven culture, and regularly contributes its subject matter expertise to other teams within the organization.

Hours of Work

This is a permanent full-time position at 40 hours a week (35 hours during July and August). The position is hybrid going to our office in Barcelona (next to Sagrada Familia) 2-3 times per week.

Benefits


Active volunteering community, with 40 annual paid hours of volunteering time.
Private Health and Life & Disability insurances.
Tax-free benefits (Ticket Restaurant scheme, kindergarten and transport cards).
Language classes (Catalan, Spanish and English).
Global and dynamic employee base (more than 20 nationalities).
30 working days of vacation.


At Clarivate, we are committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all qualified persons with respect to hiring, compensation, promotion, training, and other terms, conditions, and privileges of employment. We comply with applicable laws and regulations governing non-discrimination in all locations.

Title: Service Analyst
Place: Sant Cugat del Vall√®s, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
At Roche you can show up as yourself, embraced for the unique qualities you bring. Our culture encourages personal expression, open dialogue, and genuine connections, where you are valued, accepted and respected for who you are, allowing you to thrive both personally and professionally. This is how we aim to prevent, stop and cure diseases and ensure everyone has access to healthcare today and for generations to come. Join Roche, where every voice matters.

The Position

We invite you to apply for a dynamic role that supports the development and maintenance of Service Analytics, including global dashboards and reports. As a key participant, you will design and implement data visualizations, collaborate with data engineering teams, and enable self-service analytics solutions throughout the organization. Your work will blend diverse data sources to generate actionable insights and maintain high standards for data quality. If you are passionate about data-driven decision-making, fostering collaboration, and mentoring team members, join us to help optimize processes and elevate our analytics capabilities.

Key Challenges

Portfolio Development & Data Insights:


Design, implement, maintain, and promote global dashboards to provide actionable insights
Ensure data visualizations are clear, accurate, and aligned with stakeholder needs
Develop long-term solutions for sustainable maintenance of dashboards
Blend various data sources (Customer Experience feedback, Internal Service KPIs, Commercial data, Market & Competitive data) to compile actionable insights
Conduct exploratory data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and insights


Collaboration & Governance:


Collaborate with data engineering teams to ensure optimal data infrastructure and governance
Support self-service analytics solutions across the organization
Follow, improve, and maintain quality assurance processes for dashboards, reports, and insights
Adhere to the uniform framework for developing and managing data portfolios, ensuring scalability, quality, and ease of use. Seek continuous improvement


Documentation & Training:


Write and own documentation for data insights consumers
Develop training resources for users to effectively utilize data insights
Onboard and mentor interns and junior team members


Teamwork & Mentorship:


Contribute to a collaborative and supportive team environment by sharing knowledge and participating in discussions
Adhere to established best practices in analytics and business partnering, ensuring consistency with organizational standards
Actively seek mentorship from senior team members


Business Partner Support:


Work closely with Business Partners to gather and understand data requirements
Assist Service Analyst Business Partners by providing data-driven insights to stakeholders such as GCS managers, regional leads, and affiliates
Prepare and deliver clear, actionable reports and summaries
Participate in projects from conception to completion, ensuring alignment with business goals and timely delivery of solutions


Continuous Improvement:


Optimize processes to increase quality and efficiency standards


Who you are as our ideal candidate:


Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Business Analytics, Finance, Statistics, or a related field
In the region of 2 years of experience in data analysis, visualization, or a related field (internships or academic projects are acceptable)
Understanding and experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Looker)
Foundational knowledge of SQL and data manipulation (Python or R) is a plus
Good communication skills, with the ability to interact effectively with stakeholders and present data in a clear and actionable manner
Ability to analyze data and translate findings into meaningful insights to support decision-making
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to work collaboratively and effectively in a team environment
Eagerness to learn and develop new skills in service analytics, maybe growing into a Business Partner role, showcasing potential to take on more responsibility and engage directly with stakeholders in the future


Who we are

A healthier future drives us to innovate. Together, more than 100‚Äô000 employees across the globe are dedicated to advance science, ensuring everyone has access to healthcare today and for generations to come. Our efforts result in more than 26 million people treated with our medicines and over 30 billion tests conducted using our Diagnostics products. We empower each other to explore new possibilities, foster creativity, and keep our ambitions high, so we can deliver life-changing healthcare solutions that make a global impact.

Let‚Äôs build a healthier future, together.

Roche is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Title: Insights Analyst
Description:
Something Extraordinary Every Day‚Ñ¢







As our Senior Insights Analyst (Partnerships) you will be driving strategic planning and data analysis to support international market expansion and partnership initiatives




.

This role leverages critical data insights to optimize business strategies, enhance market performance, and understand international traveler behaviour.




About the role

You will collect and conduct comprehensive analysis of international markets to identify growth opportunities and trends
Using advanced data analytics tools, you will enhance decision-making processes within the team and present trends such as ForwardKeys and Global Blue studies
You will analyse global market data to provide actionable insights and recommendations to senior leadership.
Evaluate the impact of emerging trends on consumer behaviour and product or service demand.
Monitor partnership information and data to assess partnerships performance




Role requirements

Education in economics, Business Administration, Marketing, or a related field.
Experience working in a similar environment in particular travel platforms
Minimum 3 years of experience in data analysis, business planning, and partnership management.
Advanced knowledge of data analysis tools and budget management software.
Fluent in Spanish and English




There‚Äôs no one quite like us

The Bicester Collection are the worlds‚Äô leading luxury shopping destinations, and we are committed to creating magical and memorable experiences for our guests. Taking the name of the founding Village, The Bicester Collection distinguishes the 12 Villages in Europe China and US as one collection of destinations for our guests, our brand partners, our travel and tourism partners, our corporate and financial media, and our colleagues.




Come and live your story with us

The key to our success is the talent and commitment of our people. We are diverse in background, age, experience and leadership style. We believe that an inclusive workforce makes magic happen. We have huge ambition for what we can achieve together, and we want to have fun!




In return for your dedication and hard work, you‚Äôll receive a generous salary and along with a competitive benefits package including annual leave, (extra leave on your birthday, if you are getting married or moving) discounts throughout our villages, a very generous employee referral bonus, access to private medical and dental cover, along with many more!

Title: Data Analyst / Engineer
Description:
Join our team as a Data Analyst at AXA Partners Barcelona!

Are you passionate about data analysis and want to be part of the transformation towards a data-driven company?

At AXA Partners, we are on an exciting journey to make data more relevant in strategic decision-making. We are looking for a talented Data Analyst who can actively contribute to our data strategy.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing

As a Data Analyst, you will be a key player in delivering rich and reliable data assets.

Your Responsibilities Will Include


Developing and maintaining advanced analytical systems: Design, test, and deliver data assets that provide valuable insights for decision-making.
Ensuring the quality and sustainability of data assets: Implement quality routines and collaborate with experts to enhance our data platform.
Promoting the use of analytics within your team and the organization: Participate in data analysis projects, supporting the adoption of technologies and best practices.
Collaborating with the Data Analysts community: Share your knowledge and projects, and promote a culture of collaboration.


What You‚Äôll Bring

Profile we are looking for:


Education: Master's degree in Business Intelligence with a specialization in Big Data.
Experience: 3-5 years in a production BI environment, with experience in data warehousing/analytics projects in multicultural organizations.
Technical skills:


Proficiency in BI tools (Power BI, SQL, SSAS, DAX, among others) and best practices in dimensional modeling.

Good understanding of the software development process (git, ci/cd, etc.) and knowledge in Azure DevOps is a plus.

Business Intelligence theory (dimensional modeling: Kimball, star schema, etc., database, data warehousing, datamarts, dimensional and tabular cube, KPI, etc.)


Languages: Fluent in English; French is a plus.
Agile mindset: Ability to work in an international and complex environment, with a focus on creativity and innovation.


To apply, click on the ‚Äòapply for this job‚Äô button, you‚Äôll then need to log in or create a profile to submit your CV. We‚Äôre proud to be an Equal Opportunities Employer and don‚Äôt discriminate against employees or potential employees based on protected characteristics.

Who We Are

We‚Äôre AXA Partners, experts at designing and delivering assistance solutions and specialised insurance, credit, and lifestyle protection - with and for our partners worldwide. What sets us apart? The expertise and passion of our 8,500+ people, and a strong network of over 55,000 professionals all over the world. Powered by them and our sector-leading technology, we continuously evolve, adapt and thrive - offering solutions and services that make sure we‚Äôre always at people‚Äôs side, no matter what. Helping others is our passion. Combining the best digital technology with our warm, human touch, we‚Äôre always looking at new ways to offer seamless and reassuring experiences when it really matters.

Join a company that helps protect the forests! At AXA Partners, we plant a tree for every new recruit (with a permanent contract)

  • Developing and maintaining advanced analytical systems: Design, test, and deliver data assets that provide valuable insights for decision-making.
  • Ensuring the quality and sustainability of data assets: Implement quality routines and collaborate with experts to enhance our data platform.
  • Promoting the use of analytics within your team and the organization: Participate in data analysis projects, supporting the adoption of technologies and best practices.
  • Collaborating with the Data Analysts community: Share your knowledge and projects, and promote a culture of collaboration.

What You‚Äôll Bring

Profile we are looking for:

  • Education: Master's degree in Business Intelligence with a specialization in Big Data.
  • Experience: 3-5 years in a production BI environment, with experience in data warehousing/analytics projects in multicultural organizations.
  • Technical skills:

Proficiency in BI tools (Power BI, SQL, SSAS, DAX, among others) and best practices in dimensional modeling.

Good understanding of the software development process (git, ci/cd, etc.) and knowledge in Azure DevOps is a plus.

Business Intelligence theory (dimensional modeling: Kimball, star schema, etc., database, data warehousing, datamarts, dimensional and tabular cube, KPI, etc.)

  • Languages: Fluent in English; French is a plus.
  • Agile mindset: Ability to work in an international and complex environment, with a focus on creativity and innovation.

To apply, click on the ‚Äòapply for this job‚Äô button, you‚Äôll then need to log in or create a profile to submit your CV. We‚Äôre proud to be an Equal Opportunities Employer and don‚Äôt discriminate against employees or potential employees based on protected characteristics.

Who We Are

We‚Äôre AXA Partners, experts at designing and delivering assistance solutions and specialised insurance, credit, and lifestyle protection - with and for our partners worldwide. What sets us apart? The expertise and passion of our 8,500+ people, and a strong network of over 55,000 professionals all over the world. Powered by them and our sector-leading technology, we continuously evolve, adapt and thrive - offering solutions and services that make sure we‚Äôre always at people‚Äôs side, no matter what. Helping others is our passion. Combining the best digital technology with our warm, human touch, we‚Äôre always looking at new ways to offer seamless and reassuring experiences when it really matters.

Join a company that helps protect the forests! At AXA Partners, we plant a tree for every new recruit (with a permanent contract)

Title: Junior Data Practitioner - hybrid Barcelona/Madrid
Description:
Mission

Aily Labs is rewriting how businesses make decisions. Founded in 2020, we‚Äôre a fast-growing applied AI scaleup operating across Munich, Madrid, Barcelona, New York, and Cluj-Napoca. Our AI-powered mobile app delivers real-time, actionable business insights, empowering enterprises to make smarter, faster decisions and break silos at scale.

We focus on high-impact AI technology -no fluff, no filler - giving users accurate real time decision intelligence.

If you‚Äôre ready to shape the future of AI decision-making and work at the intersection of innovation and impact, join us.

Your profile

Key Responsibilities

If You Have a Passion For Data And Technology And Want To Join a Crew Of Sharp Analytical Minds And Data Enthusiasts, Then This May Be The Right Opportunity For You. As a Data Practitioner, You Will Take Part Of The Following Tasks


Develop high quality data models in SQL to support our applications
Create well-defined, performant, and documented DBT model
Design, build, and launch new data models and data pipelines.
Implement best practices in data engineering, including data integrity, validation, reliability, and documentation, while improving data discoverability
Optimize database design for performance
Develop automated data pipelines in AWS (Lambdas, Glue, EKS)
Design and build new ways on ingesting and providing data (API, 3rd party integrations).
Implement muti-tenant data architecture systems
Build relationships with Data Scientists, Product Managers, and Software Engineers to understand data needs


Qualifications/ Experience


1+ year of relevant Data working experience
Coding skills in Python and SQL
Knowledge of Data tooling (Airflow, DBT, S3, RDS, ‚Ä¶)
Ability to build workflows in Airflow with operators, dependencies, and error handling. Implements proper scheduling and triggering conditions.
Understanding of and ability to follow data design principles
Good understanding of GIT (branching, merging and rebase)
Ability to communicate complex concepts concisely and clearly
Able to work autonomously with agility
Strong, concise communication skills


About Us

LEARN MORE

What sets us apart?

What We Offer


A flexible working culture: Work from home and vibrant hubs in Barcelona or Madrid.
Cutting-edge tools: A MacBook Pro (M2, 16GB) to maximize your productivity.
Collaborative team: Join an internationally diverse group that thrives on creativity and support.
Growth opportunities: Participate in bootcamps, knowledge-sharing events, and training tailored to your aspirations.

Title: Data Analyst EMEA, Retail Media
Description:
What You'll Do:

The Retail Media EMEA Analytics team, part of the rapidly expanding Criteo Retail Media business, leverages our grand set of shopper data to design and develop actionable insights for our Retailer and Brand clients. We bring the analytical perspective onto the business and provide recommendations based on high quality data analysis and strong understanding of our industry and products. We leverage our unique position to provide our commercial teams and clients with visibility into shopper behavior, market trends and product performance that can't be found anywhere else.

Criteo‚Äôs high-growth business model brings both opportunities and challenges. This position requires working with large sets of data and a variety of stakeholders to solve complex business problems by thinking strategically and proposing innovative solutions. The ideal candidate functions with minimal oversight and has the ability to learn new concepts quickly.


Mine massive data sets and turn them into understandable and actionable insights
Build scalable analytic solutions using state of the art tools of Criteo analytics stack (Hadoop, Vertica, PySpark‚Ä¶)
Develop innovative analytical approaches to measure Brands & Retailers‚Äô performance from design to presentation of results, leveraging all our expertise in Data Science (statistical thinking, A/B testing, bootstrapping, data visualization‚Ä¶)
Frequently interact with other teams (R&D, product, commercial teams‚Ä¶) and clients to share data-driven recommendations and insights
Develop and maintain deep knowledge of Criteo Retail Media products and technologies as they evolve



Who You Are:

You are passionate about data and want to work with leading edge technologies in online industry:


You have at least 2 years‚Äô experience in Data Science or Data Analytics
A Master‚Äôs degree or higher in a quantitative field (Engineering, Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics, etc.) is preferred, but equivalent practical experience will also be considered.
Fluency in the core toolkit of Data Science/Data Analytics: SQL is required, Python is a real asset (master most common data libraries: pandas, numpy‚Ä¶)
Outstanding analytical skills: passion for translating data-speak into relevant, compelling stories
A background in the digital industry or consulting is a plus
You have the combination of technical skills, passion for learning, and the soft skills to work with all personality types in a dynamic environment
You are fluent in English



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we‚Äôd love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world‚Äôs marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

  • Develop and maintain deep knowledge of Criteo Retail Media products and technologies as they evolve


Who You Are:

You are passionate about data and want to work with leading edge technologies in online industry:

  • You have at least 2 years‚Äô experience in Data Science or Data Analytics
  • A Master‚Äôs degree or higher in a quantitative field (Engineering, Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics, etc.) is preferred, but equivalent practical experience will also be considered.
  • Fluency in the core toolkit of Data Science/Data Analytics: SQL is required, Python is a real asset (master most common data libraries: pandas, numpy‚Ä¶)
  • Outstanding analytical skills: passion for translating data-speak into relevant, compelling stories
  • A background in the digital industry or consulting is a plus
  • You have the combination of technical skills, passion for learning, and the soft skills to work with all personality types in a dynamic environment
  • You are fluent in English


We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we‚Äôd love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world‚Äôs marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

Title: Statistical Analyst
Description:

Somos una compa√±√≠a especializada que act√∫a como CRO en el estudio del microbioma. Aplicamos la metagen√≥mica de forma innovadora para responder a preguntas nuevas y tradicionales. La responsabilidad principal de la persona seleccionada ser√° realizar y asesorar en los an√°lisis estad√≠sticos realizados en el departamento. Tambi√©n centrar√° parte de su labor en:




Ejecuci√≥n, desarrollo y mantenimiento de pipelines para el an√°lisis de datos de Next Generation Sequencing (NGS).
An√°lisis e interpretaci√≥n de resultados, identificaci√≥n de incidencias t√©cnicas y propuesta de mejoras en procesos.
Participar en reuniones de entrega de proyectos asignados con clientes y proporcionar seguimiento t√©cnico seg√∫n sus necesidades. ¬†
Mantenimiento de bases de datos gen√≥micas, metagen√≥micas y transcript√≥micas.
Participaci√≥n activa en los proyectos de I+D+i que se realicen dentro de la empresa.




Requisitos




Formaci√≥n en Bioinform√°tica o disciplinas afines (grado en Bioinform√°tica, Estad√≠stica, Matem√°ticas, Biolog√≠a o Inform√°tica). Se valorar√° la realizaci√≥n de M√°ster en Bioinform√°tica, en Bioestad√≠stica o formaci√≥n espec√≠fica en estad√≠stica.
Experiencia acreditable de m√≠nimo 1 a√±o en bioinform√°tica, preferentemente en an√°lisis estad√≠sticos aplicados a gen√≥mica, metagen√≥mica, transcript√≥mica o similares.
Se requieren habilidades de programaci√≥n en R, Bash, Python o lenguajes relacionados. Se valorar√°n positivamente presentar conocimientos en administraci√≥n de sistemas, desarrollo y mantenimiento de bases de datos, an√°lisis metagen√≥micos, transcript√≥micos y machine learning.
Se requiere nivel alto de ingl√©s y castellano, hablado y escrito. Se valorar√° positivamente conocimiento del catal√°n.
Alta orientaci√≥n al detalle, cumplimiento de procedimientos y control de calidad.
Capacidad para adaptarse a entornos din√°micos, tomar decisiones y resolver incidencias con autonom√≠a.
Habilidades de comunicaci√≥n efectiva, tanto con el equipo como con otros departamentos y clientes.




Condiciones laborales




Trabajo presencial en nuestras oficinas de Barcelona con horario de 9h a 18h (L-V).
Salario acorde con las capacidades de la candidatura.
Integraci√≥n en una compa√±√≠a que se encuentra en pleno periodo de expansi√≥n, proporcionando un marco excelente para el desarrollo profesional.




Las candidaturas interesadas deben enviar una carta de presentaci√≥n, su CV y 2 referencias laborales anteriores (antes del 30 de Mayo), al correo job.offers@microomics.com indicando en el asunto ‚ÄòStatistical Analyst‚Äô.

Title: Checkout Data Analyst
Description:
As you contemplate your future, you might be asking yourself, what's the next step? Start your journey with us!

We're seeking a Tech Data Analyst to join our Checkout team in Barcelona (hybrid). If you're ready to soar, we're ready to take you there.

Why eDreams ODIGEO

Join the world's leading travel subscription platform and one of the largest e-commerce businesses in Europe.

Millions of customers every year across 44 markets ‚Äì 5 brands ‚Äì 7M members in Prime

More than 100 million searches per day - Up to 6 billion daily AI predictions[e1]

Over 1,600 employees ‚Äì More than 60 different nationalities from all continents ‚Äì 99% permanent contracts - 36 average age

We're the world‚Äôs leading travel subscription platform and one of the largest e-commerce businesses in Europe. We are a tech company revolutionising the travel booking experience through our consumer insight, innovative technology, market leadership, and Prime, the world's first travel subscription program.

What You Will Do

The Role's Key Responsibilities and Tasks


Build the infrastructure required for the extraction, transformation and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources.
Assemble large and complex datasets, with an optimal data pipeline architecture, meeting business requirements.
Implement processes to monitor data quality, ensuring production data is always accurate and available for key stakeholders and business processes that depend on it.
Create alerts and dashboards to contribute to the monitoring and tracking of our business KPIs.
Identify, design and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimising queries, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc.
Collaborate with analytics and business teams to improve data models that feed existing reports or create brand new reports with the aim to increase data accessibility and foster data-driven decision making across the organisation.
Contribute to the delivery of strategic projects by participating in the delivery of key initiatives, giving support to the analytics and business teams when it comes to data availability and visualisation to ensure progress and effective delivery of the desired outcomes. Work together with stakeholders in the execution of the projects.



What you need to succeed:

Good to have


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a quantitative discipline (Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, etc.).
Experience building and optimising data pipelines, data sets and workflow management tools (e.g. Airflow).
Advance knowledge of SQL is a requirement as well as experience working with databases and large sets of data; Python programming skills are also required as well as experience in data visualisation or exploration tools such as Looker Studio.
Advanced Office skills. Strong experience with analytical tools, ideally with Microsoft and Google Office package (Excel, etc.).
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with high attention to detail.
Strong organisational and communication skills.
Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment.
A self-starter and team player, who also enjoys having fun!
Business Proficiency in English.



What‚Äôs In It For You

The best talent deserves the best benefits

At eDO, we want you to be a part of our success story and great culture. Here's what we offer:


A rewarding Compensation package! üí• Prime Plus membership, Competitive salary and benefits package, including flexible benefits, performance-based bonuses, birthday day off, discounts and partnerships, relocation support and the possibility of choosing your equipment and, even better, keeping it for free after 3 years.
Continuous learning to fuel your growth and explore new horizons! üìö Learn and grow with free Coursera access, soft skills workshops, tech training, leadership development, and more. Plus, enjoy a great onboarding program.
Grow opportunities to empower your career, and unleash your potential! üöÄ Personalised career paths and the eVOLVE Program will help you discover, grow, and thrive. Internal mobility opportunities let you pursue horizontal career changes and promotions.
Your Well-being is our Priority. Embrace Freedom and Flexibility! üíô At eDO, we value flexibility, employee care, and transparency. We offer a hybrid home-office model focused on outcome, not time-in-seat. You'll be able to find the right work-personal life balance that suits you best.
Work hard, party hard! We believe in having fun and connecting with colleagues! üéâ Join eDO for after-work events, padel tournaments, parties, and more. Create communities based on your passions, like sports and music. Come to work as you are, with no dress code, and enjoy free fruit, coffee, and tea at our offices.
Enjoy a dynamic and healthy environment! üí´ Be innovative, take risks, and share your ideas. Our diverse and open-minded teams support high performance, learning, and growth. You'll work in an Agile Mindset environment with recognition at our core.



Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at eDO? Follow us on LinkedIn and discover more about life at eDO!

If you are ready for a career opportunity with unmatched benefits, continuous learning, and a supportive work-life balance, look no further! Take your career to new destinations by applying now and help our diverse, inclusive, and passionate team shape the future of travel. Apply now!

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status. Our people are the key to our success. Each one of them is unique in their own way and the respect for their uniqueness is and will always be a passion and motivation.

Create communities based on your passions, like sports and music. Come to work as you are, with no dress code, and enjoy free fruit, coffee, and tea at our offices.

If you are ready for a career opportunity with unmatched benefits, continuous learning, and a supportive work-life balance, look no further! Take your career to new destinations by applying now and help our diverse, inclusive, and passionate team shape the future of travel. Apply now!

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status. Our people are the key to our success. Each one of them is unique in their own way and the respect for their uniqueness is and will always be a passion and motivation.

Title: Senior Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Since 1890, all around the globe, employees in Allianz have been working hard to secure people‚Äôs lives and to give courage to our customers for what‚Äôs ahead. We are actuaries, advisors and service agents; engineers, lawyers and technology experts; we are daughters and sons, mothers and fathers, accountants, investors and entrepreneurs ‚Äì and together we are shaping our industry.

Because we know how important it is to have a fair partner at your side who provides solid and sustainable solutions, we strive to do it right ‚Äì with passion, every day. Allianz Technology enables Allianz Group to live up to its purpose, by providing powerful, standardized global platforms to provide efficiencies, savings and scalability for the long-term success of Allianz.

About The Job

As a key member of the People Analytics team, you will leverage your expertise in Data Analytics to drive automation and develop innovative data products that empower Allianz Technology teams globally. Collaborating closely with colleagues in Germany, Romania, and India, you will ensure high-quality data is readily available to support autonomous, data-driven decision-making across Allianz Technology.

Your role involves compiling and consolidating diverse data sets to deliver actionable insights to the People Leadership teams and the broader business. You will engage with global and local business stakeholders to define requirements for data definitions and analytics, ensuring alignment with Allianz Technology's strategic priorities.

Your focus will be on enhancing the efficiency of the global reporting landscape through automation, enabling teams to independently access and utilize People analytics data. Additionally, you will contribute your analytical expertise to Allianz Group initiatives and projects, collaborating with Allianz Technology People function Product Owners, Business Partners, IT functions, service providers, and the Allianz Group‚Äôs global People & Culture function to drive data innovation and autonomy.

What You Do


Partner with various entities, People & Culture Leadership, and business leaders to define critical People & Culture data needs and drive a data-driven culture for strategic decision-making.
Define and standardize key People metrics, KPIs, and benchmarks to measure workforce effectiveness, transforming these into robust data products and developing AI-driven analytics solutions for enhanced decision-making.
Collaborate with IT and HRIS teams to optimize People data infrastructure, ensuring data integrity, security, and compliance with regulations like GDPR and CCPA, while driving automation and self-service analytics capabilities.
Design advanced People Analytics solutions to predict turnover, enhance employee engagement, and drive DEI strategies, utilizing NLP and sentiment analysis for employee feedback and local compensation analytics for pay equity.
Provide expert guidance to People Data Analysts to enhance skills, facilitate collaboration between People & Culture, IT, Finance, and business units, and share best practices for reporting and insights communication.
Advocate for the development and utilization of data products to streamline processes, enhance data-driven decision-making, and ensure alignment on organizational streamlining activities and data initiatives.
Be an active member of the global Analytics team, taking ownership of topics and being a thought leader to elevate the team's proficiency and impact.


What You Bring


7+ years of experience in People analytics, workforce planning, or related fields, preferably in an international environment, with proficiency in data analytics languages such as SQL and Python.
Expert user of leading data visualization tools, ideally Power BI, with experience in data modeling and exposure to predictive modeling, machine learning, and AI-driven analytics.
Strong understanding of People metrics, compensation analytics, and talent management KPIs, with a proven track record in fostering a data-driven culture.
Strong communication skills to translate complex data into actionable business insights and engage effectively with stakeholders in virtual teams across various continents and cultures.
Ability to work independently, demonstrating good self-organization, prioritization, and time management skills while maintaining quality levels in reporting and meeting deadlines.
Good assertiveness, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills, with a customer-service-oriented, hands-on mentality and high attention to detail.
Fluent in both spoken and written English, with methodological and conceptual skills, and analytical thinking; other languages are an advantage.


What We Offer


We offer a hybrid work model which recognizes the value of striking a balance between in-person collaboration and remote working incl. up to 25 days per year working from abroad.
We believe in rewarding performance and our compensation and benefits package includes a company bonus scheme, pension, employee shares program and multiple employee discounts (details vary by location).
From career development and digital learning programs to international career mobility, we offer lifelong learning for our employees worldwide and an environment where innovation, delivery and empowerment are fostered.
Flexible working, health and wellbeing offers (including healthcare and parental leave benefits) support to balance family and career and help our people return from career breaks with experience that nothing else can teach.


About Allianz Technology

With its headquarters in Munich, Germany, Allianz Technology is Allianz's global IT service provider and delivers IT solutions that drive the group's digitalization. With more than 11,000 employees in over 20 countries around the world, Allianz Technology is tasked to run, optimize, transform, and innovate the infrastructure, applications, and services together with Allianz companies to co-create the best customer experience.

We service the entire spectrum of digitalization ‚Äì from one of the industry's largest IT infrastructure projects that spans data centres, networks, and security, to application platforms ranging from workplace services to digital interaction.

In short: We deliver comprehensive end-to-end IT solutions for Allianz in the digital age. We are the backbone of Allianz.

Find us at: www.linkedin.com/company/allianz-technology .

D&I statement

Allianz Technology is proud to be an equal opportunity employer that embraces diversity and commits itself to creating an inclusive work environment for all.

We therefore welcome applications regardless of race, ethnicity or cultural background, age, gender, nationality, religion, social class, disability or sexual orientation, or any other characteristics protected under applicable local laws and regulations.

Join us. Let¬¥s care for tomorrow.

You. IT.

To Recruitment Agencies:

Allianz Technology has an in-house recruitment team that sources great candidates directly. Therefore, Allianz Technology does not accept unsolicited resumes from agencies or search firm recruiters.

When we do work with recruitment agencies, that engagement is formalized by a contract. Fees will only be paid when there is a contract in place. Without a contract in place, we will not accept invoices on unsolicited resumes, even if the candidate was ultimately employed by Allianz.

72609 | Data & Analytics | Professional | Non-Executive | Allianz Technology | Full-Time | Permanent

  • Collaborate with IT and HRIS teams to optimize People data infrastructure, ensuring data integrity, security, and compliance with regulations like GDPR and CCPA, while driving automation and self-service analytics capabilities.
  • Design advanced People Analytics solutions to predict turnover, enhance employee engagement, and drive DEI strategies, utilizing NLP and sentiment analysis for employee feedback and local compensation analytics for pay equity.
  • Provide expert guidance to People Data Analysts to enhance skills, facilitate collaboration between People & Culture, IT, Finance, and business units, and share best practices for reporting and insights communication.
  • Advocate for the development and utilization of data products to streamline processes, enhance data-driven decision-making, and ensure alignment on organizational streamlining activities and data initiatives.
  • Be an active member of the global Analytics team, taking ownership of topics and being a thought leader to elevate the team's proficiency and impact.

What You Bring

  • 7+ years of experience in People analytics, workforce planning, or related fields, preferably in an international environment, with proficiency in data analytics languages such as SQL and Python.
  • Expert user of leading data visualization tools, ideally Power BI, with experience in data modeling and exposure to predictive modeling, machine learning, and AI-driven analytics.
  • Strong understanding of People metrics, compensation analytics, and talent management KPIs, with a proven track record in fostering a data-driven culture.
  • Strong communication skills to translate complex data into actionable business insights and engage effectively with stakeholders in virtual teams across various continents and cultures.
  • Ability to work independently, demonstrating good self-organization, prioritization, and time management skills while maintaining quality levels in reporting and meeting deadlines.
  • Good assertiveness, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills, with a customer-service-oriented, hands-on mentality and high attention to detail.
  • Fluent in both spoken and written English, with methodological and conceptual skills, and analytical thinking; other languages are an advantage.

What We Offer

  • We offer a hybrid work model which recognizes the value of striking a balance between in-person collaboration and remote working incl. up to 25 days per year working from abroad.
  • We believe in rewarding performance and our compensation and benefits package includes a company bonus scheme, pension, employee shares program and multiple employee discounts (details vary by location).
  • From career development and digital learning programs to international career mobility, we offer lifelong learning for our employees worldwide and an environment where innovation, delivery and empowerment are fostered.
  • Flexible working, health and wellbeing offers (including healthcare and parental leave benefits) support to balance family and career and help our people return from career breaks with experience that nothing else can teach.

About Allianz Technology

With its headquarters in Munich, Germany, Allianz Technology is Allianz's global IT service provider and delivers IT solutions that drive the group's digitalization. With more than 11,000 employees in over 20 countries around the world, Allianz Technology is tasked to run, optimize, transform, and innovate the infrastructure, applications, and services together with Allianz companies to co-create the best customer experience.

We service the entire spectrum of digitalization ‚Äì from one of the industry's largest IT infrastructure projects that spans data centres, networks, and security, to application platforms ranging from workplace services to digital interaction.

In short: We deliver comprehensive end-to-end IT solutions for Allianz in the digital age. We are the backbone of Allianz.

Find us at: www.linkedin.com/company/allianz-technology .

D&I statement

Allianz Technology is proud to be an equal opportunity employer that embraces diversity and commits itself to creating an inclusive work environment for all.

We therefore welcome applications regardless of race, ethnicity or cultural background, age, gender, nationality, religion, social class, disability or sexual orientation, or any other characteristics protected under applicable local laws and regulations.

Join us. Let¬¥s care for tomorrow.

You. IT.

To Recruitment Agencies:

Allianz Technology has an in-house recruitment team that sources great candidates directly. Therefore, Allianz Technology does not accept unsolicited resumes from agencies or search firm recruiters.

When we do work with recruitment agencies, that engagement is formalized by a contract. Fees will only be paid when there is a contract in place. Without a contract in place, we will not accept invoices on unsolicited resumes, even if the candidate was ultimately employed by Allianz.

Title: Sourcing Data Analyst Internship
Description:
Duration: Minimum 12 months

Location: Barcelona (Poblenou)

**Please submit your CV and cover letter in English**

Company Overview:

NSI is a leading player in the natural food industry committed to delivering high-quality, sustainable, and ethically sourced products to our customers. We are seeking a dynamic and detail-oriented Sourcing Data Analyst to join our team and play a pivotal role in enhancing our sourcing and procurement processes.

Responsibilities:

Import/Export Data and Market Analysis:


Analyze import/export data of key commodities in the natural food industry.
Monitor market prices, trends, and fluctuations to provide valuable insights to the sourcing team.


Supplier Database Management:


Create, populate, and manage a comprehensive supplier database.
Gather and update key information on suppliers obtained from various sources, ensuring accuracy and relevance.


Sourcing And Procurement KPIs Analysis:


Generate and analyze sourcing and procurement Key Performance Indicators (KPIs).
Provide regular reports and insights to optimize sourcing strategies.


Pricing Database Management:


Develop and manage a pricing database, recording daily prices received from suppliers.
Ensure data accuracy and use insights to negotiate favorable pricing agreements.


Global Calendar Creation:


Create a global calendar for each commodity, detailing seasonality, main producing countries, acres grown, production estimates, etc.
Provide timely information to support strategic decision-making in sourcing.


Sourcing App Development:


Design and implement a sourcing app to streamline data collection during Trade Shows.
Automate the upload of supplier data to the central database for seamless integration.


ERP Support For Contract Management:


Support the sourcing team in contract creation and management within the Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) system.


AI Integration:


Drive the integration of Artificial Intelligence (AI) tools in the sourcing department.
Explore AI applications for vendor onboarding, forecasting, price changes, and identifying potential crop disruptions.


The Ideal Candidate Will Have:


Proven experience in data analysis, preferably in the natural food industry.
Proficiency in data visualization tools and techniques.
Knowledge of sourcing and procurement processes.
Experience with ERP systems and contract management.
Familiarity with AI and machine learning concepts is a plus.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.


Required Education And Experience:


Master‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Business, Supply Chain Management, or related field. GAP year students will not be considered.
Must have professional proficiency in English (oral and written)


Work Environment:


Hybrid work schedule with at least three (3) days per week in-office. Location in Barcelona is a must.
Candidates must be flexible in regards to their schedule to accommodate working with an international team


Company Overview:

NSI is a leading player in the natural private label food industry, dedicated to providing high-quality, organic, and sustainably sourced food products to consumers. We believe in promoting healthy and conscious eating choices, and our range of products reflects our commitment to quality and sustainability. As we continue to grow and expand our market presence, we are seeking an experienced and dynamic Sourcing Data Analyst Intern to join our team and drive the creation of exciting, nutritious, and eco-friendly products.

Title: Master Data Analyst
Description:
Global Master Data Analyst

Global Master Data Analyst would be part of a team, in charge of code creation process, running enrichment processes and maintenance of master data for Coty worldwide on a global SAP platform.

Responsibilities

You would be responsible for ensuring that the Material Master Data is created on time and accurate as per briefing from Marketing/Initiative Leader. You are following the Global Data Standards provided by our Data Governance Team and contributing to adjust them to changing needs. As Coty‚Äôs growth builds on constant new product developments, this position plays a key role delivering ‚ÄúData Readiness‚Äù during different stages of the Innovation and leading the work across.

Your main focus:


Deliver Key Performance Indicators, making sure to reach the Service Level Agreement targets.
Understanding of the product creation cycles and basic data, whilst understanding the business impacts.
Identify systemic errors and trend analysis, being able to root cause, sharing a clear issue statement.
Tracking all new project status, with direct contact and communication across different workstreams, to guarantee the visibility and status of data readiness in SAP for all new initiative in the scope, giving priority based on business requirements.
Follow up with departments involved with Master Data functionality reporting clear issue statement, tackling business needs with clarity and structure.


Working for Coty means being part of one of the largest beauty companies with an iconic portfolio of brands across fragrance, color cosmetics, skin care and body care. We are a global leader in fragrance and number three in color cosmetics and our products are sold in over 150 countries around the world. COTY and its brands are committed to a range of social causes, embraces diversity as well as seeking to minimize its impact on the environment. You can work in a truly international and dynamic work environment, in a culture based on trust and cooperation with opportunities of continues improvement and learning with the freedom to be yourself.

The team consists today of five Master Data Analyst. You will work closely together with several departments such as Master Data Governance, Initiative leaders, Marketing, Planning, R&D, Quality and IT. All your colleagues are dedicated experts and ready to drive Coty to the next level. Working with a team environment with can do attitude, optimistic, focus on finding solutions. The team has a continuous improvement mindset, committed to resolving upcoming challenges and opportunities, to make processes more efficient. Master data community main characteristics are team spirit, collaboration and working together cohesively toward common goals. They willingly share knowledge and resources, help when needed, and celebrate each other's successes.

YOU ARE A COTY FIT

You like to focus on the results and be able to react to the business‚Äôs need with sensibility. As a/an experienced Master Data Analyst, you collaborate and work together with other teams, and you get energy from working in a fast-paced, diverse, and international environment.

Other than that, you:


Bachelor‚Äôs degree (Engineering, BA and/or similar academic background).
Good technical skills in Excel and SAP. Knowledge in Microsoft Access, Visual Basic will be considered.
Root Cause Analysis (RCA) mentality, with ability to propose and deliver improvements.
Team Player mindset.
Strong sense of individual accountability ‚Äì personal drive to improve and passionate ownership of performance.
Autonomous motivation to implement changes and challenge the current process / system to deliver improved results.
Good English level and communication skills.


Our Benefits

As our Master Data Analyst some of the benefits you will receive are:


A salary that matches your knowledge and experience
Omni-Working: Hybrid flexible working model enabling employees to balance remote and office-based work and promote work / life balance.
Flexible working hours
Meal voucher
Medical & Physiotherapy Service


RECRUITMENT PROCESS


A telephone/online introductory meeting.
A first online/in-person interview
A second interview
You will receive a proposal with the terms of employment.


About Coty

Coty is one of the world‚Äôs largest beauty companies with an iconic portfolio of brands across fragrance, color cosmetics, skincare, and body care. At Coty, we celebrate the entire human kaleidoscope and cultivate a culture of fearless kindness. Therefore, we are proud to be an equal opportunities employer. We do not discriminate against any candidate or employee and strive to be an open, inclusive and diverse workplace where all employees can be their authentic self. Join us in making over the world of beauty!

Buscamos un perfil din√°mico que aporte de 2 a 3 a√±os de experiencia en √°reas anal√≠ticas preferiblemente con foco comercial y en √°reas financieras o de riesgos. El candidato ideal ser√° proactivo, anal√≠tico y colaborativo, con una destacada capacidad de comunicaci√≥n y una visi√≥n cr√≠tica que le permita contribuir eficazmente al desarrollo de la organizaci√≥n.

Hablemos del proyecto...

El objetivo fundamental de este puesto es liderar el an√°lisis y reporting de la red, asegurando una fluida transmisi√≥n de informaci√≥n y desarrollando estrat√©gicas que impulsen el rendimiento comercial.

Responsabilidades Principales:

  • An√°lisis Avanzados y Benchmarks: Realizar an√°lisis detallados y comparativos seg√∫n las necesidades del negocio (analizar el resultado de las campa√±as y c√≥mo mejorarlas,..).
  • Generaci√≥n de Reportes Comerciales: Elaborar reportes mensuales para la direcci√≥n y la red, proporcionando informaci√≥n clave para la toma de decisiones.
  • Colaboraci√≥n en Proyectos Transversales: Participar activamente en iniciativas interdepartamentales que contribuyan al logro de los objetivos organizacionales.
  • Apoyar de Sistem√°tica y Formaci√≥n: Establecer metodolog√≠as de trabajo y llevar a cabo formaciones que fortalezcan las competencias del equipo (identificar y difundir buenas pr√°cticas comerciales,‚Ä¶).

Trabajar√°s en estrecha colaboraci√≥n con el Director de Inteligencia de Negocio y Directores Comerciales, interactuando con diversos departamentos del banco para fomentar un ambiente de colaboraci√≥n y sinergia.

La compa√±√≠a se encuentra en un proceso de transformaci√≥n y gran crecimiento, lo que convierte a este puesto en un elemento clave para asegurar una transici√≥n exitosa y el alineamiento de la red con los objetivos estrat√©gicos de la organizaci√≥n.

  • Experto en Excel y PowerPoint.

  • Apreciamos la formaci√≥n complementaria (m√°ster o postgrado) relacionada, as√≠ como un buen nivel de ingl√©s y conocimientos financieros.

Title: Data Analyst Junior - Transportation Analyst, Central Operations Services
Description:
Description

The EU External Fulfilment (EF) network consists of circa 35 operations which offer flexible solutions to the CF network operated by external providers (3PL providers). EU EF primarily provides: (1) network capacity solutions (storage/throughput), (2) special operation solutions (Hazmat, BWS, IXD, Relo, LCS, Kariba, Tyres, etc) and (3) emerging market penetration solutions. EU EF is currently undergoing an operational transformation, driving demand for enhanced expertise in inbound (IB) and outbound (OB) process paths.

The goal of EU 3PL Control Tower is to provide an excellent operational end to end 24/7 support in 3PL buildings across European External Fulfilment chain. We aim to provide the standardized and optimized process with frustration free communication. This role is for a highly driven and motivated individual with operational experience and innovative, hands-on approach.

This position involves the daily operational tasks resolutions and day to day communication with 3PL and Amazon team of problem solvers and node managers on their KPIs management. The successful candidate will be responsible for group of tasks involving KPI monitoring, solving system issues and analyzing process standards execution. This person has a strong delivery record, attention to details and will be able to work independently with limited supervision.

This job involves 3PL operations monitoring and ops support on 24/7 shift patter for 30+ buildings in Europe.

As EU 3PL Control Tower Specialist you will support Outbound 3PL operations, drive the continuous improvement and process standardization and optimization. You will conduct weekly process analysis that will drive to process waste reduction.

Please note that this is a day shift role, working from 6 am to 14 pm.

Key job responsibilities


Monitoring and analyzing sites hourly performance
Providing the operational guidance to 3PL
Resolving system discrepancies
Being a communication bridge between 3PL and Amazon stakeholders
Mitigating CX risk by CPT management support, resolving OB errors and managing shipment cancellations
Uploading critical data for supply chain and transportation visibility
Checking process and Amazon standard compliance
Supporting with AFTx launches and migration with SME expertise, implementing required tasks for further operational support
Optimization of actual Control Tower Outbound processes, aiming to automatize the actual tasks of the team, applying BI skills.


Basic Qualifications


- Relevant experience working with the MS Office suite (Word, Excel, Outlook)
- B2/C1 English level
- Spanish C2 level


Preferred Qualifications


High school or equivalent diploma
Expertise in data analysis tools such as SQL, Python, Power BI, AI, etc.
Experience in logistics.


Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you‚Äôre applying in isn‚Äôt listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

Title: Junior Data Analyst - Commercial Strategy (They/She/He)
Description:
If you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We‚Äôll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 23 countries.

Together we revolutionise the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

ü§ù Our culture and strong values.

üí™ Our career development philosophy.

ü§ù Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: Building the largest marketplace in your city, to give access to anything in minutes. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

You will be in charge of providing data for the main partner strategies of the Account Management team. Through analytics, you will be globally identifying and improving the experience of the customer in Glovo. You will be a direct contributor to key company initiatives, taking full ownership of data analysis and insight generation, automating data generation together with our Data teams, and driving reporting enhancements, while you will also contribute with recommendations to the initiatives you are part of for global implementation.

THE JOURNEY


Develop and apply analytical frameworks to evaluate partner performance across multiple countries.
Analyze partner behavior and lifecycle patterns and perform root-cause analysis to identify drivers of performance.
Build and run ad-hoc SQL queries to extract relevant data, prepare structured datasets, and support fast-turnaround analyses.
Automate recurring reports and build dashboards or ad-hoc reports to enable self-service access to key commercial metrics.
Calculate and track strategic KPIs such as retention and lifecycle targets, tailored by country and partner segment.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams (e.g., BI, commercial, data managers) to define analytical priorities, validate insights, and align on actions.
Lead the discovery phase of new analytical topics, shaping hypotheses, structuring analysis, and translating data into clear, actionable insights.


What You Will Bring To The Ride


A degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field.
1‚Äì2 years of experience turning data into actionable insights to support internal decision-making.
Strong analytical skills and solid command of SQL and Excel. Experience with BI tools (e.g., Looker, Tableau, Power BI) is a must.
Experience with Python and analytical libraries (Pandas, SciPy, Scikit-learn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks) or R is highly valued.
A strategic mindset with a deep understanding of business impact and prioritization.
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to turn complex data into clear recommendations.
Strong organizational and multitasking abilities‚Äîyou thrive in fast-paced environments and are comfortable managing several projects simultaneously.
A bias for action: you move fast, take ownership, and get things done with a hands-on attitude.
Team spirit and adaptability‚Äîyou collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and communicate clearly.
Professional level of English (written and spoken).


Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves


üåü An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
üí™ Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
üí≥ Discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
üèä Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
üë™ Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

Title: Logistics Data Analyst (They/She/He)
Description:
If you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We‚Äôll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 25 countries.

Together we revolutionize the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

ü§ù Our culture and strong values.

üí™ Our career development philosophy.

ü§ù Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

Support the optimization of logistics features, with a focus on delivery areas and supply/demand imbalances, by maintaining and improving settings, quantifying their impact, providing data-driven insights, coordinating feature rollouts, and measuring their effectiveness.

THE JOURNEY


Work closely with local/regional stakeholders, product teams and development teams, serving as a bridge between product and operations, to define how to best set up and enable products, monitor and give visibility of metrics and KPIs.
Deep-dive on business metrics, in order to explore areas of opportunity and enable data-driven decision-making, based on applied statistics and probability techniques
Develop and maintain scalable and self-service visualization tools and storytelling dashboards.
Build optimization processes to define the best tuning of every feature on each geography.
Build robust relationships with stakeholders acting as a strategic and supportive link between the technology, business and product.
Support recurrent processes within the team, enabling the adjustment of tools to business needs
Continuously explore and refine key operational metrics (delivery time, efficiency, costs), gaining a comprehensive understanding of Glovo‚Äôs logistics.


What You Will Bring To The Ride


1-3 years of professional experience outside of an academic and internship setting, in a quantitative analysis role
Excellent SQL and Excel/GoogleSheet skills
Solid proficiency in statistical programming (Python/R) and experience working with popular tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R Markdown.
Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau, Looker, PowerBI, ...
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
Great spoken and written English.


Individuals representing diverse profiles, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas.
