Together we revolutionize the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

ü§ù Our culture and strong values.

üí™ Our career development philosophy.

ü§ù Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

Support the optimization of logistics features, with a focus on delivery areas and supply/demand imbalances, by maintaining and improving settings, quantifying their impact, providing data-driven insights, coordinating feature rollouts, and measuring their effectiveness.

THE JOURNEY

  • Work closely with local/regional stakeholders, product teams and development teams, serving as a bridge between product and operations, to define how to best set up and enable products, monitor and give visibility of metrics and KPIs.
  • Deep-dive on business metrics, in order to explore areas of opportunity and enable data-driven decision-making, based on applied statistics and probability techniques
  • Develop and maintain scalable and self-service visualization tools and storytelling dashboards.
  • Build optimization processes to define the best tuning of every feature on each geography.
  • Build robust relationships with stakeholders acting as a strategic and supportive link between the technology, business and product.
  • Support recurrent processes within the team, enabling the adjustment of tools to business needs
  • Continuously explore and refine key operational metrics (delivery time, efficiency, costs), gaining a comprehensive understanding of Glovo‚Äôs logistics.

What You Will Bring To The Ride

  • 1-3 years of professional experience outside of an academic and internship setting, in a quantitative analysis role
  • Excellent SQL and Excel/GoogleSheet skills
  • Solid proficiency in statistical programming (Python/R) and experience working with popular tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R Markdown.
  • Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau, Looker, PowerBI, ...
  • Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
  • Great spoken and written English.

Individuals representing diverse profiles, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable

  • üí™ Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
  • üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
  • üí≥ Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
  • üèä Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
  • üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
  • üë™ Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
  • üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.

Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

Title: Data Analyst Senior
Description:
As a Data Analyst Senior, you are in charge of building SQL, Qlik and PowerBI data models to support key business decisions. You will collaborate with our product owners, guide your team members and work closely with our clients on their challenges requiring Data Foundations, Data Analytics, and Data Science.

As a Data Analyst Senior, you work closely with data engineers, bi analysts and product owners to create fast, efficient, and scalable data intelligence solutions for Werfen employees.




Key Accountabilities

Among others, you will:

‚Ä¢ Between 2 to 3 years of experience in a similar role, managing a team or multiple projects. Preferably in the digital/tech and health/diagnostics/life science space.

‚Ä¢Work with the team and business stakeholders to identify requirements, define models, and kickstart new analytics initiatives.

‚Ä¢Build data models with SQL and automate them with Python. Have deep knowledge of all the datasets inside the data lake to be able to provide guidance to stakeholders.

‚Ä¢Apply the correct data models to the business problem at hand.

‚Ä¢Leverage creative solutions, analytics, and visualization/ reporting techniques to enhance knowledge and drive actionable insights that deliver ROI.







Networking/Key relationships

Critical to be able to build relationships based in trust within the organization as the function is to respond to the internal customer needs while taking into consideration the overall corporate strategy.




Minimum Knowledge & Experience required for the position:

We expect that you have experience with:

‚Ä¢ SQL advanced

‚Ä¢ Good knowledge of any programming language like Python

‚Ä¢ Power BI, Qlik or other dashboarding software

‚Ä¢ Statistical programming (Python/R) and experience working with popular libraries and tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R Markdown.




We will consider it an advantage if you also have familiarity with any of the following:

‚Ä¢ AWS

‚Ä¢ Microsoft Azure cloud computing

‚Ä¢ Familiarity with DataOps principles

‚Ä¢ Familiar with Agile methodologies

‚Ä¢ Git software versioning




Skills & Capabilities: We expect you to demonstrate proficiency in data analysis and have a keen interest in understanding various business domains. We will also need you to be able to communicate data concepts to non-technical colleagues.

‚Ä¢ You are fluent in English both orally and in writing.

‚Ä¢ You have good presentation skills.

‚Ä¢ You can communicate well within the team and with stakeholders.

‚Ä¢ You can analyze business requirements in dialogue with internal stakeholders.

‚Ä¢ You can collaborate directly with external consultants and vendors.

‚Ä¢ You are a team player willing to share knowledge, ideas, and banter.




Travel requirements: 5% of time

Title: Data Analyst (M/F)
Description:
You want to join a company that places people at the heart of its concerns? We are waiting for you at Extia!

Extia is an engineering consultancy which proposes since 2007 an unprecedented approach in its sector by combining well-being and performance at work. A successful model: more than 3000 Extians working in 22 agencies in France and abroad, 1st Great Place To Work¬Æ in France, 160 millions of euros of turnover and plenty of energy!

At Extia, it's "First who, then what" so, let's do it!

First who

Involved, always willing to help your team.

Teamwork: Able to work in a multicultural environment.

Proactive, you enjoy projects that move forward quickly and efficiently.

Organized

Then what

Main Responsibilities in the Role



Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques, and generate reports.
Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics, and other strategies to optimize statistical efficiency and quality.
Filter and "clean" data by reviewing computer reports, printed materials, and performance indicators to identify and correct coding issues.
Identify and define new opportunities for process improvement.



Education and Experience



Studies in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or Engineering.
Minimum of 1 to 2 years of experience in a similar role.
Knowledge of PHP and/or Python programming languages.
Experience with Tableau or Power BI.
Knowledge of SQL.



What We Offer at Extia



Personalized career development plan.
Meal vouchers.
Private health insurance.
Public transportation reimbursement.
International and young work environment.
Office just a few meters from the beach.
Free drinks (beer, coffee, water, tea, milk).
Hybrid work mode (3 days remote, 2 days in-office).
Events (training sessions, meetups, after-work gatherings, parties).



Whatever you can think of, we welcome it! üöÄ

Title: Game Data Analyst
Description:
Ready for your next adventure?

We are Socialpoint, a world-renowned mobile game studio based in sunny Barcelona. Our games consistently rank among the top on iOS and Android, enjoyed by millions of players worldwide. As proud members of the Take-Two Interactive and Zynga family, our mission is simple: to create amazing gaming experiences and bring fun to everyone!

We‚Äôre looking for a Game Data Analyst to join our Analytics team. In this role, you'll analyze player behavior, collaborate with game teams, and help improve our games by driving retention and user conversion.

Using quantitative analysis, data science, statistics, and programming, you‚Äôll generate insights that make a real impact at Socialpoint. To succeed, you‚Äôll need to learn quickly, thrive in a fast-paced environment, and work closely with both analytics and game teams.

What will you do in Socialpoint?


Work with the game development teams to provide insights into user behavior and answer key business questions, turning our vast amount of data into actionable insights and transferable learnings.
Visualize and communicate the results of your analysis to senior stakeholders, making data driven recommendations that support key decisions.
Design and analyze A/B tests and other causal impact analysis to assess the impact of new features and changes.
Continuously educate stakeholders on data literacy and analytics best practices, to ensure they are empowered and autonomous to run analytically correct analysis.
Occasionally participate in advanced analytics projects, teaming up with other game data scientists & analysts to develop data tools and products.


Requirements


2-3 years experience applying analytics to answer business questions and mine for insights that drive value.
Highly proficient in SQL as well as Python for data exploratory analysis.
Experience with A/B testing.
Strong analytical skills in applied statistics. Prior experience with bayesian statistics is a plus.
Experienced creating dashboards and visualizing findings with a front-end visualization tool like Tableau or Looker.
A fast learner, highly meticulous and proactive individual.
Pragmatic, you know how to balance short term and long term deliverables.
A team player, you establish effective relationships to work with others for the win.


What's in it for you as a Socialpointer?


Hybrid working model from home and office. What does this mean? You need to live within commuting distance of our Barcelona office to attend important meetings and events.
Relocation support to help you move to Barcelona, if you're not already here.
An impressive 25 days of annual leave, not including public holidays.
An additional 5 days of annual leave during Christmas.
Full Catering for Breakfast and lunch at the office
Private medical insurance for you and your family to keep your health bar full.
Choose from the latest iOS or Android device upon joining (phone or tablet).
Free language lessons in English and Spanish.
Spotify Premium to add a special soundtrack to your adventure.
Legendary social events and parties to let off some steam.
Personal development is key for us: enjoy a significant budget to enhance your skills and knowledge, providing real growth opportunities!


What We Offer You:

Coming to work in the office? Don‚Äôt worry ‚Äì we have you covered. Check out some of our onsite benefits:


Gym Facilities: Want to stay in shape? We have state-of-the-art gym facilities so you can level up your build stats.
New Office: Enjoy our brand-new office, complete with top-tier amenities, including a professional barista and delicious breakfast options.
Onsite Physiotherapist: Book an appointment with our onsite physiotherapist for any aches and pains.
Onsite Hairdressers: Drop by our onsite hairdressers for a trim (and forget your wallet; it's a Guild perk).


The list just goes on & on... so get your game on and apply now! Click ‚Äúapply‚Äù to level up and submit your application in English.

Diversity & Conclusion Statement

We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer, which means we are committed to creating and celebrating diverse thoughts, cultures, and backgrounds throughout our organization. Employment with us is based on substantive ability, objective qualifications, and work ethic ‚Äì not an individual‚Äôs race, creed, color, religion, sex or gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin or ancestry, alienage or citizenship status, physical or mental disability, pregnancy, age, genetic information, veteran status, marital status, status as a victim of domestic violence or sex offenses, reproductive health decision, or any other characteristics protected by applicable law.

As an equal opportunity employer, we are committed to providing the necessary support and accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities, health conditions, or impairments (subject to any local qualifying requirements) to ensure their full participation in the job application or interview process. Please contact us at recruitment@socialpoint.es to request any accommodations or for support related to your application for an open position.

Please be aware that Socialpoint does not conduct job interviews or make job offers over third-party messaging apps such as Telegram, WhatsApp, or others. Socialpoint also does not engage in any financial exchanges during the recruitment or onboarding process, and will never ask a candidate for their personal or financial information over an app or other unofficial chat channel. Any attempt to do so may be the result of a scamp or phishing attack, and you should not engage. Socialpoint‚Äôs in-house recruitment team will only contact individuals through their official Company email addresses (i.e., via a zynga.com, naturalmotion.com, smallgiantgames.com, themavens.com, gram.gs email domain).

Title: Data Analyst EMEA, Retail Media
Description:
What You'll Do:

The Retail Media EMEA Analytics team, part of the rapidly expanding Criteo Retail Media business, leverages our grand set of shopper data to design and develop actionable insights for our Retailer and Brand clients. We bring the analytical perspective onto the business and provide recommendations based on high quality data analysis and strong understanding of our industry and products. We leverage our unique position to provide our commercial teams and clients with visibility into shopper behavior, market trends and product performance that can't be found anywhere else.

Criteo‚Äôs high-growth business model brings both opportunities and challenges. This position requires working with large sets of data and a variety of stakeholders to solve complex business problems by thinking strategically and proposing innovative solutions. The ideal candidate functions with minimal oversight and has the ability to learn new concepts quickly.


Mine massive data sets and turn them into understandable and actionable insights
Build scalable analytic solutions using state of the art tools of Criteo analytics stack (Hadoop, Vertica, PySpark‚Ä¶)
Develop innovative analytical approaches to measure Brands & Retailers‚Äô performance from design to presentation of results, leveraging all our expertise in Data Science (statistical thinking, A/B testing, bootstrapping, data visualization‚Ä¶)
Frequently interact with other teams (R&D, product, commercial teams‚Ä¶) and clients to share data-driven recommendations and insights
Develop and maintain deep knowledge of Criteo Retail Media products and technologies as they evolve



Who You Are:

You are passionate about data and want to work with leading edge technologies in online industry:


You have at least 2 years‚Äô experience in Data Science or Data Analytics
A Master‚Äôs degree or higher in a quantitative field (Engineering, Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics, etc.) is preferred, but equivalent practical experience will also be considered.
Fluency in the core toolkit of Data Science/Data Analytics: SQL is required, Python is a real asset (master most common data libraries: pandas, numpy‚Ä¶)
Outstanding analytical skills: passion for translating data-speak into relevant, compelling stories
A background in the digital industry or consulting is a plus
You have the combination of technical skills, passion for learning, and the soft skills to work with all personality types in a dynamic environment
You are fluent in English



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we‚Äôd love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world‚Äôs marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

Title: Statistical Analyst
Description:
Microomics busca Statistical Analyst

Title: Checkout Data Analyst
Description:
As you contemplate your future, you might be asking yourself, what's the next step? Start your journey with us!

We're seeking a Tech Data Analyst to join our Checkout team in Barcelona (hybrid). If you're ready to soar, we're ready to take you there.

Why eDreams ODIGEO

Join the world's leading travel subscription platform and one of the largest e-commerce businesses in Europe.

Millions of customers every year across 44 markets ‚Äì 5 brands ‚Äì 7M members in Prime

More than 100 million searches per day - Up to 6 billion daily AI predictions[e1]

Over 1,600 employees ‚Äì More than 60 different nationalities from all continents ‚Äì 99% permanent contracts - 36 average age

We're the world‚Äôs leading travel subscription platform and one of the largest e-commerce businesses in Europe. We are a tech company revolutionising the travel booking experience through our consumer insight, innovative technology, market leadership, and Prime, the world's first travel subscription program.

What You Will Do

The Role's Key Responsibilities and Tasks


Build the infrastructure required for the extraction, transformation and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources.
Assemble large and complex datasets, with an optimal data pipeline architecture, meeting business requirements.
Implement processes to monitor data quality, ensuring production data is always accurate and available for key stakeholders and business processes that depend on it.
Create alerts and dashboards to contribute to the monitoring and tracking of our business KPIs.
Identify, design and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimising queries, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc.
Collaborate with analytics and business teams to improve data models that feed existing reports or create brand new reports with the aim to increase data accessibility and foster data-driven decision making across the organisation.
Contribute to the delivery of strategic projects by participating in the delivery of key initiatives, giving support to the analytics and business teams when it comes to data availability and visualisation to ensure progress and effective delivery of the desired outcomes. Work together with stakeholders in the execution of the projects.



What you need to succeed:

Good to have


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a quantitative discipline (Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, etc.).
Experience building and optimising data pipelines, data sets and workflow management tools (e.g. Airflow).
Advance knowledge of SQL is a requirement as well as experience working with databases and large sets of data; Python programming skills are also required as well as experience in data visualisation or exploration tools such as Looker Studio.
Advanced Office skills. Strong experience with analytical tools, ideally with Microsoft and Google Office package (Excel, etc.).
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with high attention to detail.
Strong organisational and communication skills.
Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment.
A self-starter and team player, who also enjoys having fun!
Business Proficiency in English.



What‚Äôs In It For You

The best talent deserves the best benefits

At eDO, we want you to be a part of our success story and great culture. Here's what we offer:


A rewarding Compensation package! üí• Prime Plus membership, Competitive salary and benefits package, including flexible benefits, performance-based bonuses, birthday day off, discounts and partnerships, relocation support and the possibility of choosing your equipment and, even better, keeping it for free after 3 years.
Continuous learning to fuel your growth and explore new horizons! üìö Learn and grow with free Coursera access, soft skills workshops, tech training, leadership development, and more. Plus, enjoy a great onboarding program.
Grow opportunities to empower your career, and unleash your potential! üöÄ Personalised career paths and the eVOLVE Program will help you discover, grow, and thrive. Internal mobility opportunities let you pursue horizontal career changes and promotions.
Your Well-being is our Priority. Embrace Freedom and Flexibility! üíô At eDO, we value flexibility, employee care, and transparency. We offer a hybrid home-office model focused on outcome, not time-in-seat. You'll be able to find the right work-personal life balance that suits you best.
Work hard, party hard! We believe in having fun and connecting with colleagues! üéâ Join eDO for after-work events, padel tournaments, parties, and more. Create communities based on your passions, like sports and music. Come to work as you are, with no dress code, and enjoy free fruit, coffee, and tea at our offices.
Enjoy a dynamic and healthy environment! üí´ Be innovative, take risks, and share your ideas. Our diverse and open-minded teams support high performance, learning, and growth. You'll work in an Agile Mindset environment with recognition at our core.



Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at eDO? Follow us on LinkedIn and discover more about life at eDO!

If you are ready for a career opportunity with unmatched benefits, continuous learning, and a supportive work-life balance, look no further! Take your career to new destinations by applying now and help our diverse, inclusive, and passionate team shape the future of travel. Apply now!

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status. Our people are the key to our success. Each one of them is unique in their own way and the respect for their uniqueness is and will always be a passion and motivation.

If you are ready for a career opportunity with unmatched benefits, continuous learning, and a supportive work-life balance, look no further! Take your career to new destinations by applying now and help our diverse, inclusive, and passionate team shape the future of travel. Apply now!

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. Each one of them is unique in their own way and the respect for their uniqueness is and will always be a passion and motivation.

Title: Senior Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Since 1890, all around the globe, employees in Allianz have been working hard to secure people‚Äôs lives and to give courage to our customers for what‚Äôs ahead. We are actuaries, advisors and service agents; engineers, lawyers and technology experts; we are daughters and sons, mothers and fathers, accountants, investors and entrepreneurs ‚Äì and together we are shaping our industry.

Because we know how important it is to have a fair partner at your side who provides solid and sustainable solutions, we strive to do it right ‚Äì with passion, every day. Allianz Technology enables Allianz Group to live up to its purpose, by providing powerful, standardized global platforms to provide efficiencies, savings and scalability for the long-term success of Allianz.

About The Job

As a key member of the People Analytics team, you will leverage your expertise in Data Analytics to drive automation and develop innovative data products that empower Allianz Technology teams globally. Collaborating closely with colleagues in Germany, Romania, and India, you will ensure high-quality data is readily available to support autonomous, data-driven decision-making across Allianz Technology.

Your role involves compiling and consolidating diverse data sets to deliver actionable insights to the People Leadership teams and the broader business. You will engage with global and local business stakeholders to define requirements for data definitions and analytics, ensuring alignment with Allianz Technology's strategic priorities.

Your focus will be on enhancing the efficiency of the global reporting landscape through automation, enabling teams to independently access and utilize People analytics data. Additionally, you will contribute your analytical expertise to Allianz Group initiatives and projects, collaborating with Allianz Technology People function Product Owners, Business Partners, IT functions, service providers, and the Allianz Group‚Äôs global People & Culture function to drive data innovation and autonomy.

What You Do


Partner with various entities, People & Culture Leadership, and business leaders to define critical People & Culture data needs and drive a data-driven culture for strategic decision-making.
Define and standardize key People metrics, KPIs, and benchmarks to measure workforce effectiveness, transforming these into robust data products and developing AI-driven analytics solutions for enhanced decision-making.
Collaborate with IT and HRIS teams to optimize People data infrastructure, ensuring data integrity, security, and compliance with regulations like GDPR and CCPA, while driving automation and self-service analytics capabilities.
Design advanced People Analytics solutions to predict turnover, enhance employee engagement, and drive DEI strategies, utilizing NLP and sentiment analysis for employee feedback and local compensation analytics for pay equity.
Provide expert guidance to People Data Analysts to enhance skills, facilitate collaboration between People & Culture, IT, Finance, and business units, and share best practices for reporting and insights communication.
Advocate for the development and utilization of data products to streamline processes, enhance data-driven decision-making, and ensure alignment on organizational streamlining activities and data initiatives.
Be an active member of the global Analytics team, taking ownership of topics and being a thought leader to elevate the team's proficiency and impact.


What You Bring


7+ years of experience in People analytics, workforce planning, or related fields, preferably in an international environment, with proficiency in data analytics languages such as SQL and Python.
Expert user of leading data visualization tools, ideally Power BI, with experience in data modeling and exposure to predictive modeling, machine learning, and AI-driven analytics.
Strong understanding of People metrics, compensation analytics, and talent management KPIs, with a proven track record in fostering a data-driven culture.
Strong communication skills to translate complex data into actionable business insights and engage effectively with stakeholders in virtual teams across various continents and cultures.
Ability to work independently, demonstrating good self-organization, prioritization, and time management skills while maintaining quality levels in reporting and meeting deadlines.
Good assertiveness, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills, with a customer-service-oriented, hands-on mentality and high attention to detail.
Fluent in both spoken and written English, with methodological and conceptual skills, and analytical thinking; other languages are an advantage.


What We Offer


We offer a hybrid work model which recognizes the value of striking a balance between in-person collaboration and remote working incl. up to 25 days per year working from abroad.
We believe in rewarding performance and our compensation and benefits package includes a company bonus scheme, pension, employee shares program and multiple employee discounts (details vary by location).
From career development and digital learning programs to international career mobility, we offer lifelong learning for our employees worldwide and an environment where innovation, delivery and empowerment are fostered.
Flexible working, health and wellbeing offers (including healthcare and parental leave benefits) support to balance family and career and help our people return from career breaks with experience that nothing else can teach.


About Allianz Technology

With its headquarters in Munich, Germany, Allianz Technology is Allianz's global IT service provider and delivers IT solutions that drive the group's digitalization. With more than 11,000 employees in over 20 countries around the world, Allianz Technology is tasked to run, optimize, transform, and innovate the infrastructure, applications, and services together with Allianz companies to co-create the best customer experience.

We service the entire spectrum of digitalization ‚Äì from one of the industry's largest IT infrastructure projects that spans data centres, networks, and security, to application platforms ranging from workplace services to digital interaction.

In short: We deliver comprehensive end-to-end IT solutions for Allianz in the digital age. We are the backbone of Allianz.

Find us at: www.linkedin.com/company/allianz-technology .

D&I statement

Allianz Technology is proud to be an equal opportunity employer that embraces diversity and commits itself to creating an inclusive work environment for all.

We therefore welcome applications regardless of race, ethnicity or cultural background, age, gender, nationality, religion, social class, disability or sexual orientation, or any other characteristics protected under applicable local laws and regulations.

Join us. Let¬¥s care for tomorrow.

You. IT.

To Recruitment Agencies:

Allianz Technology has an in-house recruitment team that sources great candidates directly. Therefore, Allianz Technology does not accept unsolicited resumes from agencies or search firm recruiters.

When we do work with recruitment agencies, that engagement is formalized by a contract. Fees will only be paid when there is a contract in place. Without a contract in place, we will not accept invoices on unsolicited resumes, even if the candidate was ultimately employed by Allianz.

72609 | Data & Analytics | Professional | Non-Executive | Allianz Technology | Full-Time | Permanent

Allianz Technology is proud to be an equal opportunity employer that embraces diversity and commits itself to creating an inclusive work environment for all.

We therefore welcome applications regardless of race, ethnicity or cultural background, age, gender, nationality, religion, social class, disability or sexual orientation, or any other characteristics protected under applicable local laws and regulations.

Join us. Let¬¥s care for tomorrow.

You. IT.

To Recruitment Agencies:

Allianz Technology has an in-house recruitment team that sources great candidates directly. Therefore, Allianz Technology does not accept unsolicited resumes from agencies or search firm recruiters.

When we do work with recruitment agencies, that engagement is formalized by a contract. Fees will only be paid when there is a contract in place. Without a contract in place, we will not accept invoices on unsolicited resumes, even if the candidate was ultimately employed by Allianz.

Title: Senior Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Our mission? Creating the freedom for SMEs to succeed in business and beyond, by delivering Europe‚Äôs leading finance workspace. We combine business-class tools (seamless invoicing, spend management, and pre-accounting) with unwaveringly attentive 24/7 support, designed to help businesses breeze through all things finance.

Our journey: Founded by Alexandre and Steve in July 2017, Qonto has rapidly gained trust, serving over 500,000 customers. Thanks to our wonderful team of 1,600+ Qontoers, we also made it to the LinkedIn Top Companies French ranking!

Our values:

Customer focus | Prioritize customers in everything you do

Ownership | Own your part, get things done

Teamwork | Make (team)work easy

Mastery | Continuously raise the bar

Integrity | Always do what‚Äôs right, and respect people

Our beliefs: At Qonto, we're committed to fostering a welcoming environment where everyone can thrive. We prioritize evaluating applicants based solely on skills and potential, ensuring diversity with 50% international team members, 44% women, and 20% parents. Join us in building a workplace that celebrates diversity and individuality.

Discover the steps we took to create a discrimination-free hiring process.

üë©‚Äçüíªüßë‚ÄçüíªYour Impact:

Join our team of Marketing data analysts where you'll:


Drive Qonto's acquisition strategy through data-driven insights
Partner with teams across the Growth department, such as Acquisition, Partnership and Sales and help shape the future of our success story .
Be part of a dynamic Business Analytics organization that's central to Qonto's strategic decisions


üéØ Your Key Missions:


Acquisition Monitoring and optimisation: Setup dashboards and analysis that enable to improve the performance of our acquisition throughout the funnel and through our multi channel touch points.
Marketing Campaign measurement and testing: Design success metric and a measurement protocols to measure incremental impact of Acquisition Channel key initiatives and campaigns.
Growth deep dives: Lead investigations into performance patterns, transforming data anomalies into actionable acquisition strategies
Analytics Democratization: Create intuitive self-service analytics tools that empower our Growth team to make data-driven decisions
Strategic Partnership: Be the trusted data advisor to our Growth department, challenging assumptions and driving data-informed strategies
Quality Champion: Help set new standards for analytics excellence, ensuring our insights are both powerful and reliable


üë• The Team Experience:


Work alongside a diverse, international team of five growth experts spread across Europe
Learn from various experience levels, including staff members and senior analysts
Enjoy a culture that values autonomy, quick learning, and strong relationships
Tackle exciting challenges that require creative problem-solving and innovative thinking


ü§ù Your Future Manager: Omar

Meet Omar, our Lead Data Analyst who:


Built Qonto's analytics team and scaled it from 4 to 25 talented individuals in 4 years
Has deep understanding of our Product & Growth Strategies
Is passionate about mentoring and developing data talent
Will help you grow both technically and strategically in your role
Brings rich experience from airline revenue management and ad tech industries


üèÖ What Makes You Stand Out:


Analytical Prowess: You have a proven track record in growth analytics, particularly in areas of Customer Acquisition & Multi-channel attribution
Business Acumen: You don't just crunch numbers - you understand the business implications behind them
Technical Excellence: You're proficient in Python, SQL, and Tableau, with an eagerness to expand your technical toolkit
Communication: You can translate complex data insights into clear, actionable recommendations
Innovation Mindset: You're excited about finding creative solutions to complex data challenges
Statistical Thinking: You can distinguish meaningful patterns from statistical noise


‚ôüÔ∏è Why This Role Matters:


Direct impact on Qonto's European acquisition strategy
Opportunity to work with cutting-edge analytics tools and methodologies
Chance to shape the future of business banking
Work in a fast-growing scale-up that values data-driven decision-making


Diversity & Inclusion:

At Qonto, diversity isn't a checkbox - it's our strength. We believe the best teams are built on different perspectives, experiences, and backgrounds. We encourage applications from everyone who feels they can contribute to our mission, regardless of traditional qualifications.

üèÜ What We Offer:


Work with a purpose: Help transform business banking across Europe
Growth opportunities: Learn from experienced data leaders and tackle complex challenges
International exposure: Collaborate with teams across multiple European markets
Innovation culture: Be part of a team that's pushing the boundaries of fintech


At Qonto we understand that true diversity isn't just about ticking boxes on a hiring checklist. Apply regardless of the boxes you tick! Who knows? You may have the missing piece of the puzzle we've been searching for all along.

üéÅ Perks

A tailor-made and dynamic career track. An inclusive work environment. And so much more to help you succeed.


Offices in Paris, Berlin, Milan, Barcelona, and Belgrade;
Tailor-made remote work policy depending on the job you apply for and where you live;
Competitive salary package;
A meal voucher;
Public transportation reimbursement (part or global);
A great health insurance (depending on the country);
Employee well-being initiatives: access to Moka Care to take care of your mental health and great offers for sports and wellness activities;
A progressive disability and parenthood policy (1 in 6 of Qonto employees is a parent!) and childcare benefits with selected partners;
Monthly team events.


üí¨ Our hiring process:


Interviews with your Talent Acquisition Manager and future managers
A remote exercise to demonstrate your skills and give you a taste of what working at Qonto could be like


Find more information about our interview process on our careers website.

On average, our process lasts 20 working days and offers usually follow within 48 hours ü§û

To learn more about us:

Qonto's Blog | Les √âchos I L'Usine Digitale | Courrier Cadres

Title: Graduate Intern - Automation & Data Analysis
Place: Sant Cugat del Vall√®s, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
At Roche you can show up as yourself, embraced for the unique qualities you bring. Our culture encourages personal expression, open dialogue, and genuine connections, where you are valued, accepted and respected for who you are, allowing you to thrive both personally and professionally. This is how we aim to prevent, stop and cure diseases and ensure everyone has access to healthcare today and for generations to come. Join Roche, where every voice matters.

The Position

Graduate Intern - Automation & Data Analysis

We advance science so that we all have more time with the people we love.

Department Summary

We are looking for a dedicated and motivated intern to join our team, focusing on developing automation scripts to streamline various processes and tasks and conducting detailed analysis of vulnerability data to identify, assess, and mitigate potential security risks. This position provides a unique opportunity to gain practical experience in both automation and cybersecurity, collaborating closely with our experienced professionals to enhance our systems and ensure the integrity and security of our data. The ideal candidate should have a strong interest in programming and cybersecurity, a keen eagerness to learn, and the ability to work both independently and collaboratively within a team.

The Opportunity


Develop scripts to automate data import (JSON, CSV, XML)
Containerize and deploy scripts on AWS
Schedule automated script executions using AWS infrastructure
Develop test procedures and test automation scripts
Maintain clear documentation
Assist in data analysis, troubleshooting, and debugging


Program Highlights


Intensive 1 year intern graduate program (Contrato en practicas)
Competitive salary and benefits package
Program start dates are in September
Location in Sant Cugat del Valles, On site
Access to training and development opportunities
Work with some of the most talented people in the biotechnology industry



Who You Are (Required)

Must have graduated from a University degree program
Must have attained a Bachelor's degree
Experience with automation scripting and data analysis
Experience or familiarity with cloud computing technologies and cybersecurity
Basic scripting skills (e.g. Python/Bash)
Interest or experience with AWS and Docker
Good analytical, documentation, and problem-solving abilities


Required Majors: Business, Information Systems, Computer Science or a related relevant area of study.

This opportunity is part of the START TECH program, You can find more information about the

program at the following link: https://careers.roche.com/global/en/start-tech-program-spain

Who we are

A healthier future drives us to innovate. Together, more than 100‚Äô000 employees across the globe are dedicated to advance science, ensuring everyone has access to healthcare today and for generations to come. Our efforts result in more than 26 million people treated with our medicines and over 30 billion tests conducted using our Diagnostics products. We empower each other to explore new possibilities, foster creativity, and keep our ambitions high, so we can deliver life-changing healthcare solutions that make a global impact.

Let‚Äôs build a healthier future, together.

Roche is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Title: Sourcing Data Analyst Internship
Description:
Duration: Minimum 12 months

Location: Barcelona (Poblenou)

**Please submit your CV and cover letter in English**

Company Overview:

NSI is a leading player in the natural food industry committed to delivering high-quality, sustainable, and ethically sourced products to our customers. We are seeking a dynamic and detail-oriented Sourcing Data Analyst to join our team and play a pivotal role in enhancing our sourcing and procurement processes.

Responsibilities:

Import/Export Data and Market Analysis:


Analyze import/export data of key commodities in the natural food industry.
Monitor market prices, trends, and fluctuations to provide valuable insights to the sourcing team.


Supplier Database Management:


Create, populate, and manage a comprehensive supplier database.
Gather and update key information on suppliers obtained from various sources, ensuring accuracy and relevance.


Sourcing And Procurement KPIs Analysis:


Generate and analyze sourcing and procurement Key Performance Indicators (KPIs).
Provide regular reports and insights to optimize sourcing strategies.


Pricing Database Management:


Develop and manage a pricing database, recording daily prices received from suppliers.
Ensure data accuracy and use insights to negotiate favorable pricing agreements.


Global Calendar Creation:


Create a global calendar for each commodity, detailing seasonality, main producing countries, acres grown, production estimates, etc.
Provide timely information to support strategic decision-making in sourcing.


Sourcing App Development:


Design and implement a sourcing app to streamline data collection during Trade Shows.
Automate the upload of supplier data to the central database for seamless integration.


ERP Support For Contract Management:


Support the sourcing team in contract creation and management within the Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) system.


AI Integration:


Drive the integration of Artificial Intelligence (AI) tools in the sourcing department.
Explore AI applications for vendor onboarding, forecasting, price changes, and identifying potential crop disruptions.


The Ideal Candidate Will Have:


Proven experience in data analysis, preferably in the natural food industry.
Proficiency in data visualization tools and techniques.
Knowledge of sourcing and procurement processes.
Experience with ERP systems and contract management.
Familiarity with AI and machine learning concepts is a plus.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.


Required Education And Experience:


Master‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Business, Supply Chain Management, or related field. GAP year students will not be considered.
Must have professional proficiency in English (oral and written)


Work Environment:


Hybrid work schedule with at least three (3) days per week in-office. Location in Barcelona is a must.
Candidates must be flexible in regards to their schedule to accommodate working with an international team


Company Overview:

NSI is a leading player in the natural private label food industry, dedicated to providing high-quality, organic, and sustainably sourced food products to consumers. We believe in promoting healthy and conscious eating choices, and our range of products reflects our commitment to quality and sustainability. As we continue to grow and expand our market presence, we are seeking an experienced and dynamic Sourcing Data Analyst Intern to join our team and drive the creation of exciting, nutritious, and eco-friendly products.

Supplier Database Management:

  • Gather and update key information on suppliers obtained from various sources, ensuring accuracy and relevance.

Sourcing And Procurement KPIs Analysis:

  • Generate and analyze sourcing and procurement Key Performance Indicators (KPIs).
  • Provide regular reports and insights to optimize sourcing strategies.

Pricing Database Management:

  • Develop and manage a pricing database, recording daily prices received from suppliers.
  • Ensure data accuracy and use insights to negotiate favorable pricing agreements.

Global Calendar Creation:

  • Create a global calendar for each commodity, detailing seasonality, main producing countries, acres grown, production estimates, etc.
  • Provide timely information to support strategic decision-making in sourcing.

Sourcing App Development:

  • Design and implement a sourcing app to streamline data collection during Trade Shows.
  • Automate the upload of supplier data to the central database for seamless integration.

ERP Support For Contract Management:

  • Support the sourcing team in contract creation and management within the Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) system.

AI Integration:

  • Drive the integration of Artificial Intelligence (AI) tools in the sourcing department.
  • Explore AI applications for vendor onboarding, forecasting, price changes, and identifying potential crop disruptions.

The Ideal Candidate Will Have:

  • Proven experience in data analysis, preferably in the natural food industry.
  • Proficiency in data visualization tools and techniques.
  • Knowledge of sourcing and procurement processes.
  • Experience with ERP systems and contract management.
  • Familiarity with AI and machine learning concepts is a plus.
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills.

Required Education And Experience:

  • Master‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Business, Supply Chain Management, or related field. GAP year students will not be considered.
  • Must have professional proficiency in English (oral and written)

Work Environment:

  • Hybrid work schedule with at least three (3) days per week in-office. Location in Barcelona is a must.
  • Candidates must be flexible in regards to their schedule to accommodate working with an international team

Company Overview:

NSI is a leading player in the natural private label food industry, dedicated to providing high-quality, organic, and sustainably sourced food products to consumers. We believe in promoting healthy and conscious eating choices, and our range of products reflects our commitment to quality and sustainability. As we continue to grow and expand our market presence, we are seeking an experienced and dynamic Sourcing Data Analyst Intern to join our team and drive the creation of exciting, nutritious, and eco-friendly products.

Title: Data Analyst (Product)
Description:
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, and more freedom. Since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. Our powerhouse of products ‚Äî including spending, saving, investing, exchanging, travelling, and more ‚Äî help our 55+ million customers get more from their money every day.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‚Äå 2 things are essential to our success: our people and our culture. In recognition of our outstanding employee experience, we've been certified as a Great Place to Work‚Ñ¢. So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our offices and remotely, to help us achieve our mission. And we're looking for more brilliant people. People who love building great products, redefining success, and turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems, and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. Our Data Analysts aren‚Äôt kept in the background, doomed to never see the impact of their work. They‚Äôre some of our best and brightest problem solvers, deployed to the front-lines to work in Product Teams and deliver rock star solutions ü§ò

We‚Äôre looking for a superstar Data Analyst who does not believe there is a data task that can be too hard ü¶¨ From digging into our complex databases, looking for the root cause of a problem to designing their own solutions and writing their own code to implement them. In this process they never stop learning, picking up new skills and delivering value.

Up for the challenge? Get in touch üëá

What You‚Äôll Be Doing


Understanding our business and its processes through our data
Applying this understanding and knowledge of data to help product and service teams
Designing key metrics to measure different aspects of the business
Creating and maintaining new aggregated views and tables to simplify data querying
Maintaining and creating new dashboards to track metrics and visualise insights
Promoting data literacy across the company, organising and holding workshops


What You'll Need


Previous experience in an analytical role, creating impactful solutions
A strong background/education in a quantitative discipline
5+ years of experience with SQL
Great skills with Python or other programming languages
Evidence of strong mathematical and statistics knowledge


Building a global financial super app isn‚Äôt enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that‚Äôs why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We‚Äôre doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That‚Äôs why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Important notice for candidates:

Job scams are on the rise. Please keep these guidelines in mind when applying for any open roles.


Only apply through official Revolut channels. We don‚Äôt use any third-party services or platforms for our recruitment.
Always double-check the emails you receive. Make sure all communications are being done through official Revolut emails, with an @revolut.com domain.


We won't ask for payment or personal financial information during the hiring process. If anyone does ask you for this, it‚Äôs a scam. Report it immediately.

Title: Business Data Analyst
HTML:
Are we the best-kept secret in M√°laga?

We like to think so. Over the past year, our M√°laga hub has grown into a thriving center of excellence, where we combine innovation, collaboration, and opportunity. We are serious about finding the right people and are confident that we have a lot to offer.


The role in a nutshell

Are you passionate about leveraging data to make meaningful business improvements? As a Business Data Analyst within the Coupa Global Reporting & Governance team, you will be instrumental in enabling datadriven decision-making and fostering continuous improvement. Your goal? To turn data insights into actionable strategies that enhance contract compliance, boost supplier performance, and streamline operational efficiency. In this role, you will collaborate closely with diverse stakeholders, acting as a vital link between business needs and technical capabilities. Your responsibilities will include gathering and validating business requirements, translating them into technical specifications, and ensuring user-friendly reporting solutions meet organizational goals. You will uphold best practices in data quality, work towards impactful reporting outcomes, and create a data-driven culture across our global Coupa landscape. With opportunities for growth in a stimulating and innovative environment, you will develop cost-saving initiatives, enhance business processes, and maintain compliance with audit requirements. If you thrive on advancing improvements through data and working in a collaborative global team, this role is your next career move!


More specifically, you will be expected to:

‚Ä¢ Analyze trends and patterns in Power BI reports to identify areas for improvement, such as contract compliance and supplier performance;

‚Ä¢ Monitor catalogue growth and drive initiatives to increase on-catalogue purchasing and reduce offcatalogue spend;

‚Ä¢ Evaluate purchasing trends to enhance contract compliance and support cost-saving strategies;

‚Ä¢ Track payment schedules to maximize early payment discounts and optimize cost efficiency;

‚Ä¢ Implement initiatives to reduce cycle times for requisitions, invoice processing, and supplier onboarding;

‚Ä¢ Advocate for electronic invoicing to improve accuracy and streamline processes;

‚Ä¢ Gather, validate, and document business requirements for reporting projects;

‚Ä¢ Support data standardization efforts to enhance reporting accuracy and consistency;

‚Ä¢ Act as a liaison between business stakeholders and technical teams to ensure reporting solutions align with strategic goals;

‚Ä¢ Develop training programs and user guides to empower end users in utilizing reports effectively


Do you have what it takes?

‚Ä¢ Skilled at interpreting data and providing actionable business insights;

‚Ä¢ Advanced skills in Power BI and Excel; SAP experience is beneficial.

‚Ä¢ Solid interpersonal and communication skills to engage with and collaborate efficiently across teams;

‚Ä¢ High accuracy and a focus on maintaining data quality in reporting outputs;

‚Ä¢ Quick to identify and address operational and technical issues;

‚Ä¢ Significant experience in increasing efficiencies and optimizing workflows;

‚Ä¢ Experience working across procurement, finance, or accounts payable functions;

‚Ä¢ Ability to develop and deliver clear training materials for diverse user groups.


Language : As you will be part of a global team, you are expected to communicate fluently in English (verbal and written). Knowledge of other languages such as French, German, or Spanish is favorable but not mandatory.


Travel: Some occasional travelling will be required.


Location: This role will ideally be based at our Malaga office, but we could consider other suitable locations


Wondering what‚Äôs in it for you?

üÜô Be part of a world class organization with a mandate to identify opportunities for improvement and drive performance benefits

üè† Hybrid Work

üí∞ Competitive compensation structure

üë®‚Äçüë©‚Äçüëß‚Äçüë¶ Health Insurance coverage for you and your dependents

üõü Life Insurance

üìà Growth Opportunities (career progression, tuition assistance, language courses, training and certifications, etc.)

üõ¨ Relocation assistance


If you are ready to join our diverse team, make a difference and advance your career in a global setting, we want to hear from you.

Join us and help shape the future of data-driven procurement and finance processes! Given the global nature of the role, we ask applicants to submit their resume in English and indicate their working rights status.

Glencore encourages diversity and provides an inclusive workplace.

Accommodations are available upon request for applicants with special needs.

Interviews may start prior to the closing date.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Inetum es l√≠der europeo en servicios digitales. El equipo de 28.000 consultores y expertos de Inetum se esfuerza cada d√≠a por lograr un impacto digital en las empresas, en las entidades del sector p√∫blico y en la sociedad. Las soluciones de Inetum quieren contribuir al rendimiento y la innovaci√≥n de sus clientes, as√≠ como al inter√©s general. Presente en 19 pa√≠ses con una red de centros densa, Inetum colabora con los principales fabricantes de software para afrontar los retos de la transformaci√≥n digital con proximidad y flexibilidad. Impulsada por su ambici√≥n de crecimiento y expansi√≥n, Inetum gener√≥ una cifra de negocio de 2.500 millones de euros en 2023.




üéØ ¬°√önete a INETUM como Data Analyst! üéØ

Estamos en busca de un especialista en transformaci√≥n de procesos y datos que domine el an√°lisis funcional, documentaci√≥n y optimizaci√≥n de flujos de informaci√≥n. Si eres un apasionado de la automatizaci√≥n y el dise√±o de procesos eficientes, ¬°este reto es para ti!




üîé ¬øQu√© har√°s?

Analizar y documentar procesos funcionales actuales (As Is analysis).
Identificar y estructurar todos los datos utilizados en informes, foros y comit√©s.
Dise√±ar la transformaci√≥n de los procesos (To Be) y crear especificaciones t√©cnicas.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At Unimedia Technology, we're on the lookout for a Data Analyst to work on the next-gen digital signage and advertising platform used by major clients across Europe.




üéØ What You‚Äôll Do

As a Data Specialist, you‚Äôll be crucial to making sure the geographic and postal data is clean, accurate, and ready to go. Here's a taste of your day-to-day:

‚óè üåê Research and scrape geographic, postal data and point-of-interest sources, integrating them into the systems.

‚óè üßπ Perform data cleaning, validation, and integration into our PostgreSQL database.

‚óè üß© Collaborate on internal projects with the team to process and analyze data effectively.

‚óè üó∫ Work closely with the Product Owner and Development to ensure data accuracy and relevance.

‚óè üìù Document your workflows and processes to keep things running smoothly.




ü§π You‚Äôll Fit Right In If You...

‚óè Have strong proficiency in SQL and experience with PostgreSQL (you‚Äôre comfortable writing queries like a pro).

‚óè Know your way around data processing and automation (bonus if you‚Äôve automated workflows before).

‚óè Have excellent written and spoken English communication skills

‚óè Hold a Bachelor‚Äôs degree (or higher) in a relevant field.

‚óè Have a good handling of Python or similar







üí• Nice-to-Haves

‚óè Experience with GIS (Geographical Information Systems) tools like QGIS or similar platforms.

‚óè Some familiarity with bash scripting and Git for version control.

‚óè Hands-on knowledge of web scraping tools and techniques (because sometimes the best data is hiding on the web).

‚óè A basic understanding of PHP (for occasional integrations).

‚óè Fluency in additional languages, especially those useful in international postal systems.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description



We‚Äôre looking for a Data Analyst to join our team in Madrid and help shape the future of contextual advertising as we continue to expand globally.

Who We Are
At Seedtag, we lead the way in contextual advertising with our machine learning-powered platform. Our technology provides superior brand safety, human-like content understanding, and advanced cookieless targeting, making ads more engaging and respectful. Founded by two ex-Googlers in 2014, we‚Äôve grown to over 600 Seedtaggers across 18 countries, raising ‚Ç¨250M to revolutionize digital advertising.

Your Challenge

You will propose a new analysis to get the most out of our current data and define what additional data will be needed to improve our current Contextual Understanding.
Your data visualization skills will be key to grasping the attention of the public and transmitting complex information into simple explanations.
You will get full ownership of our contextual data to offer insights and communication strategies to our most relevant clients.
You will present your results internally and externally, co-creating contextual strategies with big clients (from Nissan to Coca-Cola, Heineken, Tag Heuer, etc).
You will help us build contextual tools that would allow the democratization of data inside the company: from sales to marketing to operations, the different teams should be using contextual data in their day-to-day.
Some experience building extract, transform, load (ETL) data pipelines will be needed here.
You will analyze the performance of our current Contextual products and actively propose improvements together with the Product Team.
Finally, you will build a strong knowledge of the ecosystem and sector to develop a strong instinct of how to improve our products and positioning. Creativity here will also be a must!
During all these tasks, you will be using the latest technologies developed by our Machine Learning Engineers: amazing NLP and CV models to get the most out of massive amounts of data!

What You‚Äôll Need to Succeed
You have a relevant degree in engineering, mathematics, statistics or an analytics-related field.
You have between 1 and 3 years of work experience in Data Analysis or a related field.
You are proficient in SQL and Python: data treatment and data visualizations are a must.
You have an analytical mind capable of structuring complex problems into simple, iterative solutions.
You have full proficiency in Spanish and English.
You are energetic, proactive and eager to work in a dynamic environment.
You are a real team player with good communication and cooperation skills.
You have proven ability to work in a fast-paced, informal, dynamic and exigent environment.
You like to have fun while working and don‚Äôt take yourself too serious!
It would be a big plus if you
Have previous experience in a startup or have a background in consulting.
Have previous experience in presenting and communicating data analysis results and insights to external stakeholders.

Why Join Seedtag?
Growth & Opportunity: A key moment to join with vast career development prospects.
Flexibility: At Seedtag, we trust you to balance work and life effortlessly with the option to work from home, the office, or even the beach in our hybrid mode.
Learning & Development: Online courses in ODILO and optional English or Spanish group classes.
Inclusive Culture: We foster a supportive environment that values personal growth.
Fun & Connection: Participate in team activities, company off-sites, and more!

Additional Perks
Flexible benefits plan: Restaurant, transportation, and kindergarten vouchers.
Health insurance: Comprehensive coverage is included.
Gympass: Access to wellness programs and fitness classes.
Seedsave Program: Exclusive discounts to help you save for the future.

Ready to join the Seedtag adventure? Send us your CV, and let‚Äôs grow together!

At Seedtag, we‚Äôre committed to creating an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive. We welcome diverse perspectives as they fuel our innovation and growth. Please let us know if you require accommodations during the hiring process, and we‚Äôll ensure a positive and accessible experience.

Title: Data Analyst (They/She/He)
Description:
If you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We‚Äôll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 25 countries.

Together we revolutionise the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

ü§ù Our culture and strong values.

üí™ Our career development philosophy.

ü§ù Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

THE JOURNEY


Work closely with multi-disciplinary teams to define the business roadmap and strategy, monitor and give visibility of operations metrics and KPIs.
Apply various advanced mathematical and statistical modeling techniques and analyses (experimentation, machine learning, causal inference, etc.) to solve for product and business problems that drive the highest impact.
Translate business questions and hypotheses into analysis and actionable insights.
Develop and maintain scalable and self-service visualization tools and storytelling dashboards.
Foster strong relationships with stakeholders acting as a strategic and supportive link between the technology, business, and product.


What You Will Bring To The Ride


3-5 years of professional experience outside of an academic and internship setting, in a quantitative analysis role.
A higher education in scientific discipline such as Physics, Statistics, Computer Science or Mathematics.
Knowledge or experience in digital product development.
Demonstrable experience with the application of statistical modeling and advanced analytics to provide strategy-shaping insights.
Mastery in SQL and statistical programming (Python/R) and experience working with popular tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R Markdown.
Demonstrated experience in designing and analyzing experiments in digital products (A/B test, multivariate, etc).
Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau, Looker, PowerBI.
Excellent spoken and written English.


Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves


üåü An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
üí™ Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
üí≥ Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
üèä Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.

HTML:
If you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We‚Äôll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 25 countries.

Together we revolutionise the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

ü§ù Our culture and strong values.

üí™ Our career development philosophy.

ü§ù Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

THE JOURNEY

  • Work closely with multi-disciplinary teams to define the business roadmap and strategy, monitor and give visibility of operations metrics and KPIs.
  • Apply various advanced mathematical and statistical modeling techniques and analyses (experimentation, machine learning, causal inference, etc.) to solve for product and business problems that drive the highest impact.
  • Translate business questions and hypotheses into analysis and actionable insights.
  • Develop and maintain scalable and self-service visualization tools and storytelling dashboards.
  • Foster strong relationships with stakeholders acting as a strategic and supportive link between the technology, business, and product.

What You Will Bring To The Ride

  • 3-5 years of professional experience outside of an academic and internship setting, in a quantitative analysis role.
  • A higher education in scientific discipline such as Physics, Statistics, Computer Science or Mathematics.
  • Knowledge or experience in digital product development.
  • Demonstrable experience with the application of statistical modeling and advanced analytics to provide strategy-shaping insights.
  • Mastery in SQL and statistical programming (Python/R) and experience working with popular tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R Markdown.
  • Demonstrated experience in designing and analyzing experiments in digital products (A/B test, multivariate, etc).
  • Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau, Looker, PowerBI.
  • Excellent spoken and written English.

Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves

  • üåü An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
  • üí™ Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
  • üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
  • üí≥ Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
  • üèä Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
  • üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
  • üë™ Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
  • üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.

Title: Data Analyst Trainee
Description:
Ecolab Company has an opening for an Data Analyst Trainee in our Procurement Analytics and Digital Solutions (ADS) team located in Barcelona, Spain. If you are a passionate professional that is seeking opportunity, advancement, and a rewarding learning chance and career we invite you to apply. This is a fantastic opportunity to join a highly recognized global growth company offering competitive compensation and benefits in addition to career growth.

Job Overview

As a part of the Data Operations team in the Global Supply Chain Analytics and Digital Solutions group you will be responsible for continuous improvements in digital capabilities and advanced analytics. You will lead the development of new digital products providing critical insights that help solve business challenges. The successful candidate will lead efforts to improve the chemical data understanding across the organization through improved process, governance, and data management.

Candidates must display a passion for systems, data, operational reporting & advanced analytics. The strong performer can expect further career advancement opportunities with Ecolab and will have the chance to move into other roles within Procurement or the organization, with increasing leadership opportunities. This is an exciting opportunity to advance your career with a stable growing company!

Main Responsibilities


Serve as a liaison among stakeholders to analyze, document, and validate requirements for reporting and changes to business processes
Develop and maintain data products
Develop, test, and operationalize new standardized reporting
Develop and maintain business intelligence dashboards
Lead automation of processes and analyses
Train other teams in systems, tools, and processes owned by ADS
Proactively make recommendations and identify opportunities to solve business problems through new business intelligence reporting
Interface with IT to specify and implement improvements to our data pipelines


Basic Qualifications


Masters in Data Science or Statistics or Computer Science or equivalent advance degree.
Interest in an Artificial Intelligence (AI) and business intelligence (BI) role
Experience with AI and BI data modeling and presenting insights to key stakeholders.
Exceptional analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Proficient in Python, PySpark, SQL, Azure AI, Tenserflow, Streamlit, Flask, Power Apps, Power BI, Snowflake, Azure SQL Database.
Intermediate SQL skills, or willingness to learn.
Fluent English
Full-time availability.
To be eligible for the Traineeship contract you must have completed your bachelor's or master's degree studies.
Work permit in Barcelona.


Preferred Qualifications


Experience designing and building standard reports and dashboards
History of managing and delivering projects, tasks, and initiatives
Ability to create, implement, document, and continuously improve processes in a changing environment
Training or experience in data science areas such as time series analysis, forecasting, classification, and regression analysis
Experience with data analytics tools such as Python, R, SPSS, MATLAB, Stata, and SAS
Experience working with global cross-functional teams and demonstrated ability to work well with people from different disciplines with varying degrees of technical expertise
Microsoft PowerBI experience
Project management experience
Experience in the petrochemical industry a plus
Enrolled in or recently completed degree with emphasis in Chemistry, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Information Technology, or Engineering preferred

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

Ecolab is committed to fair and equal treatment of associates and applicants and furthering the principles of Equal Opportunity to Employment. Our goal is to fully utilize minority, female, and disabled individuals at all levels of the workforce. We will recruit, hire, promote, transfer and provide opportunities for advancement based on individual qualifications and job performance. In all matters affecting employment, compensation, benefits, working conditions, and opportunities for advancement, Ecolab will not discriminate against any associate or applicant for employment because of race, religion, color, creed, national origin,‚ÄØcitizenship status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expressions, genetic‚ÄØinformation, marital status, age, or disability.
