Title: Freelance Data Analyst (Python) - AI Tutor
Description:
At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

What We Do

The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.

About The Role

GenAI models are improving very quickly, and one of our goals is to make them capable of addressing specialized questions and achieving complex reasoning skills. If you join the platform as an AI Tutor in Data Analysis, you'll have the opportunity to collaborate on these projects.

Although every project is unique, you might typically:


Triple-check some delivery data and ensure client expectations are reflected in every batch
Generate prompts that challenge AI
Define comprehensive scoring criteria to evaluate the accuracy of the AI's answers
Correct the model's responses based on your domain-specific knowledge
Ensure taxonomies are logical, consistent, and aligned with operational needs



How To Get Started

Simply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects aligned with your skills, on your own schedule. From creating training prompts to refining model responses, you'll help shape the future of AI while ensuring technology benefits everyone.

Requirements


You have a Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Science, Mathematics
You have at least 3 years of professional experience in Data Analysis
You have experience with prompt engineering (basic to intermediate level) and have Basic-to-Intermediate Python Scripting and SQL understanding
You are proficient in spreadsheet tools such as Google Sheets, Excel
You have experience with interpreting data visualization & reporting (e.g., dashboards)
You have a strong command of taxonomy and classification design
Your level of English is advanced (C1) or above
You are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between tasks and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelines
Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge



Benefits

Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?


Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments
Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio
Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise
Show more

Title: Business Intelligence Consultant
Description:
Mutual Respect, Empathy, Innovation, and Professional Pride. Do you see yourself within these values?




Founded in 2006 with the mission "To Challenge Complexity", Closer Consulting is a Data Science company specializing in Business Intelligence, Advanced Analytics, and Artificial Intelligence.

Developing projects in the most diverse industries ‚Äì Banking, Telecommunications, Healthcare, Retail, Energy, Insurance, and Aviation, among others ‚Äì, we have created an environment where the brightest enquiring minds feel at home, providing our people with the means, opportunities and support they need to thrive and innovate.




We are seeking a skilled Business Intelligence Consultant (5+ years of professional experience) eager to take on new challenges in a hybrid work model in Lisbon (4 days in the office).




Are you the one?




SQL language for extracting and manipulating data in different databases;
Power BI tool for creating reports, dashboards and data visualizations.
Other relevant technologies, such as Python, machine learning, are optional;
Agile methodologies and data project life cycle.
Analytical and critical thinking to identify patterns and insights in data;
Ability to communicate complex results clearly and concisely to different audiences;
Proactivity and willingness to learn new technologies and tools.
Opportunity to work in a collaborative and innovative environment;
Challenging projects with a direct impact on business;
Continuous professional development.




We believe we are the ones to, by:

Providing a multidisciplinary Team.
Giving a home office kit with everything you need to perform remotely.
Ensuring a career plan alongside professional growth.
Providing you with a custom training plan.
Helping you reach happiness.




Oh‚Ä¶ and by the way, we also have:

Several challenging complex projects.
Stimulating teams and leaders.
World-class Clients and Partners.




If you believe in this match as much as we do, send us your CV to catarina.rolo@closer.pt and reach the closer side of life.




Closer is a company that values diversity and inclusion. We are committed to fostering an environment where everyone is treated with dignity and respect, regardless of race, gender, beliefs, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other personal characteristics.




At Closer, we embrace the unique perspectives and experiences that everyone brings, and we believe that it is a fundamental driver for the success we've achieved.

Title: Consumer Insights Intern
Description:
Job Description

ABOUT THIS JOB

We are looking to hire passionate and agile individuals as interns who can take a high degree of ownership and deliver results in a fast-paced and evolving business division.

The person would be assisting Quantitative CPG/Retail team in their project work in terms of questionnaire checking, charting for report preparation, analyses and any other assistance. The person would get good exposure to the various types of Quantitative studies.

Qualifications/ Skills


Post Graduate in MBA (Marketing as majors/ specialization subject) or any other related field
Market Research knowledge and interest in this career
Adept in MS Excel, Word and PowerPoint with good presentation skills
Strong analytic skills and ability to structure high volume data
High degree of ownership, agility and willingness to get tasks completed within short durations
Team working skills
Data interpretation & problem-solving skills
Excellent communication skills
Managing timelines for various tasks, multi-tasking and meeting deadlines
Excellent Business English
Proficient in Portuguese


What We Can Offer


Work in a stable environment, in a large international research company
Opportunity to work with the biggest FMCG companies
Learning opportunities within ‚ÄúConsumer Insights Academy‚Äù
Opportunity to be a part of many products' development projects (Eye Tracking, Digital Solutions)
Ability to develop within expert groups in various products, methodologies, analytical tools
High level of projects & clients diversity (quali & quant / FMCG & non-FMCG)
Working in a multi-country environment (on local and multicounty projects)
Great team


Additional Information

Our Benefits


Flexible working environment
Volunteer time off
LinkedIn Learning
Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)


About NIQ

NIQ is the world‚Äôs leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights‚Äîdelivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms‚ÄîNIQ delivers the Full View‚Ñ¢. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world‚Äôs population.

For more information, visit NIQ.com

Want to keep up with our latest updates?

Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion

Title: Junior Fraud Reporting Data Analyst
HTML:
A Company you will be happy to grow with!

At InnoTech, it¬¥s all about connecting people with business through technology.

We care about you, your happiness, and your well-being. We seek people who want to learn and further improve their skills with us ‚Äì growth is part of our DNA, and that‚Äôs why we‚Äôre proud to be certified as a Great Place to Work and to be among the Top 50 Best Workplaces in Portugal! For us, sustainability is not just a word. Integrity and social responsibility lead our behavior.

We dare to be different, ambitious, dream big, and deliver value like no other! You will have the opportunity to work with top-level partners in the banking area, insurance, retail, telecommunications, financial services, and so much more!

We are 180+ InnoTechers, and we want your talent as a Junior Fraud Reporting Data Analyst.

Your Mission Will Be

  • Develop reports and dashboards to track the performance of fraud prevention strategies across various services and regions;
  • Build analytical and reporting solutions that help stakeholders understand the business impact of fraud mitigation efforts;
  • Support operational teams in tracking and optimizing daily fraud prevention activities;
  • Respond to ad-hoc data requests and assist in client-facing analysis and reporting tasks;
  • Continuously improve existing processes by promoting scalable and automatable solutions.

You Will Need

  • Previous experience in analytical roles and designing and implementing ETL processes;
  • Proficiency in SQL and DAX;
  • Knowledge of data visualization tools, with emphasis on MS Power BI;
  • A Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in areas such as Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Management, Economics, or related;
  • CPLP nationality or an EU work permit is required to facilitate employment.

Would Be Awesome If You Have

  • Familiarity with fraud detection scenarios;
  • Experience with Databricks and cloud-based data tools;
  • Understanding of machine learning algorithms like Random Forest, XGBoost, or LightGBM;
  • Knowledge of Big Data frameworks such as Spark or Hadoop;
  • BSc or MSc in Computer Science/Engineering, Information Technology, or related fields.

With Us You Can Be a

TechThinker ‚Äì people who want to re-imagine technology with us;

TechSolver ‚Äì strategic, resilient, and a little bit of a puzzle lover;

InnoMinder ‚Äì inhale innovation, exhale digital transformation;

InnoTecher ‚Äì no words needed. Just happiness, talent, and all the above!

Are you convinced? Come see it for yourself.

Join our Top-Notch Team!

Title: Data Analyst (Contract)
Description:
Job Description

We are looking to hire a Data Analyst on a 12-month contract to add to the Product Analytics team!

Your goal is to deeply understand gamers‚Äô needs and prioritise their critical issues.

The Product Analytics team focuses on ensuring gamers are engaged with and return to the products. Your goal in this role will be to focus on and affect the parts of our games that will help us scale. Our current teams work on problems across multiple games, resulting in more gamers playing Miniclip games.

What will you be doing at Miniclip?


You‚Äôll derive actionable insights from data to inform product decisions, from improving our onboarding flow to driving game feature performance.
You‚Äôll help build conviction on high-value areas and challenge assumptions if there are faster or more effective ways to tackle a problem.
You‚Äôll partner with Product Managers, Game Designers, Game Developers and other Analysts to set success metrics and monitor the impact of new product features.
You‚Äôll contribute to the team environment where ideas are freely exchanged.
Using data to logically design and conduct A/B tests that lead to a better understanding of gamer behaviour.
You‚Äôll contribute to the broader Product Analytics goals, such as democratising data.


What are we looking for?


Evidence of delivering actionable insights that have led to positive results.
Ability to clearly and concisely explain key findings and give data-driven recommendations to technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Knowledge of SQL and ability to perform complex queries in non-relational databases.
Experience using Data Visualization Tools such as Looker.
Familiar with domain-specific programming languages such as R or Python.
Robust knowledge in mathematical areas relevant to the position statistics, hypothesis testing, etc.
Knowledge of games and the gaming industry. (not mandatory)
Experience of A/B testing. (not mandatory)


About Miniclip

Miniclip is a global leader in games and one of the world's biggest developers and publishers of mobile games, with a mission of unleashing the gamer in everyone. It distributes highly engaging games to a global audience of over 450 million monthly and 70 million daily active users across mobile, PC, console, social, and online platforms. Operating in 15 countries, Miniclip develops and launches games in multiple categories across its 22 studios.

Founded in 2001 with an internationally recognised brand name, Miniclip has successfully grown a global audience across 195 countries and six continents. It has a unique understanding of the games space, developing and distributing a strong portfolio of over 60 high-quality mobile games globally.

To date, Miniclip‚Äôs studios and companies have generated more than 10.5 billion downloads, including the following games 8 Ball Pool, Subway Surfers, Golf Battle, Football Strike, Carrom Pool, OSM - Online Soccer Manager‚Ñ¢, Football Rivals , Pure Sniper , Puzzle Page‚Ñ¢, Head Ball 2, Motorsport Manager, Darts of Fury, Ultimate Golf, Mini Football, Triple Match 3D‚Ñ¢, Agar.io, PowerWash Simulator, Sudoku.com‚Ñ¢, and We Are Warriors‚Ñ¢.

https//miniclip.com/
Show more
HTML:
Job Description

We are looking to hire a Data Analyst on a 12-month contract to add to the Product Analytics team!

Your goal is to deeply understand gamers‚Äô needs and prioritise their critical issues.

The Product Analytics team focuses on ensuring gamers are engaged with and return to the products. Your goal in this role will be to focus on and affect the parts of our games that will help us scale. Our current teams work on problems across multiple games, resulting in more gamers playing Miniclip games.

What will you be doing at Miniclip?

  • You‚Äôll derive actionable insights from data to inform product decisions, from improving our onboarding flow to driving game feature performance.
  • You‚Äôll help build conviction on high-value areas and challenge assumptions if there are faster or more effective ways to tackle a problem.
  • You‚Äôll partner with Product Managers, Game Designers, Game Developers and other Analysts to set success metrics and monitor the impact of new product features.
  • You‚Äôll contribute to the team environment where ideas are freely exchanged.
  • Using data to logically design and conduct A/B tests that lead to a better understanding of gamer behaviour.
  • You‚Äôll contribute to the broader Product Analytics goals, such as democratising data.

What are we looking for?

  • Evidence of delivering actionable insights that have led to positive results.
  • Ability to clearly and concisely explain key findings and give data-driven recommendations to technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  • Knowledge of SQL and ability to perform complex queries in non-relational databases.
  • Experience using Data Visualization Tools such as Looker.
  • Familiar with domain-specific programming languages such as R or Python.
  • Robust knowledge in mathematical areas relevant to the position statistics, hypothesis testing, etc.
  • Knowledge of games and the gaming industry. (not mandatory)
  • Experience of A/B testing. (not mandatory)

About Miniclip

Miniclip is a global leader in games and one of the world's biggest developers and publishers of mobile games, with a mission of unleashing the gamer in everyone. It distributes highly engaging games to a global audience of over 450 million monthly and 70 million daily active users across mobile, PC, console, social, and online platforms. Operating in 15 countries, Miniclip develops and launches games in multiple categories across its 22 studios.

Founded in 2001 with an internationally recognised brand name, Miniclip has successfully grown a global audience across 195 countries and six continents. It has a unique understanding of the games space, developing and distributing a strong portfolio of over 60 high-quality mobile games globally.

To date, Miniclip‚Äôs studios and companies have generated more than 10.5 billion downloads, including the following games 8 Ball Pool, Subway Surfers, Golf Battle, Football Strike, Carrom Pool, OSM - Online Soccer Manager‚Ñ¢, Football Rivals , Pure Sniper , Puzzle Page‚Ñ¢, Head Ball 2, Motorsport Manager, Darts of Fury, Ultimate Golf, Mini Football, Triple Match 3D‚Ñ¢, Agar.io, PowerWash Simulator, Sudoku.com‚Ñ¢, and We Are Warriors‚Ñ¢.

Title: Data Analyst Trainee - Real Assets
Description:
About The Job


Data is a strategic asset for BNP Paribas. It plays a fundamental role in the analysis of the teams‚Äô performance and evolution ultimately allowing to become more efficient and to contribute to the sustainability of the business model and the accurate selection of the bank‚Äôs assets. To be in control of data is crucial to enhance risk management, to reach right credit decisions and bring added value to the business
Based in Lisbon, the Trainee will join a team of professionals who are known for their sectorial knowledge and support the team


Your Main Activities Are


Input missing data on credit files for presentation to the Credit Committee
Ensure accuracy of credit data
Ensure consistency of data between different credit files
Communicate with the CPM Credit Analyst Teams aiming to get updates on progress of credit files
Ensure proper understanding of credit files to identify structured data to be inputted
Create and maintain standard procedures for data input (user guides)
Cooperate and communicate with the teams in charge of the golden source systems to ensure correct data in the source system
Produce periodic reports based on data collected and captured, providing clear analysis and interpretation


Profile And Skills To Success


Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Economics, Accounting or Management
Detail oriented with deep interest in data
Good knowledge of Excel
Good written/verbal communication skills in English (mandatory)
Ability to collaborate / teamwork
Efficient organizational and planning capacities
Self-starter, good initiative and flexible


About The Team


The Real Assets team includes a Coverage Relationship & Origination team, a Transaction & Execution team and a Credit Portfolio Management Team (CPM) spread across several countries serving the sector client in EMEA. These teams are split across Transportation (Shipping & Offshore, Aviation, Rail), Real Estate, Energy, Recourses & Infrastructure (ERI), Export, Leasing & Alternative Structuring. This transversality aims to provide a common training path, opportunities to explore other sectors, more efficiency and greater mobility


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centers providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Data Analyst Senior
Description:
Company Description

Inetum is a European leader in digital services. Inetum‚Äôs team of 28,000 consultants and specialists strive every day to make a digital impact for businesses, public sector entities and society. Inetum‚Äôs solutions aim at contributing to its clients‚Äô performance and innovation as well as the common good. Present in 19 countries with a dense network of sites, Inetum partners with major software publishers to meet the challenges of digital transformation with proximity and flexibility. Driven by its ambition for growth and scale, Inetum generated sales of 2.5 billion euros in 2023.

Job Description

Main tasks:


Analyses, plans, implements and technically tests IT solutions in the context of projects within the scope of the DataWarehouse.
Ensures the formalization and ensures that documentation is completed in accordance with current procedures.
Occasionally participates in meetings with the Business Areas and in working sessions with the team responsible for functional definition, carrying out certification/quality tests and monitoring UAT tests.
Proposes improvements to management platforms and tools, with the aim of optimizing and innovating them.
Formalize and documents the technical analyses it carries out, the technical solutions it implements, the technical tests it performs and the decision-making meetings it participates in.
Communicates and validates its activities and decisions with the person in charge, thus ensuring that they are aligned with the department's recommendations in terms of posture and Roadmap.
Reports to the Data Hub Chapter.


Qualifications

Technical Skills:


Knowledge of programming Microsoft BI Tolls
SQL/T-SQL
Power Bi
Jira/Confluence/ Draw IO
Knowledge of applications from a user perspective: MS Outlook, Word, Excel and PowerPoint
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Engineering, Information Technology or similar areas.
Experience in Datawarehouse solutions, with an understanding of all phases of construction.
Minimum of 6 years of experience in functional/technical analysis and definition of corporate data models.
Analytical skills and clear skills for conceptual designs that respond transversally to the Datawarehouse.
Experience in projects/environments with Agile framework.
Preference for experience in models with Data Vault methodology.
Preference for experience in the Banking area (consumer credit)


Language Skills


Portuguese
English


Additional Information

Soft skills:

Strong communication and organizational skills

Ability to gather requirements, document and lead meetings

Autonomy and proactivity. Critical thinking

Ability to synthesize and solve problems. Adaptability and resilience

Focus on the customer and delivering results

Title: Junior Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Semasio, a Samba TV company, is a dynamic global company with access to the world's most progressive audiences and the most comprehensive contextual platform available. Fortune 500 companies and emerging brands trust our industry-leading advertising solutions to increase reach, boost efficiency, and maximize ROI. Our team is located globally in the US, UK, Portugal, Germany, and Denmark.




We remain tight-knit across time zones through open communication and consistent collaboration. We care about cultivating an inclusive, approachable and ambitious culture while having fun along the way. We believe diversity fosters creativity, innovation and a sense of community. Join us in our mission to lead the privacy-first performance revolution. If this sparks your curiosity, then read on!




Are you passionate about turning data into insights? Do you have a keen eye for detail and a drive to optimize business performance? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you! We are looking for a Junior Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst to join our dynamic team in

Porto. In this role, you will play a key part in ensuring the accuracy, consistency, and efficiency of our data models and reports. Your contributions will directly impact strategic decision-making, providing stakeholders with critical insights to drive the company forward.




What You‚Äôll Do:
Maintain and update our BI data model, ensuring data integrity and accuracy.
Own specific monthly reports and updates, ensuring timely and precise delivery.
Work closely with different teams to understand reporting needs and enhance data quality.
Identify opportunities to improve data structures and reporting processes.
Assist in troubleshooting and resolving data inconsistencies or anomalies.
Support the development of new dashboards and analytics solutions.




What We‚Äôre Looking For:
Strong attention to detail‚Äînothing slips past you!
A problem-solving mindset with a passion for optimizing data processes.
Proficiency in SQL and experience with BI tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, Looker).
Basic understanding of data modeling concepts and database structures.
Strong communication skills, with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights.
A proactive attitude, always looking for ways to improve and streamline reporting.
A degree in Business, Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field is a plus.




Why Join Us?
Be part of a data-driven company that values innovation and continuous learning.
Work in a collaborative and supportive environment where your contributions matter.
Opportunity for professional growth and development in the exciting field of Business Intelligence.









Samba TV is an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.¬†¬†We strive to empower connection with one another, reflect the communities we serve, and tackle meaningful projects that make a real impact.




Samba TV may collect personal information directly from you, as a job applicant, Samba TV may also receive personal information from third parties, for example, in connection with a background, employment or reference check, under the applicable law.¬†For further details, please see Samba's¬†Applicant Privacy Policy.¬†For residents of the EU, Samba Inc. is the data controller.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
M/F










CHALLENGE:




As a Data Analyst, you will play a central role in supporting strategic planning and improving business analysis, predicting outcomes, and understanding complex data relationships.




Work closely with business users to understand the questions they want to answer with data, propose and design possible solutions, and work together with other teams to implement those solutions.







MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES:




Define, execute data analysis to make recommendations to support decision making
Collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders to formulate and complete full cycle analysis that includes data gathering, analysis, ongoing scaled deliverables and presentations
Develop and automate reports, and dashboards to provide insights at scale to define business priorities, and to provide valuable information to stakeholders and leadership
Verify, validate data accuracy and reports to provide a high quality of standards
Optimize Internal business processes to increase operational efficiency across all platforms
Contribute to building a strong data-driven culture.







PROFILE:




Degree in Mathematics, Economics, Engineering, or equivalent fields of study
A professional with +3 years of experience with data analytics
Interest and experience in data, metrics, analysis, and trends and applied knowledge of measurement, statistics, and program evaluation
Experienced in leveraging data and analytics to solve real-world problems and create new solutions. This requires a strong understanding of business processes and data flows.
Experience with Excel, Power BI and SQL
Familiarity in Python to the extent of delivering the same analysis you could do in SQL and a BI tool, and knowledge of Algorithms in Retail is a nice-to-have
An excellent communicator with presentation skills
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment
Critical thinking
Problem-solving aptitude.
Show more
HTML:
M/F




CHALLENGE:


As a Data Analyst, you will play a central role in supporting strategic planning and improving business analysis, predicting outcomes, and understanding complex data relationships.


Work closely with business users to understand the questions they want to answer with data, propose and design possible solutions, and work together with other teams to implement those solutions.



MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES:


  • Define, execute data analysis to make recommendations to support decision making
  • Collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders to formulate and complete full cycle analysis that includes data gathering, analysis, ongoing scaled deliverables and presentations
  • Develop and automate reports, and dashboards to provide insights at scale to define business priorities, and to provide valuable information to stakeholders and leadership
  • Verify, validate data accuracy and reports to provide a high quality of standards
  • Optimize Internal business processes to increase operational efficiency across all platforms
  • Contribute to building a strong data-driven culture.



PROFILE:


  • Degree in Mathematics, Economics, Engineering, or equivalent fields of study
  • A professional with +3 years of experience with data analytics
  • Interest and experience in data, metrics, analysis, and trends and applied knowledge of measurement, statistics, and program evaluation
  • Experienced in leveraging data and analytics to solve real-world problems and create new solutions. This requires a strong understanding of business processes and data flows.
  • Experience with Excel, Power BI and SQL
  • Familiarity in Python to the extent of delivering the same analysis you could do in SQL and a BI tool, and knowledge of Algorithms in Retail is a nice-to-have
  • An excellent communicator with presentation skills
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment
  • Critical thinking
  • Problem-solving aptitude.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst (f/m/d)




As a Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in supporting our in-house digital agency team by analysing and interpreting data to drive strategic decision-making.

Your primary responsibility will be to develop and maintain comprehensive dashboards on PowerBI, providing actionable insights and recommendations based on data analysis. You will integrate a data team and collaborate closely with the digital marketing team to identify key performance indicators (KPIs), track campaign performance, and uncover opportunities for optimization.

Youe role in our team




‚Ä¢ Collaborate with the digital marketing team to identify data requirements, KPIs, and reporting needs.

‚Ä¢ Develop and maintain interactive dashboards on PowerBI to track KPIs, campaign performance and overall business goals.

‚Ä¢ Perform in-depth analysis of data to identify trends, patterns, and actionable insights.

‚Ä¢ Conduct ad hoc analysis to answer specific business questions and support decision-making.

‚Ä¢ Create data visualisations, reports, and presentations to effectively communicate findings and recommendations to experts.

‚Ä¢ Monitor data quality, identify data discrepancies, and work with relevant teams to ensure data accuracy and consistency.

‚Ä¢ Stay up to date with industry trends, best practices, and emerging tools in data analysis, visualization, and reporting.

Your profile:




‚Ä¢ Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, and analyse significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.

‚Ä¢ Proficiency in creating interactive dashboards and reports using PowerBi.

‚Ä¢ Knowledge on Python and SQL for data extraction, manipulation and automation is highly desirable.

‚Ä¢ Knowledge on Databricks and Microsoft fabric is a plus.

‚Ä¢ Familiarity with digital marketing concepts, metrics and platforms (e.g., LinkedIn Ads and Google Analytics) is a plus.

‚Ä¢ Excellent communication skills with the ability to present complex data findings in a clear and concise manner to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

‚Ä¢ Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently or collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.

Your benefits

We offer you:

‚Ä¢ Possibility of Working from Home ‚Äì we care about results not locations;

‚Ä¢ Training Budget for each employee ‚Äì we care about the growth of our people;

‚Ä¢ Private Health Insurance ‚Äì we care about health on and off working hours;

‚Ä¢ 3 Additional Vacation Days ‚Äì we care about free time;

‚Ä¢ Cooking, sports or book club ‚Äì we care about spending time with our folks;

‚Ä¢ Fresh fruits ‚Äì we care about your daily dose of vitamins;

‚Ä¢ Fresh coffee, tea or water ‚Äì we care about boosting your day.

‚Ä¢ A home for passionate people who innovate, collaborate and love what they do;




An environment where the team thinks and acts entrepreneurial;

An international and dynamic working atmosphere with cross-functional teams;

The opportunity to take more responsibility and develop your career.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:




DECSKILL TALENT: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.
DECSKILL BOOST: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.
DECSKILL CONNECT: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.




At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.




We are searching for a Data Analyst!




Responsibilities:

Create business-facing dashboards and high impact data visualizations and analyses with complex data structures which will support BNP Paribas internal or external clients achieve their objectives in terms of revenue generation, efficiency creation, production levels and risk management.
Collaborate with internal/external clients to best understand their operational and strategic needs.
Creative descriptive, predictive and quantitative analyses addressing key business priorities and supporting the stakeholder‚Äôs decision making.
Support and monitor the run of these activities of data analysis, reporting, and data mining.




Requirements:

Data knowledge / Data processing / Data quality / IT Development
Database Management (SQL)
Methodologies (Agile)
Office Pack (MS Excel)
Power BI / Tableau
English required, both spoken and written.




If you‚Äôre interested in this job, please send your CV to cesaltina.abreu@decskill.com or with reference ‚ÄúDataAnalyst‚Äù.




Thank You! üòä




Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being

  • Support and monitor the run of these activities of data analysis, reporting and data mining.
  • Contribute to disseminate a culture of data driven solutions.


If you‚Äôre interested in this job please send your CV to carolina.novais@decskill.com with reference CN/DAP.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
ü§îWho are we?




As the founding entity of RAINBOW PARTNERS, Quanteam is a consulting firm specializing in the fields of Banking, Finance, and Financial Services. Guided by our core values of closeness, teamwork, diversity, and excellence, our team of 980 expert consultants, representing 35 different nationalities, collaborates across 10 international offices: Paris, Lyon, New York, Montreal, London, Brussels, Geneva, Lisbon, Porto and Casablanca. Committed to sustainability (Ecovadis Gold), diversity (gender index: 92%), and quality of work life (Best Workplace Experience), Quanteam is a forward-thinking enterprise.




üöÄ Our Expertise




With a dual expertise in both business and IT, Quanteam supports its corporate clients (investment banks, asset management companies, private and retail banks, custodians, etc.) across the entire Front-to-Back spectrum in evolving their business activities and transformation projects.







Our teams are organized into 5 expertise areas:




‚û° Quantitative Finance

‚û° Risk, Compliance, and Regulatory

‚û° Operations and Finance

‚û° Transformation and Organization

‚û° Information Systems




In 2023, Quanteam generated a revenue of ‚Ç¨74.6 million.







üîéWe are looking for a Data Analyst







MAIN TASKS:




Create business-facing dashboards and high impact data visualizations and analyses with complex data structures which will support internal or external clients achieve their objectives in terms of revenue generation, efficiency creation, production levels and risk management;
Collaborate with internal/external clients to best understand their operational and strategic needs.
Create descriptive, predictive and quantitative analyses addressing key business priorities and supporting the stakeholder‚Äôs decision making.
Support and monitor the run of these activities of data analysis, reporting, and data mining.




YOUR PROFILE AND SKILLS:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in fields such as computer science, data science, or related fields.
Experience with data knowledge/data processing/data quality
Experience with Database Management (SQL)
Experience with Power BI and Tableau
Excellent communication skills and the ability to work in a team.
Fluency in English (written and spoken).
Hybrid role based in Porto.







üöÄIf you feel this opportunity is for you, send your CV and join our team!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:




Decskill Talent: We believe that our people are key to our success.

Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.




Decskill Boost: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.




Decskill Connect: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.




At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.




We are looking for a Data Analyst for a remote position from Portugal:




What we are looking for (mandatory):




Skilled in data visualization tools such as Power BI and Looker Studio to create clear, actionable reports and dashboards
Experience in Text Mining techniques to extract insights from unstructured data

Expertise in the full ETL process, ensuring data is clean, structured, and ready for analysis and decision-making

Strong working knowledge of GA4, providing in-depth insights into user behavior and marketing performance
Strong collaborative skills, fostering teamwork and cross-functional partnerships to achieve shared goals
Committed to maintaining high standards of integrity and trustworthiness in all professional interactions
High adaptability and a solution-oriented mindset
Focused on continuous learning and improvement, with a drive for excellence and delivering high-quality results
Excellent written and spoken English skills.




If you‚Äôre interested in this job, please send your CV to estefania.rodrigues@decskill.com




Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Data Analyst Mid
Description:
Data Analyst (f/m/d)

As a Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in supporting our in-house digital agency team by analysing and interpreting data to drive strategic decision-making.

Your primary responsibility will be to develop and maintain comprehensive dashboards on PowerBI, providing actionable insights and recommendations based on data analysis. You will integrate a data team and collaborate closely with the digital marketing team to identify key performance indicators (KPIs), track campaign performance, and uncover opportunities for optimization.

You Will Be Responsible For



Collaborate with the digital marketing team to identify data requirements, KPIs, and reporting needs.
Develop and maintain interactive dashboards on PowerBI to track KPIs, campaign performance and overall business goals.
Perform in-depth analysis of data to identify trends, patterns, and actionable insights.
Conduct ad hoc analysis to answer specific business questions and support decision-making.
Create data visualisations, reports, and presentations to effectively communicate findings and recommendations to experts.
Monitor data quality, identify data discrepancies, and work with relevant teams to ensure data accuracy and consistency.
Stay up to date with industry trends, best practices, and emerging tools in data analysis, visualization, and reporting.



Your Profile



Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, and analyse significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Proficiency in creating interactive dashboards and reports using PowerBi.
Knowledge on Python and SQL for data extraction, manipulation and automation is highly desirable.
Knowledge on Databricks and Microsoft fabric is a plus.
Familiarity with digital marketing concepts, metrics and platforms (e.g., LinkedIn Ads and Google Analytics) is a plus.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to present complex data findings in a clear and concise manner to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently or collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.



Benefits + Application

We Offer You



Possibility of Working from Home ‚Äì we care about results not locations;
Training Budget for each employee ‚Äì we care about the growth of our people;
Private Health Insurance ‚Äì we care about health on and off working hours;
3 Additional Vacation Days ‚Äì we care about free time;
Cooking, sports or book club ‚Äì we care about spending time with our folks;
Fresh fruits ‚Äì we care about your daily dose of vitamins;
Fresh coffee, tea or water ‚Äì we care about boosting your day.
A home for passionate people who innovate, collaborate and love what they do;



An environment where the team thinks and acts entrepreneurial;

An international and dynamic working atmosphere with cross-functional teams;

The opportunity to take more responsibility and develop your career.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst (1 Year Maternity Cover)

‚Ç¨40,000 - ‚Ç¨45,000 + 10% bonus + benefits

Porto (2 days per week in the office)




Our client




Our client is a global strategic technology and payments partner. They deliver seamless personalised shopping experiences to over 29m international shoppers, who in turn generate ‚Ç¨22.9bn revenue.




With 2,000 employees spread across 50 countries, they integrate with 300,000 point of sale systems in a number of luxury retailers and brands including Harrods, Selfridges, John Lewis, Liberty‚Äôs, Apple, Cartier, De Beers, Herm√®s, Rolex, Dior and Jimmy Choo.




Their products include tax-free shopping, smart data and intelligence, marketing and sales, POS technology and payment solutions.




The role




The Data Analyst will help the business to understand customer needs and behaviours through the analysis of complex data sets and subsequent translation into meaningful, shareable insights and stories.




This role will be hands on with building visualisations in Tableau and ad hoc analysis (using SQL) to inform the optimisation of products and features.




As a Data Analyst, you will:




Monitor and report on key KPIs.
Deep-dive (using SQL) into customer data to provide product teams with detailed customer analysis.
Be hands-on with building visualisations in Tableau.
Identify data requirements, working with international data teams to ensure data is cleansed and prepared.
Support with the identification of new and innovative ways to leverage data to deliver new customer engagement opportunities, optimise channels and deliver economic efficiency.
Deliver enhanced customer profiling and segmentation.
Measure the effectiveness of customer-facing products, features and campaigns.
Provide ad-hoc analysis to inform the optimisation of customer-facing products, features and campaigns.
Advise on how advanced statistical and analytical techniques can further improve the understanding of customers.




To apply, you should have




Experience working as a Data Analyst with good exposure to statistical methodologies.
Intermediate SQL skills.
Advanced experience with Tableau (or a similar tool).
Advanced Excel skills.
Proven experience delivering impactful and actionable insights with a B2C environment.




Match Digital specialises in connecting talented individuals with businesses in the digital, tech, media and marcomms industries.

Title: Data Analyst (f/m/div)
Description:
Are you a data-oriented person with good stakeholder management skills? Do you want to play a role in the future of our Communications & Public Policy Data & Insights team? With your reporting knowledge and data processes savviness, combined with a solid track record of BI solutions deployment, you will be a valuable addition to our company! Apply now and become part of an innovative team within a strategic-minded department!

Job Description

As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for developing and delivering state-of-the-art data solutions. You will act as a consultant towards several stakeholders, partnering up with counterparts across different areas in order to translate business needs into fact-based solutions.

In your new role, you will:


Analyze and interpret data to uncover trends and correlations, using storytelling to share your insights with non-technical stakeholders
Create powerful visualizations to support targeted projects and overall strategic initiatives
Develop sustainable self-service data solutions such as dashboards, enabling data-driven decision-making
Own and handle assigned solutions, namely by troubleshooting & bug-fixing, enhancing & maintaining features throughout life-cycle, enabling & supporting end-users, as well as managing involved stakeholders and relevant communication flows
Provide consultancy and training on data-related matters
Trend-scout regularly in order to ensure our solutions portfolio is up-to-date, efficient, and adjusted to the requirements
Support Communications & Public Policy as well as business in taking better, faster, fact-based decisions, driving our digital transformation further


Your Profile

You are proactive, result-oriented and have a structured and self-driven working style. Your strong communication skills allow you to build and leverage solid relations and cooperate with different stakeholders. Furthermore, you have strong analytical skills combined with the ability to develop user-friendly BI solutions to support decision-makers.

You are best equipped for this task if you have:


A University degree in Business Administration, Communication Science, Information Technology, or similar field of studies
1+ years of analytics working experience ‚Äì ideally linked to Communications & Public Policy
Concrete knowledge and understanding of reporting solutions & data analysis process, as well as proven experience in identifying trends and visualizing data in order to build value-add solutions
BI software proficiency ‚Äì both on data flows and visualization ends - preferably Tableau
Analytical and conceptual skills, combined with hands-on spirit and outstanding planning capacity
Team spirit, high attention to detail and stakeholder management experience, preferably in globally operating organizations
Fluency in English


Please send us your CV in English.

Contact:

Regan Lottering , LinkedIn

#WeAreIn for driving decarbonization and digitalization.

As a global leader in semiconductor solutions in power systems and IoT, Infineon enables game-changing solutions for green and efficient energy, clean and safe mobility, as well as smart and secure IoT. Together, we drive innovation and customer success, while caring for our people and empowering them to reach ambitious goals. Be a part of making life easier, safer and greener.

Are you in?


Welcome to Infineon Technologies Business Solutions in Porto! - Infineon Technologies Business Solutions is a vibrant global hub, driven by diverse talents and an operational culture of excellence, in a privileged geographic location. The team of more than 25 nationalities works together in a dynamic, diverse, and inclusive environment. We lead innovation and digital transformation, shaping the future of Infineon Technologies. At the heart of everything we do, people matter most. Our ultimate goal is to craft a unique experience for both our customers and employees.


At our site, you will find a range of diverse teams that have built a reputation for delivering high-quality services for all Infineon in Finance, Procurement, Human Resources, IT, Audit, Legal, Compliance, Business Continuity and Sustainability, Cyber Security, Communication, Corporate Supply Chain Logistics and Sales & Marketing. Porto is a powerhouse of ideas and solutions, a key player in the global company‚Äôs puzzle, delivering specialized services and innovative solutions.

Together, Infineon Technologies Business Solutions will continue to shape the future, driving innovation and excellence for years to come.

At Communications & Public Policy (CP), we strengthen Infineon's position as the world's leading semiconductor manufacturer for energy systems and IoT, targeting our internal and external stakeholders. Thereby, we significantly contribute to the company's vision of driving decarbonization and digitalization together.

In short, as a global CP team, that operates at Infineon's largest sites worldwide, we strengthen Infineon's reputation and internal identification. In an increasingly challenging economic, technological and political environment, we make Infineon's key role in innovative semiconductor technologies visible and create confidence in a sustainable future.

Click here for more information about Communications & Public Policy.

We are on a journey to create the best Infineon for everyone.

This means we embrace diversity and inclusion and welcome everyone for who they are. At Infineon, we offer a working environment characterized by trust, openness, respect and tolerance and are committed to give all applicants and employees equal opportunities. We base our recruiting decisions on the applicant¬¥s experience and skills.

We look forward to receiving your resume, even if you do not entirely meet all the requirements of the job posting.

Please let your recruiter know if they need to pay special attention to something in order to enable your participation in the interview process.

Click here for more information about Diversity & Inclusion at Infineon.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Mutual Respect, Empathy, Innovation and Professional Pride. Do you see yourself within these values?

Founded in 2006 under the mission "To Challenge Complexity", Closer Consulting is a Data Science company specialized in Business Intelligence, Advanced Analytics and Artificial Intelligence.

By developing projects in the most diverse industries ‚Äì Banking, Telecommunications, Health, Retail, Energy, Insurance or Aviation - we analyze data, transforming it into knowledge for our clients, allowing them to adopt the best decision-making for their respective organizations and businesses.

We are now looking for a Data Analyst willing to accept new challenges in our Closer team.


For this position you need to have residency in Portugal.


Are you the one?


Between 3-6 years of experience in Data Analytics and/or similar roles.
Data Knowledge: Data processing, quality, and IT development.
Database Management: Strong SQL proficiency.
Methodologies: Agile.
Office Pack: Advanced MS Excel.
Data Visualization: Power BI / Tableau.
English (C1/C2) is mandatory, and French is a plus.
Business/IT Relationship Management.
Strong Analytical Ability.
Collaboration and Teamwork.
Attention to Detail & Rigor.


We Believe We Are The Ones Too, By


Providing a Multidisciplinary Team;
Giving a home office kit, with everything you need to perform remotely;
Ensuring a career plan alongside with professional growth;
Providing you with a custom training plan;
Helping you reach happiness.


Oh‚Ä¶ And By The Way, We Also Have


Several challenging complex projects;
Stimulating teams and leaders;
World-class Clients and Partners.


If you believe in this match as much as we do, send us your CV and reach the closest side of life.

Closer is a company that values diversity and inclusion. We are committed to fostering an environment where everyone is treated with dignity and respect, regardless of race, gender, beliefs, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other personal characteristics. At Closer, we embrace the unique perspectives and experiences that everyone brings, and we believe that it is a fundamental driver for the success we've achieved.

Title: Insights Analyst
Description:
Company Description:

BrandDelta empowers companies around the world to transform the way their Brands can learn and win. Our Brand Intelligence platform is built to enable our clients to understand how consumers perceive their brands faster, deeper and in a more actionable manner with measurable links. We are already optimizing ¬£550m of marketing investment to help Brands Grow across 3 continents. BrandDelta has ambitious plans for growth, with Porto marked as the centre for our team growth and development. Our Founders have a history building globally awarded AI businesses (e.g. achieving a top-10 Gartner rating for AI-led insight in 2020 and 2021) and investing heavily back into the Team & the Business.




Role Description:

As an Insights Analyst,¬†you will play pivotal role in turning our unique data into compelling insights & stories to attract & engage with Marketing, Brand, and Leadership teams in Global Consumer & D2C organizations. We are developing and integrating a corpus of cross-channel digital signals from social, search, web, reviews and offline survey datasets to uncover insights, to help our clients & new prospects succeed in the 21st Century marketing.




In this role, you will be responsible for collaborating with our Data & AI team here in Porto in undertaking strategic and ongoing research to scale our platform & Develop Insights from the Product Category you will be working on. You will typically take ownership of a number categories & clients, whilst identifying compelling & topical insights.

You will play client facing and report to our Insights team + Leadership in order to ensure a successful link between the relationship and insights




Requirements

Undergraduate or higher degree in Business, Economics, Social Sciences, from a reputable University with a strong academic performance
Autonomous and willing to take the ownership on their own projects
Proven experience in conducting research & understanding various research methodologies
Data driven & literate (data analysis, vlookups, correlational analysis, pivots etc.)
Strong storytelling & presentation skills
A track record of writing plans and designing research
Culturally plugged in and literate in modern media from a user & industry perspective
Sharp thinker and crisp communicator ‚Äì able to synthesize complex problems to senior leaders
Ability to synthesize large amounts of information - and translate into an easily understood story
This is a client facing role and candidates must be comfortable in this environment




Preferred Skills/Experience:

Experience in Consumer / Marketing insights with the ability to apply knowledge of and passion for digital, social, mobile media, and other new platforms to provide insight and evaluation that helps clients build stronger consumer connections.
Pricing, Promotions, Marketing Insight are a huge plus
Consumer Insights background in Marketing research outfit such as Kantar, IPSOS, or similar is also preferred.
Ability to explain findings and recommendations to a broad business audience, both internal and external
Educated on a variety of analytical methods, shapes thinking and influences decisions
Effectively complete tasks to achieve both short- and long-term goals within a team




What we offer:

Career Acceleration - Fast growth with many opportunities both in the AI-led software and business domains, with board-level clients.
Health Insurance
Flexible Work Hours - adjust your schedule to your needs
Work Setup - Hybrid ‚Äì Work from home but also collaborate weekly with the team
Hardware and software for remote setup
Autonomy and Ownership Culture
Continuous feedback culture
Innovation Mindset

HTML:
Company Description:

BrandDelta empowers companies around the world to transform the way their Brands can learn and win. Our Brand Intelligence platform is built to enable our clients to understand how consumers perceive their brands faster, deeper and in a more actionable manner with measurable links. We are already optimizing ¬£550m of marketing investment to help Brands Grow across 3 continents. BrandDelta has ambitious plans for growth, with Porto marked as the centre for our team growth and development. Our Founders have a history building globally awarded AI businesses (e.g. achieving a top-10 Gartner rating for AI-led insight in 2020 and 2021) and investing heavily back into the Team & the Business.


Role Description:

As an Insights Analyst, you will play pivotal role in turning our unique data into compelling insights & stories to attract & engage with Marketing, Brand, and Leadership teams in Global Consumer & D2C organizations. We are developing and integrating a corpus of cross-channel digital signals from social, search, web, reviews and offline survey datasets to uncover insights, to help our clients & new prospects succeed in the 21st Century marketing.


In this role, you will be responsible for collaborating with our Data & AI team here in Porto in undertaking strategic and ongoing research to scale our platform & Develop Insights from the Product Category you will be working on. You will typically take ownership of a number categories & clients, whilst identifying compelling & topical insights.

You will play client facing and report to our Insights team + Leadership in order to ensure a successful link between the relationship and insights


Requirements

  • Undergraduate or higher degree in Business, Economics, Social Sciences, from a reputable University with a strong academic performance
  • Autonomous and willing to take the ownership on their own projects
  • Proven experience in conducting research & understanding various research methodologies
  • Data driven & literate (data analysis, vlookups, correlational analysis, pivots etc.)
  • Strong storytelling & presentation skills
  • A track record of writing plans and designing research
  • Culturally plugged in and literate in modern media from a user & industry perspective
  • Sharp thinker and crisp communicator ‚Äì able to synthesize complex problems to senior leaders
  • Ability to synthesize large amounts of information - and translate into an easily understood story
  • This is a client facing role and candidates must be comfortable in this environment


Preferred Skills/Experience:

  • Experience in Consumer / Marketing insights with the ability to apply knowledge of and passion for digital, social, mobile media, and other new platforms to provide insight and evaluation that helps clients build stronger consumer connections.
  • Pricing, Promotions, Marketing Insight are a huge plus
  • Consumer Insights background in Marketing research outfit such as Kantar, IPSOS, or similar is also preferred.
  • Ability to explain findings and recommendations to a broad business audience, both internal and external
  • Educated on a variety of analytical methods, shapes thinking and influences decisions
  • Effectively complete tasks to achieve both short- and long-term goals within a team


What we offer:

  • Career Acceleration - Fast growth with many opportunities both in the AI-led software and business domains, with board-level clients.
  • Health Insurance
  • Flexible Work Hours - adjust your schedule to your needs
  • Work Setup - Hybrid ‚Äì Work from home but also collaborate weekly with the team
  • Hardware and software for remote setup
  • Autonomy and Ownership Culture
  • Continuous feedback culture
  • Innovation Mindset

Title: Forecast and Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

MIR Insight forecasts demand and price developments in the materials industry, enabling companies to reduce waste and minimize losses. We are a fast-growing tech startup serving leading industry players such as K.D. Feddersen, Maral Overseas Ltd, and Jobachem, supported by international investors. Our goal is to provide our users with innovative, reliable, and user-friendly software. Join us on our mission to transform the manufacturing supply chain into a highly efficient, sustainable, and near-predictive economy.


Your Mission

Ensure that our clients receive the most accurate, relevant, and actionable forecasts‚Äîdelivered on time, clearly explained, and tailored to their business needs. You will be part of a small, high-impact forecasting team working closely with data scientists, product engineers, and customers across Europe, the U.S., and India.


What You‚Äôll Do

Ingest, clean, and structure customer data to prepare it for forecasting
Analyze forecast outputs, validate them against industry logic and trends
Ensure timely and high-quality delivery of forecasts to all clients
Continuously monitor model performance and help push the boundaries of forecasting accuracy
Translate technical forecasts into clear, understandable business insights
Collaborate with customers to understand their planning needs and business goals
Document experiments, iterations, and customer-specific improvements
Proactively identify risks, outliers, or new opportunities in the data
Contribute to automation and process improvements to enhance team efficiency
Support the product team with structured feedback from customer use




What We‚Äôre Looking For

2‚Äì5 years experience in a management consultant, data analyst, BI, or applied statistics role
Strong analytical mindset and a passion for solving complex, real-world problems
Experience working with time series, forecasting, or econometric data
Solid skills in Python, R, or SQL ‚Äî and a knack for fast data wrangling
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English
Business intuition: you understand that numbers are only useful if they drive decisions
Bonus: experience with supply chains, pricing models, or industrial production data


What We Offer

The chance to shape the future of how companies plan and forecast
A high-performance, founder-led team and fast-paced startup culture
Competitive salary with potential equity upside
Flexible working setup
Opportunity to grow into a Lead Analyst or Customer Strategy role as we scale

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
We‚Äôre the world‚Äôs leading data, insights, and consulting company; we shape the brands of tomorrow by better understanding people everywhere.

Our Functions teams are right at the centre of our business, making sure we can always get better, every day. Supporting the business with things like Marketing, Human Resources, Finance, Legal and Technology, our Functions colleagues are skilled professionals whose role it is to ensure we continue to become an indispensable partner to brands everywhere.

Job Details

About the BI Team: The Kantar BI team is a dynamic, integrated function that delivers expert data tools and insights to Finance across Kantar. Our primary focus is to empower business teams with seamless access to high-quality data while managing best-in-class business intelligence solutions. By enhancing data quality and streamlining BI processes, we drive operational excellence and elevate the overall business experience.

Why this job is important

As a Business Intelligence Analyst within Kantar‚Äôs BI team, you will play a key role in executing and supporting the company‚Äôs business intelligence strategy. Reporting directly to the BI Manager, you will be responsible for delivering high-quality reporting, analytics, and data-driven insights that align with strategic objectives. Your contributions will help transform raw data into valuable business intelligence, whether through reports, analyses, or by enhancing the team‚Äôs existing BI assets.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing


Project Ownership: Take charge of assigned projects, ensuring alignment with team priorities and strategic goals. Oversee the entire delivery process from inception to completion, adhering to deadlines and maintaining quality standards.
Data Analysis & Reporting: Create and sustain strategic dashboards, offering data-driven insights regarding performance across all financial dimensions.
Stakeholder Management: Manage stakeholder expectations throughout the project lifecycle. Provide regular updates on project progress, address concerns, and ensure deliverables meet stakeholder requirements.
Advanced Analytics Support: Facilitate the application of advanced analytics models, such as forecasting, collaborating with the BI Manager to ensure new models are seamlessly incorporated into existing systems and processes.
Continuous Improvement: Contribute to continuous improvement initiatives by identifying areas for process optimization and innovation. Support the team‚Äôs efforts to enhance reporting and analytics capabilities by facilitating automation of reporting with BI Tools.
Collaboration & Communication: Work closely with all team members to ensure effective collaboration. Communicate effectively to ensure alignment on project goals and deliverables.
Training & Education: Participate in training and education programs to enhance your BI skills and knowledge. Support the broader team‚Äôs efforts to promote a data-driven culture within the organisation.


The Skills & Experience Needed As Business Intelligence Analyst


Educational Background: Bachelor‚Äôs degree in business administration, engineering, data science, computer science, or a related field.
Experience: Previous experience in a business intelligence, data analysis, or similar role.
Technical Skills: Proficiency in BI tools (such as Power BI, Tableau, or MicroStrategy), data analysis techniques, and proficiency in Excel. Familiarity with ERP Reporting Platforms (Maconomy, SAP, Oracle) is a plus.
Analytical Skills: Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data and provide actionable insights.
Task Management: Ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously, ensuring timely delivery and alignment with team priorities.
Communication Skills: Strong written and verbal communication skills in English, with the ability to engage effectively with senior stakeholders.
Problem-Solving: A proactive approach to problem-solving, with the ability to identify challenges and develop effective solutions.
Collaboration: A team player with the ability to work effectively in a cross-functional environment.


What‚Äôs In It For You


Flexible hybrid working
Up to 25 days off, plus your birthday off and two days paid for volunteering
Meal card and flexible benefits where you are allocated funds to spend on a variety of benefits such as transport cost, education related and more


Country

Portugal

Why join Kantar?

We shape the brands of tomorrow by better understanding people everywhere. By understanding people, we can understand what drives their decisions, actions, and aspirations on a global scale. And by amplifying our in-depth expertise of human understanding alongside ground-breaking technology, we can help brands find concrete insights that will help them succeed in our fast-paced, ever shifting world.

And because we know people, we like to make sure our own people are being looked after as well. Equality of opportunity for everyone is our highest priority and we support our colleagues to work in a way that supports their health and wellbeing. While we encourage teams to spend part of their working week in the office, we understand no one size fits all; our approach is flexible to ensure everybody feels included, accepted, and that we can win together. We‚Äôre dedicated to creating an inclusive culture and value the diversity of our people, clients, suppliers and communities, and we encourage applications from all backgrounds and sections of society. Even if you feel like you‚Äôre not an exact match, we‚Äôd love to receive your application and talk to you about this job or others at Kantar.

Title: Finance Data Analyst
Description:
Decskill was founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company and their main mission is to delivery value through the knowledge. We enable companies to meet the chalenges of digital world by providing our clients with business models that ensure technological capacity, flexibility and agility. We are more than 500 consultants with offices in Lisbon, Porto and Madrid.




DECSKILL operates in 3 main areas:

DECSKILL TALENT, through which we provide our clients with an extension to their IT teams;




DECSKILL BOOST, through which we provide our client with software development models to increase capacity and optimize Time-to-Market, where we create and manage teams that deliver according to their needs, at the desired speed;




DECSKILL CONNECT, through which we provide our client with consulting services, as well as the implementation and management of information technology infrastructures.




Our practice results in the creation of value for our customers, either by delivering qualified and value-added services, or through highly qualified and motivated professionals, as well as technology solutions that allow us to operate and transform the business of our customers.




We are looking for an Finance Data Analyst!




Responsibilities:

Analyse and interpret financial data focusing on IFRS13.
Developing analytical models for Position, PnL and Mark to Market, valuation etc.
Build and maintain financial data transformation & reports and dashboards for internal stakeholders.
Maintain finance master data governance model. ¬∑ Ensure data accuracy and support automation of recurring reporting tasks.




Requirements:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in finance, Accounting, Economics, or a related field. ¬∑ 1‚Äì3 years of experience in financial or data analysis.
Working knowledge of IFRS 13 and financial instrument valuation. ¬∑ Strong analytical mindset and attention to detail.
Advanced Excel (formulas, pivot tables, Power Query).
SQL for querying and managing financial datasets. ¬∑ Basic knowledge of AI models related to Finance is a Plus.
Power BI or Qlik sense or Open source (Apache Superset..) for data visualization and reporting.
Familiarity with financial systems or market data platforms (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters) is a plus
Proficiency in English.




If you‚Äôre interested in this job, please send your CV to cesaltina.abreu@decskill.com with reference ‚ÄúCA/FinanceDataAnalyst‚Äù.




Thank You! üòä




Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being
