HTML:
Decskill was founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company and their main mission is to delivery value through the knowledge. We enable companies to meet the chalenges of digital world by providing our clients with business models that ensure technological capacity, flexibility and agility. We are more than 500 consultants with offices in Lisbon, Porto and Madrid.


DECSKILL operates in 3 main areas:

  • DECSKILL TALENT, through which we provide our clients with an extension to their IT teams;


  • DECSKILL BOOST, through which we provide our client with software development models to increase capacity and optimize Time-to-Market, where we create and manage teams that deliver according to their needs, at the desired speed;


  • DECSKILL CONNECT, through which we provide our client with consulting services, as well as the implementation and management of information technology infrastructures.


Our practice results in the creation of value for our customers, either by delivering qualified and value-added services, or through highly qualified and motivated professionals, as well as technology solutions that allow us to operate and transform the business of our customers.


We are looking for an Finance Data Analyst!


Responsibilities:

  • Analyse and interpret financial data focusing on IFRS13.
  • Developing analytical models for Position, PnL and Mark to Market, valuation etc.
  • Build and maintain financial data transformation & reports and dashboards for internal stakeholders.
  • Maintain finance master data governance model. ¬∑ Ensure data accuracy and support automation of recurring reporting tasks.


Requirements:

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in finance, Accounting, Economics, or a related field. ¬∑ 1‚Äì3 years of experience in financial or data analysis.
  • Working knowledge of IFRS 13 and financial instrument valuation. ¬∑ Strong analytical mindset and attention to detail.
  • Advanced Excel (formulas, pivot tables, Power Query).
  • SQL for querying and managing financial datasets. ¬∑ Basic knowledge of AI models related to Finance is a Plus.
  • Power BI or Qlik sense or Open source (Apache Superset..) for data visualization and reporting.
  • Familiarity with financial systems or market data platforms (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters) is a plus
  • Proficiency in English.


If you‚Äôre interested in this job, please send your CV to cesaltina.abreu@decskill.com with reference ‚ÄúCA/FinanceDataAnalyst‚Äù.


Thank You! üòä


Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being

Title: Data Analyst | Retail
Description:
Make an impact by working for sectors where technology is the enabler, everything is ground-breaking and there‚Äôs a constant need to be innovative.

Create and enhance projects in Java, Python, Angular, PHP, .NET and so much more while diving in the world of Blockchain, Artificial Intelligence, Data Science, Security and Internet of Things.

Be part of the team that combines business knowledge, technological edge and a design experience. Our different backgrounds and know-how are key in developing solutions and experiences for digital clients.

Face challenges and learn other ways of thinking and seeing the world - there‚Äôs always room for your energy and creativity.

About The Role

A Data Analyst is responsible for examining and interpreting complex data sets to derive meaningful insights and support business decision-making. Focused on descriptive and diagnostic analytics to answer questions of where your company has been, where it is now, why things are the way they are now and support the decision about what are the next steps.

Their mission involves organizing data, conducting statistical analysis, creating data models, and collecting data requirements from Business.

Data analysts collaborate with different teams to understand their analytical requirements, identify key metrics, and communicate data-driven findings to stakeholders effectively.

As a part of your job, you will:


Gathering and analyzing business requirements to determine the best solution for data reporting and analysis.
Designing data solutions such as data warehousing, data marts, dashboards, and reporting systems.
Developing and maintaining data models, reports, and visualizations.
Collaborating with IT teams to ensure proper data integration and management.
Assisting stakeholders in interpreting data insights and making informed business decisions.



What are we looking for?


Retail experience;
At least 8 years of experience in data analysis, with a demonstrated track record of delivering actionable insights and driving business impact;
Proficiency in SQL for data querying and analysis;
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, or matplotlib);
Knowledge of statistical analysis techniques and tools (e.g., R, Python libraries like pandas);
Ability to interpret and analyze complex data sets;
Familiarity with data cleansing and preparation techniques.



Personal traits


Ability to adapt to different contexts, teams, and Clients;
Teamwork skills but also a sense of autonomy;
Motivation for international projects and ok if travel is included;
Willingness to collaborate with other players;
Strong communication skills.



At Celfocus, we are committed to cultivate a diverse and inclusive workplace. As an equal-opportunity employer, we welcome applicants of all backgrounds, gender identities, and abilities. We are dedicated to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with specific needs. If you require any adjustments during the selection process, please inform our Talent Acquisition Team.

Come join the Team!

Celfocus is a European high-tech system integrator, providing leading edge professional services focused on creating business value through Analytics and Cognitive solutions ‚Äì addressing Telecommunications, Financial Services, Retail, Energy & Utilities, Pharmaceutical, and other markets' strategic opportunities.

As a highly specialised engineering company, Celfocus helps clients undergo their innovation path, providing technological solutions to extract value from data and make it actionable.

Serving clients in +25 countries, Celfocus delivers solutions that boost customer experience and enhance operational efficiency, via our Cognitive Automation, Data & Analytics and Digital offers.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Mission

The Data Analyst will work on a new product (FINSTAR > Data Capture) of a global project focused on the evolution of third-party data ecosystems would aim to streamline the integration of new data and technologies such as data virtualization, APIs, etc., enhancing the accessibility and real-time availability of data across systems.

FINSTAR has the objective and ambition to build and deploy a new Financial Statement referential that serves internal clients/ business lines next needs, that allows centralized access to quality, standardized (accounting standards), certified (CAC), validated (financial analysts) and homogeneous financial data according to internal models.

Its features must meet the operational needs of the business lines and the needs of internal and regulatory reporting and support the diversification of existing sources and accounting standards.

The opportunity to extend the scope of the company's entities served within FINSTAR will be explored during the project phase.

The Data Analyst will focus on guarantee the follow-up and reliability of the result of this product and quality.

The global aim of the project ensures high data quality and consistency across various REFERENTIALS data sources and reducing discrepancies in reporting and closing figures by performing a deep analysis on the existing data and sources and transform the processes and technologies used, including the existing REFERENTIALS. The goal is to streamline workflows, improving time to market and enabling faster and more accurate insights for better decision-making.

Knowledge in referential data is a plus.

Main Tasks


Create business-facing dashboards and high impact data visualizations and analyses with complex data structures which will support company's internal or external clients achieve their objectives in terms of revenue generation, efficiency creation, production levels and risk management.
Collaborate with internal/external clients to best understand their operational and strategic needs.
Creative descriptive, predictive, and quantitative analyses addressing key business priorities and supporting the stakeholder‚Äôs decision making.
Support and monitor the run of these activities of data analysis, reporting, and data mining.


Profile

Technical Skills


Data knowledge / Data processing / Data quality / IT Development
Database Management (SQL)
Methodologies (Agile)
Office Pack (MS Excel)
Power BI / Tableau


Language Skills


English
French


Soft Skills


IT - Business/IT relationship
Analytical Ability
Data Intelligence, Research and Quant Analytics
Ability to understand, explain and support change
Ability to collaborate/Teamwork


Attention to detail / rigor

Organization

Inetum is a European leader in digital services. Inetum‚Äôs team of 28,000 consultants and specialists strive every day to make a digital impact for businesses, public sector entities and society. Inetum‚Äôs solutions aim at contributing to its clients‚Äô performance and innovation as well as the common good.

Present in 19 countries with a dense network of sites, Inetum partners with major software publishers to meet the challenges of digital transformation with proximity and flexibility.

Driven by its ambition for growth and scale, Inetum generated sales of 2.5 billion euros in 2023.

Title: Master Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

Master Data Analyst

Location: Porto

Hybrid working ‚Äì 3 days in the office

Application closing date: 4th of June 2025

We are seeking a Master Data Analyst to join our team! In this role, you will:


Take responsibility for the setup, administration, and maintenance of master records used across business processes.
Ensure adherence to Data Governance standards and naming conventions.
Manage supplier, customer, finance, quality, and manufacturing engineering master data.
Support business consistency by following group guidelines and MDM quality standards.


üìà Key Responsibilities


‚úÖ Ensure highest degree of data quality (e.g., identify mismatches, eliminate duplicates).
‚úÖ Maintain and administer master records used across business processes:
Supplier Master Data: Creation, changes, inactivation/blocking/activation across purchasing tools, ERPs, and related applications.
Customer Master Data: Creation, changes, inactivation/activation.
Finance Master Data: Maintain Chart of Accounts, cost centers, project data.
Quality Master Data: Maintain IMDS material data sheets and BOM datasets.
Manufacturing Engineering Data: Maintain item master data.
‚úÖ Facilitate the supplier certification process and track compliance.
‚úÖ Review and document supplier quality specifications.


üìÑ Skills & Qualifications

Functional Capabilities:


‚úÖ Prior experience in a similar role/environment
‚úâ Effective communication ‚Äì intermediate English
‚ú® High attention to detail and accuracy
üôå Teamwork-oriented
üìÖ Strong organizational and time-management skills


üéÅ Benefits


üéÇ Birthday off
‚ùÑÔ∏è 24 December off
üéì Career development & global project lifecycle involvement
üåê Access to LinkedIn Learning, Excel, and language courses on-site
üåç Multicultural environment (23 nationalities, 12 languages)
üç¨ Employee Assistance Programme
üåø 1 Day paid volunteering
üè¢Modern office: social, dining & relaxation zones
üöó Discounts at retailers & services

Title: Risk Data Analyst - RISK EM
Description:
About The Job

Within the Group RISK Function, the main mission of RISK EM is to manage credit risk, counterparty risk, market risk and operational risk within the Retail Banking perimeter, which covers Central Europe (Poland, Ukraine), Turkey and the Maghreb (Morocco and Algeria) to:


Contribute to the implementation of a robust risk management framework within the scope,
Monitor and control risks on its perimeter, providing a dynamic and comprehensive analysis of all the risks incurred within its scope,
Ensure compliance with banking regulations in the risk area, in conjunction with the relevant functions within its scope.


Your Main Activities Are

Supporting the EM Risk teams


Framework, planning and budgeting of work
Coordination and development of supporting materials in response to ad hoc requests from the Group (e.g. Stress Tests, ETS, CRR impact study)
Participate in the preparation of materials & minutes for project committees, steering committees and strategic committees (AQC)
Ensure the update of EM policies on non-performing loans, and coordinate cascading within EM entities and monitor operational implementation.
Production of adequate documentation in line with Group Documentation


As part of B-Ready program for the implementation of CRR3 guidelines,


Coordinate actions to ensure the sourcing of CRR3 data, and support EM entities in the certification phase of the calculation of the CRR3 RWA.
Integration of additional regulatory data into local systems required to calculate the RWA according to the Bale 4 standards.
Coordination of the certification phase (Dry Run) and support to entities for data verification, understanding and interpretation of results, as well as implementation of action plans.


Supporting the Risk EM central teams as a PMO on the Prudential Backstops project


Support entities for the shortfall computation, in respect of the timeline imposed by the regulator and by the Group.
Organize workshops with entities and ensure the minutes with the monitoring of action / decisions exchanges.
Collect, control and consolidate the shortfall computed by entities,
Lead the building of the forecast assumption of provisioning evolution.


Ensure the data collection for the Stress Test EBA 2023 and Stress Test CRE


Collect Group needs and share the instructions to EM entities
Monitor the progress of the work in relation to the plans imposed.
Provide support to EM entities in their collection work (prioritization, identification of alternative solutions in case of missing data


Coordinate The Data Reliability Actions Used To Meet The Calculation Needs Of IFRS9 Provisions (Stages 1, 2 And 3), Shortfalls Computation And More Generally On All Projects Monitored By The Team


Support BMCI in identifying data corrections/development, defining and operational monitoring of action plans with a view to improving reliability and data collection.
Monitor the correction actions and the implementation of IT roadmaps for data implementation, feeding and control.


Monitor the implementation of indicators of financial difficulties in the credit process


Monitoring the integration of UTP in the credit process, in the respect of the regulatory deliverables.
Maintenance of the UTP dashboard for monitoring UTP deployment.
Communicate and control the application of updated instructions.


Profile And Skills To Success


2/3 years of experience in same or related field
Data knowledge
Risk analysis
Culture Transformation Change Management
Process improvement
Project management
Active collaboration
Adaptability
English (mandatory): fluent
French (recommended): Operational


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job


The Data Analyst will work on a new product (UMD) of a global project focused on the evolution of third-party data ecosystems would aim to streamline the integration of new data and technologies such as data virtualization, APIs, etc., enhancing the accessibility and real-time availability of data across systems
UMD has the objective and ambition to build and deploy a matching solution live having as a target matching as a service capability with unique identification to all third parties publishing through the Businesses and locations (facilitating cross-selling, making Group-level reports reliable) and new data collection application delivered
The Data Analyst will be in charge of the quality, steering follow-up, building indicators, define and follow remediation actions (including potential architecture change ir new external data sources to be added)
A deep knowledge of banking activities & data (Referentials) knowledge, quality, follow and build indicators
The global aim of the project ensure high data quality and consistency across various REFERENTIALS data sources and reducing discrepancies in reporting and closing figures by performing a deep analyses on the existing data and sources and transform the processes and technologies used, including the existing REFERENTIALS. The goal is to streamline workflows, improving time to market and enabling faster and more accurate insights for better decision-making


Your Main Activities Are


Create business-facing dashboards and high impact data visualizations and analyses with complex data structures which will support BNP Paribas Internal or External clients achieve their objectives in terms of revenue generation, efficiency creation, production levels and risk management. Responsibilities
Collaborate with internal/external clients to best understand their operational and strategic needs.
Create descriptive, predictive and quantitative analyses addressing key business priorities and supporting the stakeholders' decision making.
Actively manage clients.
Support and monitor the run of these activities of data analysis, reporting and data mining.
Coach as necessary more junior members of the team.
Contribute to disseminate a culture of data driven solutions within BNP Paribas
Provide visibility on performance and activities of BNP Paribas to stakeholders


Profile And Skills To Success


Educational background: Information Technology & computer Science / Information Systems or Business Management
More than 4 years of Experience as Data Analyst or similar role
Professional experience in Referential administration (data management, database‚Ä¶) desirable;
Availability and customer orientation skills;
Strong analytical mind, problem solving, planning & organization skills.
Analytical and goal oriented;
Excellent attention to details, Rigour & Accuracy;
Pro-active attitude with ability to work in a fast changing and demanding environment;
Team spirit and at ease with multi-tasking;
Ability to report.
Strong interpersonal communication and presentation skills (spoken and written);
English is mandatory (B2 Level minimum);
French is a plus;
Proficiency in MS Office tools, Power BI, Tableau
Experience with databases and data management
Financial Data knowledge desirable
Client focus


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Business Intelligence Associate
Description:
Who We Are

The next step of your career starts here, where you can bring your own unique mix of skills and perspectives to a fast-growing team.Metyis is a global and forward-thinking firm operating across a wide range of industries, developing and delivering AI & Data, Digital Commerce, Marketing & Design solutions and Advisory services. At Metyis, our long-term partnership model brings long-lasting impact and growth to our business partners and clients through extensive execution capabilities.With our team, you can experience a collaborative environment with highly skilled multidisciplinary experts, where everyone has room to build bigger and bolder ideas. Being part of Metyis means you can speak your mind and be creative with your knowledge. Imagine the things you can achieve with a team that encourages you to be the best version of yourself.

We are Metyis. Partners for Impact.

What We Offer


A balanced work environment where you will have autonomy, responsibility, and ownership while working with a vibrant and dynamic team.
A modern office with everything you need (including food and beverages).
Become part of a fast-growing international and diverse team.



What You Will Do


Design visually appealing and business useful reports.
Understand client requirement and suggest right technical architecture.
Developing technically efficient, fast, useful and appealing reports.
Technical problem solving - good knowledge of DAX and data modelling.
Preparing and facilitating workshops.
Managing stakeholders and communicating with executives.



What you‚Äôll bring


3+ years of experience in PowerBI/ BI design and development.
Prior experience in customer facing role across functions is good to have.
In-depth understand of data modelling and basics of azure environment.
Solid understanding and working experience of other BI tools and powerapps.
Profound knowledge of the English language.

Title: Data Analyst (0 Experience Required)
Description:
For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.




At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.




As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.




With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.




So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!




Benefits

Work up to 20 hours per week.
Earn a competitive rate of pay.
Develop your research skills.
Avoid the long commute.
Work from the comfort of your home office.
Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!




Ideal Candidate

Fluent in English and Portugese.
Excellent research skills.
Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Portugal.
Analytical mindset.




Job Requirements

Must be living in Portugal for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
All work must be of an independent nature.







T&C's apply*




Apply Online Today!

Title: Reporting Specialist - Porto, Portugal
Description:
Come and work with us.

We are looking for a talented and accomplished Reporting Specialist to join our team. The purpose of this role is to directly assist the reporting team by collecting and reporting all KPIs data from Foundever Operations, Supporting Departments and Leadership.

As a Reporting Specialist, Your Daily Responsibilities Will Include


Under limited supervision, prepare and maintain databases & statistical reports used in financial/quality/performance management decision-making.
Investigate and analyze data and decide upon alternatives to complete assignments.
Assemble and assess statistical information from system databases and other sources.
Independently plan, prepare and maintain business unit reports critical to organizational success/profitability and meeting client expectations.
Investigate, analyze and assess trends and campaign/brand activity.
Monitor, evaluate and assess unit productivity on a daily basis.
Communicate with the manager on a daily basis to resolve problems/issues, assess scores/trends and maximize efficiency.
Additional operations support duties as assigned.
Creation of ‚Äúad hoc‚Äù reports under short timelines
Takes personal responsibility to understand and comply with all company and client security requirements and policies.


To succeed in the role, you will need to have:


English C1 advanced level
Strong computer, communication and analytical skills.
Strong knowledge Microsoft Excel
Microsoft Access/Database skills appreciated
Power BI experience is highly valued
VBA knowledge/experience is highly valued
SQL knowledge/experience is highly valued
SAP Business Objects knowledge/experience highly valued
Data Architecture knowledge/experience is highly valued
Ability to collect and assess large sets of data, dashboard creation and KPI evaluation.
Ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
Ability to work with minimal supervision, make independent decisions and solve complex problems
Strong understanding of the call center industry and operations,
Ability to work in a dynamic, fast-paced environment,
Demonstrated ability to develop professional relationships and interact with all levels of internal and external clients.
Solution driven mindset
Must hold EU citizenship or valid work permit for Portugal
Be a local candidate or willing to relocate to Porto, Portugal
Availability to work from our site in Porto
Availibility to work Monday to Friday 8 AM to 5 PM


Education And Experience.


Minimum 1 year experience as Reporting Specialist or Real Time Analyst


Benefits.


Competitive wages
Paid professional training
Employee discounts
Private healthcare & dental insurance (after six months of employment)
Growth opportunities through various development programs
Fun and engaging company-wide initiatives, including our EverBetter wellness program
Job stability
Life-long skills and experience
Excellent work culture


Go further with Foundever‚Ñ¢

We believe in memorable associate experiences. Here, you can improve your quality of life and grow your career.‚ÄØ

Apply today!

Title: CRM Data Analyst
Description:
ABOUT US üöÄ

Hostelworld Group, the global hostel-focussed online booking platform, inspires adventurous minds to meet the world and come back with life-changing stories to tell. Our customers are not your average tourists, they crave cultural connection and unique experiences that we make possible by providing an unbeatable selection of hostels in unmissable locations ‚Äì all in the palm of their hand.

It is the social nature and community feel of hostels and their environment, that enable travellers to embrace journeys of discovery, adventure and meaning. We have more than 13 million reviews across 17,800 hostels in more than 179 countries, making the brand the leading online hub for social travel. The website operates in 19 different languages and our mobile app in 13 languages.

Founded in 1999 and headquartered in Dublin, Hostelworld has a growing, high-calibre team of 230 people within Technology, Product, Global Markets, HR, Finance & Legal and Marketing Teams across our Dublin, London, Porto, Shanghai and Sydney offices. Hostelworld is listed on the London Stock Exchange and Dublin Euronext. You can read more about our story here.




LOCATIONüåç

This role is based in Portugal. We have an office hub in Porto available for those who prefer a hybrid model where you can spend time with colleagues in-person. You will need to be able to commute to our office hub as required from time to time.




WHO YOU'LL WORK WITH üë®üèΩ‚Äçü§ù‚Äçüë®üèº

We have a matrixed structure here at Hostelworld; with Growth teams comprising of people across Technology, Product, Marketing and Analytics & Insights (A&I) ‚Äì all working towards one common goal with aligned objectives.

This role sits in the Mobile Analytics Team reporting to the Head of Growth Analytics. We are seeking a CRM Analyst to play a crucial role in enhancing our customer relationships through data-driven insights. You will be instrumental in analysing customer behaviours, segmenting audiences, and optimising our marketing efforts to improve customer engagement and retention. This role is ideal for someone who is passionate about leveraging data to drive business decisions and enhance the customer journey in the travel sector. You will be working with best in class technology and working within a wider motivated team of data analysts, engineers and scientists.

Our core data stack:

Front End Tracking: Google Analytics
CDP: Segment
CRM: Iterable
Data Storage: GCP & Snowflake
Data Visualisation and Usage: Tableau, Snowflake, Vertex AI
Orchestration: Airflow
Transformation: DBT
Synching data: Fivetran, Hightouch, Twilio Segment




WHAT YOU'LL DO üë©‚Äçüíª

Develop and maintain segments for personalised marketing campaigns based on customer behaviour, demographic data, and booking patterns.
Analyse CRM data to provide actionable insights on customer lifecycle, loyalty, and retention.
Collaborate with the mobile team to design, test, and optimize campaigns across multiple channels.
Monitor and report on the performance of CRM initiatives, providing regular updates to senior management on their impact on revenue and customer engagement.
Manage the integration of new data sources into the CRM system to ensure a holistic view of the customer.
Utilise advanced analytical techniques to predict customer behaviours and identify opportunities for growth and improvement.




WHAT WE‚ÄôRE LOOKING FOR üëÄ

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Marketing, Business, Statistics, or a related field.
2+ years of experience in CRM analytics or a related field, preferably in the travel or tech industry.
Strong analytical skills with experience in SQL, Excel, and CRM software (e.g., Salesforce, HubSpot).
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI.
Knowledge of statistical modeling and data mining techniques is a plus.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights.
Proactive, detail-oriented, and capable of handling multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment.
Knowledge of agile project management and familiarity with working alongside engineering teams to prioritize product enhancements.




WHAT WE OFFER üíØ

Competitive salary & benefits
Enhanced annual leave plus 3 Wellbeing Days per year
Paid family leave (maternity, paternity, surrogacy & adoption)
Agile working (plus a Working from Abroad Policy!)
Support for your ongoing growth & development
Inclusive people policies (sickness, menopause, compassionate and fertility leave)
A chance to give back to your local community with 5 paid volunteering days




We believe in talented and diverse teams that reflect the diversity of our customers and the communities in which we operate. Everyone brings different perspectives and experiences. We lay out the above requirements to guide applicants to the experiences that we believe will allow you to be successful in the role. If you don‚Äôt meet them all, please consider applying if you think you can still perform the role as described.

HTML:
ABOUT US üöÄ

Hostelworld Group, the global hostel-focussed online booking platform, inspires adventurous minds to meet the world and come back with life-changing stories to tell. Our customers are not your average tourists, they crave cultural connection and unique experiences that we make possible by providing an unbeatable selection of hostels in unmissable locations ‚Äì all in the palm of their hand.

It is the social nature and community feel of hostels and their environment, that enable travellers to embrace journeys of discovery, adventure and meaning. We have more than 13 million reviews across 17,800 hostels in more than 179 countries, making the brand the leading online hub for social travel. The website operates in 19 different languages and our mobile app in 13 languages.

Founded in 1999 and headquartered in Dublin, Hostelworld has a growing, high-calibre team of 230 people within Technology, Product, Global Markets, HR, Finance & Legal and Marketing Teams across our Dublin, London, Porto, Shanghai and Sydney offices. Hostelworld is listed on the London Stock Exchange and Dublin Euronext. You can read more about our story here.

Title: Alteryx Data Analyst
Description:
Empowered by our motto, "Making Data Matter", Keyrus stands at the forefront of global consultancy in Data & Analytics, AI & Machine Learning, and Digital Transformation. With a presence in 27 countries across 4 continents, we're on a mission to elevate the impact of data.

We are data experts, guiding our clients through their data journey regardless of their level of maturity in analytics. As an end-to-end partner, we address varied challenges that our clients face, from Advanced Analytics, Cloud, Data Governance, Visualisation to Enterprise Performance Management, from advisory to delivery.

With more than 3200 employees in all corners of the world, Keyrus is dedicated to helping businesses taking advantage of the Data and Digital paradigm to enhance their performance, facilitating, and accelerating their transformation, and generating new drivers of growth, competitiveness, and sustainability.

Job Summary

Keyrus is looking for an Data Analyst. The ideal candidate embodies technical prowess in Alteryx, coupled with a fervent commitment to making every piece of data matter. We value individuals who are detail-oriented, independent contributors with exceptional communication and problem-solving skills, ensuring that together, we continue to transform possibilities into reality.

This position is Hybrid in Porto - 2x week.

Note: All applications/CV‚Äôs must be submitted in English.

Key Responsibilities


Design and model data preparation workflows using Alteryx, including the creation of complex macros
Contribute to application design and data visualisation modelling
Work with databases and apply strong knowledge of SQL and data modelling
(DMC)
Collaborate with teams on data visualisation and restitution, with tools such as Tableau and Power BI (preferred)
Deliver high-quality solutions with a strong client-focused approach
Participate actively in team discussions and contribute to collaborative problem-solving


Requirements For The Role


+3 years of professional experience as a Data Analyst / Alteryx Consultant
Mandatory expertise in Alteryx, particularly in workflow modelling and complex macro creation
Proficiency in SQL and data modelling
Knowledge of application design and data visualisation
Experience with Tableau and Power BI is a plus
Strong teamwork and communication skills
Fluent in English
Must be a Portuguese or European citizen or have a work permit for Portugal


What We Offer At Keyrus Portugal


Competitive salary based on your skills & experience and according to the Data market practice
Meal allowance of ‚Ç¨8.32 per day
Flexible benefits option
Private Medical Insurance
22 days of annual leave (increasing every 3 years up to a maximum of 25 days)
Training Program through KLX (Keyrus Learning Experience) Platform


Why Keyrus?

Joining Keyrus means joining a market leader in the Data Intelligence field and an (inter)national player in Management Consultancy and Digital Experience.

Keyrus Portugal operates on five guiding pillars that shape our approach to work and collaboration ‚Äì Diversity; Trust; Flexibility; Ownership & Innovation - we're dedicated to cultivating a team as diverse as the challenges we take on.

We embrace and celebrate the rich variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and talents that each individual brings. We firmly believe that diversity fuels innovation, ignites creativity, and propels us towards greatness.

Regardless of race, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, disability, age, or any other dimension of diversity, everyone is not only welcome but valued here.

Join us in shaping a future where everyone can thrive!

At Keyrus Portugal, we're more than just a company - we're a constellation of bright minds and innovative souls.

If you're seeking a place where your passion meets purpose, where every project is a canvas and every challenge an opportunity, then look no further.

Join us, and be a part of a community that's shaping the digital frontier. At Keyrus Portugal, your journey to greatness begins.

Title: Data Science Associate (Fashion)
Description:
Who We Are




We are Metyis, a forward-thinking, global company that develops and delivers solutions around Big Data, Digital Commerce, Marketing and Design and provides Advisory services. We have offices in 15 locations with a talent pool of 1000+ employees and more than 50 nationalities, dedicated to creating long-lasting impact and growth for our business partners and clients.

Together with HUGO BOSS, our esteemed business partner, we have embarked on a joint venture and created the HUGO BOSS Digital Campus, dedicated to increasing the data analytics, eCommerce and technology capabilities of the company and boosting digital sales. The HUGO BOSS Digital Campus employees will help create a state-of-the-art data architecture infrastructure, advanced business analytics, and the development and enhancement of HUGO BOSS‚Äô eCommerce platform and services.

This collaborative environment will provide the capabilities required for HUGO BOSS to maximise data usage and support its growth trajectory towards becoming the leading premium tech-driven fashion platform worldwide.




We are Metyis. Partners for Impact.




What We Offer




Opportunity to accelerate the pace of digitalization through advanced technology, business intelligence, and analytics.
Driving high-impact insights enhancing decision making across the entire organization.
Interaction with senior business leaders on regular basis to drive their business towards impactful change.
Become part of a fast-growing international and diverse team




What you will do




Conduct advanced data analysis focused on omnichannel customer behavior, CRM performance, and sales effectiveness across digital and physical touchpoints (specific for our team).
Translate business problems into analytical solutions, from requirement gathering to model deployment and monitoring.
Build, deploy, and maintain machine learning models (e.g. churn, CLV, segmentation, personalization) using modern MLOps frameworks (e.g. MLflow, GitL).
Leverage Databricks, Azure, or similar cloud infrastructure for scalable data processing and model deployment.
Use Python, PySpark, and common ML libraries (e.g. scikit-learn, XGBoost, LightGBM, etc.) for data transformation, model development, and evaluation.
Apply statistical methods (e.g. hypothesis testing, A/B testing, confidence intervals) to validate performance and derive actionable insights.
Communicate findings and recommendations clearly through compelling storytelling and visualizations.
Collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders (e.g. Business teams, Data Engineering, IT teams) and contribute to customer-centric strategies..
Support team development through knowledge sharing, collaboration, and participation in agile working models.




What you‚Äôll bring




3‚Äì5 years of experience in data science or advanced analytics, ideally in retail or e-commerce.
Master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative field such as Data Science, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, or Engineering.
Proven ability to manage the full lifecycle of an ML solution ‚Äì from business understanding, data wrangling, and modelling, to production deployment and monitoring.
Hands-on experience with MLflow, Git, and MLOps frameworks.
Solid programming skills in Python, including libraries like pandas, NumPy, scikit-learn, matplotlib, seaborn, and PySpark.
Experience with Azure (preferred) or AWS, especially in the context of Databricks, data pipelines, and model hosting.
Good understanding of data warehousing and querying using SQL.
Familiarity with statistical concepts (e.g. experiment design, hypothesis testing, p-values).
Strong communication and stakeholder management skills, including the ability to present technical insights to non-technical audiences.
Fluency in English (written and spoken);




Nice to have:




Experience within the retail and fashion industry.
Experience within international environments, consultancies, or a start-up environment.




In a changing world, diversity and inclusion are core values for team well-being and performance. At Metyis, we want to welcome and retain all talents, regardless of gender, age, origin or sexual orientation, and irrespective of whether or not they are living with a disability, as each of them has their own experience and identity.

Title: Data Analyst & Operations Manager
Description:
DESCRIPTION

We are scaling our AI team with mission-driven individuals eager to shape the future of mobility. As a Data Analyst and Operation Manager, you‚Äôll collaborate closely with our research team to design, build, and optimize data infrastructure and annotation workflows. You will oversee the annotation team, ensuring high-quality labeled data and efficient processes. Additionally, you will help optimize our algorithms, analyze performance metrics, and define optimal operating points to enhance model effectiveness. Your work will directly contribute to pushing the boundaries of Vision AI and advancing our cutting-edge projects.


RESPONSIBILITIES

Model Evaluation
Work closely with the research team to evaluate model performance and define optimal operating points using precision, recall, and other ML evaluation metrics.
Annotation Management
Oversee annotation processes and manage the annotation team to ensure high-quality labeled data and streamlined workflows.
Database Management
Manage and maintain internal research databases for data-driven decision-making.
Cloud Infrastructure
Develop, maintain, and optimize cloud-based data infrastructure (AWS, GCP).
Benchmarking Framework
Build and maintain a benchmarking framework for continuous algorithm performance evaluation, including human-in-the-loop pipelines.
Dataset Curation
Curate training and testing datasets by querying databases and annotations, and by running data quality and auto-labelling tools.
Model Execution
Run algorithms and deep-learning models at scale.¬†

REQUIREMENTS

Technical skills & qualifications¬†


BA in computer science or other exact science/engineering

3-5 years of experience

Strong understanding of machine learning concepts and model evaluation techniques.

Experience with database management (SQL, NoSQL) and large-scale data processing.

Familiarity with data annotation processes and experience managing labeling teams.

Proficiency in Python and SQL for data manipulation and analysis.

Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work in cross-functional teams.

Experience working with cloud-based data infrastructure (AWS, GCP, or Azure), including provisioning machines for development and multi-GPU training.

Familiarity with data engineering and analytics tools such as Databricks, Spark, and other cloud-based platform



People skills & traits¬†


Highly organized and methodical, with a strong eye for detail.

Ability to manage complex processes efficiently while ensuring data integrity.

Creative and innovative problem-solving skills with a passion for cutting-edge technologies and product delivery.

Strong team player and self-learner with excellent communication skills.

A ‚Äúcan-do‚Äù mindset in a fast-paced environment.


WHAT WE OFFER
The chance to have a meaningful and positive impact on roads and cities‚Äô safety
Flexibility - in schedule, work location, benefits
Competitive compensation
A fast-paced work environment full of kind, smart, and highly driven people
Great professional and personal growth opportunities
Regular team-building events and well-being initiatives/facilities

WHO WE ARE

Nexar is a Vision AI company that is organising the physical world as digital information. We are a global, connected, and intelligent network of mobile cameras on the road that uses data to deliver valuable insights and build transformative products in vehicle autonomy and safety.

Our goal is to be the best car camera service in the world, with a vast network of smart, connected cameras across the planet. We are unlocking the power of connected driving to protect our users and build a lasting business, and this is where you come in!

We‚Äôre looking for passionate, forward-thinking people to help us execute this incredible opportunity and drive the future of connected driving technology. Join us in shaping a safer, smarter world.

Title: Business Analyst (PL/SQL- Financial Markets)
HTML:
Your connection with Aubay starts in the following lines:

Aubay Portugal is a multinational French company, in Portugal since 2007. We have offices in Lisbon and Oporto and we are a specialized consultant in Management, Implementation, Development and Maintenance of Information Systems. We have more than 150 active partners and we operate in sectors such as banking, insurance, telecommunications, services, energy and transports.


What are we looking for?

  • + 6 years of experience as IT business analyst;
  • Knowledge of PL/SQL (Sybase or MS SQL Server);
  • Experience in Market risk within banking;
  • Experience in Agile Project Methodology
  • Fluency in English.


What do we have to offer you?

  • Health Insurance;
  • Feedback&Coffee ‚Äì the system that includes Aubay‚Äôs Performance Management Cycle, with regular moments of feedback and the Career Progression Model;

  • A Training Academy designed to think of you and your needs. You can count on technical and behavioural training sessions (e-Learning and classroom), Meet&Techs, Webinars and Mentoring;

What makes us different?

  • We know your name and all address each other informally;

If we got your attention, we now hope to spark your enthusiasm. Ready for the first phase?

We are waiting for you at andre.b.eufrasio@aubay.pt.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
HTML:

Title: Senior Risk Data Analyst - RISK EM
Description:
About The Job

Within the Group RISK Function, the main mission of RISK EM is to manage credit risk, counterparty risk, market risk and operational risk within the Retail Banking perimeter, which covers Central Europe (Poland, Ukraine), Turkey and the Maghreb (Morocco and Algeria) to:


Contribute to the implementation of a robust risk management framework within the scope,
Monitor and control risks on its perimeter, providing a dynamic and comprehensive analysis of all the risks incurred within its scope,
Ensure compliance with banking regulations in the risk area, in conjunction with the relevant functions within its scope.


Your Main Activities Are

Supporting the EM Risk teams


Framework, planning and budgeting of work
Coordination and development of supporting materials in response to ad hoc requests from the Group (e.g. Stress Tests, ETS, CRR impact study)
Participate in the preparation of materials & minutes for project committees, steering committees and strategic committees (AQC)
Ensure the update of EM policies on non-performing loans, and coordinate cascading within EM entities and monitor operational implementation.
Production of adequate documentation in line with Group Documentation


As part of B-Ready program for the implementation of CRR3 guidelines,


Coordinate actions to ensure the sourcing of CRR3 data, and support EM entities in the certification phase of the calculation of the CRR3 RWA.
Integration of additional regulatory data into local systems required to calculate the RWA according to the Bale 4 standards.
Coordination of the certification phase (Dry Run) and support to entities for data verification, understanding and interpretation of results, as well as implementation of action plans.


Supporting the Risk EM central teams as a PMO on the Prudential Backstops project


Support entities for the shortfall computation, in respect of the timeline imposed by the regulator and by the Group.
Organize workshops with entities and ensure the minutes with the monitoring of action / decisions exchanges.
Collect, control and consolidate the shortfall computed by entities,
Lead the building of the forecast assumption of provisioning evolution.


Ensure the data collection for the Stress Test EBA 2023 and Stress Test CRE


Collect Group needs and share the instructions to EM entities
Monitor the progress of the work in relation to the plans imposed.
Provide support to EM entities in their collection work (prioritization, identification of alternative solutions in case of missing data


Coordinate The Data Reliability Actions Used To Meet The Calculation Needs Of IFRS9 Provisions (Stages 1, 2 And 3), Shortfalls Computation And More Generally On All Projects Monitored By The Team


Support BMCI in identifying data corrections/development, defining and operational monitoring of action plans with a view to improving reliability and data collection.
Monitor the correction actions and the implementation of IT roadmaps for data implementation, feeding and control.


Monitor the implementation of indicators of financial difficulties in the credit process


Monitoring the integration of UTP in the credit process, in the respect of the regulatory deliverables.
Maintenance of the UTP dashboard for monitoring UTP deployment.
Communicate and control the application of updated instructions.


Profile And Skills To Success


4/5 years of experience in same or related field
Data knowledge
Risk analysis
Culture Transformation Change Management
Process improvement
Project management
Active collaboration
Adaptability
English (mandatory): fluent
French (recommended): Operational


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Insights Analyst
Description:
Company Description:

BrandDelta empowers companies around the world to transform the way their Brands can learn and win. Our Brand Intelligence platform is built to enable our clients to understand how consumers perceive their brands faster, deeper and in a more actionable manner with measurable links. We are already optimizing ¬£550m of marketing investment to help Brands Grow across 3 continents. BrandDelta has ambitious plans for growth, with Porto marked as the centre for our team growth and development. Our Founders have a history building globally awarded AI businesses (e.g. achieving a top-10 Gartner rating for AI-led insight in 2020 and 2021) and investing heavily back into the Team & the Business.




Role Description:

As an Insights Analyst,¬†you will play pivotal role in turning our unique data into compelling insights & stories to attract & engage with Marketing, Brand, and Leadership teams in Global Consumer & D2C organizations. We are developing and integrating a corpus of cross-channel digital signals from social, search, web, reviews and offline survey datasets to uncover insights, to help our clients & new prospects succeed in the 21st Century marketing.




In this role, you will be responsible for collaborating with our Data & AI team here in Porto in undertaking strategic and ongoing research to scale our platform & Develop Insights from the Product Category you will be working on. You will typically take ownership of a number categories & clients, whilst identifying compelling & topical insights.

You will play client facing and report to our Insights team + Leadership in order to ensure a successful link between the relationship and insights




Requirements

Undergraduate or higher degree in Business, Economics, Social Sciences, from a reputable University with a strong academic performance
Autonomous and willing to take the ownership on their own projects
Proven experience in conducting research & understanding various research methodologies
Data driven & literate (data analysis, vlookups, correlational analysis, pivots etc.)
Strong storytelling & presentation skills
A track record of writing plans and designing research
Culturally plugged in and literate in modern media from a user & industry perspective
Sharp thinker and crisp communicator ‚Äì able to synthesize complex problems to senior leaders
Ability to synthesize large amounts of information - and translate into an easily understood story
This is a client facing role and candidates must be comfortable in this environment




Preferred Skills/Experience:

Experience in Consumer / Marketing insights with the ability to apply knowledge of and passion for digital, social, mobile media, and other new platforms to provide insight and evaluation that helps clients build stronger consumer connections.
Pricing, Promotions, Marketing Insight are a huge plus
Consumer Insights background in Marketing research outfit such as Kantar, IPSOS, or similar is also preferred.
Ability to explain findings and recommendations to a broad business audience, both internal and external
Educated on a variety of analytical methods, shapes thinking and influences decisions
Effectively complete tasks to achieve both short- and long-term goals within a team




What we offer:

Career Acceleration - Fast growth with many opportunities both in the AI-led software and business domains, with board-level clients.
Health Insurance
Flexible Work Hours - adjust your schedule to your needs
Work Setup - Hybrid ‚Äì Work from home but also collaborate weekly with the team
Hardware and software for remote setup
Autonomy and Ownership Culture
Continuous feedback culture
Innovation Mindset

Title: Data Analyst (m/f)
Description:

Title: Forecast and Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

MIR Insight forecasts demand and price developments in the materials industry, enabling companies to reduce waste and minimize losses. We are a fast-growing tech startup serving leading industry players such as K.D. Feddersen, Maral Overseas Ltd, and Jobachem, supported by international investors. Our goal is to provide our users with innovative, reliable, and user-friendly software. Join us on our mission to transform the manufacturing supply chain into a highly efficient, sustainable, and near-predictive economy.


Your Mission

Ensure that our clients receive the most accurate, relevant, and actionable forecasts‚Äîdelivered on time, clearly explained, and tailored to their business needs. You will be part of a small, high-impact forecasting team working closely with data scientists, product engineers, and customers across Europe, the U.S., and India.


What You‚Äôll Do

Ingest, clean, and structure customer data to prepare it for forecasting
Analyze forecast outputs, validate them against industry logic and trends
Ensure timely and high-quality delivery of forecasts to all clients
Continuously monitor model performance and help push the boundaries of forecasting accuracy
Translate technical forecasts into clear, understandable business insights
Collaborate with customers to understand their planning needs and business goals
Document experiments, iterations, and customer-specific improvements
Proactively identify risks, outliers, or new opportunities in the data
Contribute to automation and process improvements to enhance team efficiency
Support the product team with structured feedback from customer use




What We‚Äôre Looking For

2‚Äì5 years experience in a management consultant, data analyst, BI, or applied statistics role
Strong analytical mindset and a passion for solving complex, real-world problems
Experience working with time series, forecasting, or econometric data
Solid skills in Python, R, or SQL ‚Äî and a knack for fast data wrangling
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English
Business intuition: you understand that numbers are only useful if they drive decisions
Bonus: experience with supply chains, pricing models, or industrial production data


What We Offer

The chance to shape the future of how companies plan and forecast
A high-performance, founder-led team and fast-paced startup culture
Competitive salary with potential equity upside
Flexible working setup
Opportunity to grow into a Lead Analyst or Customer Strategy role as we scale

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
We‚Äôre the world‚Äôs leading data, insights, and consulting company; we shape the brands of tomorrow by better understanding people everywhere.

Our Functions teams are right at the centre of our business, making sure we can always get better, every day. Supporting the business with things like Marketing, Human Resources, Finance, Legal and Technology, our Functions colleagues are skilled professionals whose role it is to ensure we continue to become an indispensable partner to brands everywhere.

Job Details

About the BI Team: The Kantar BI team is a dynamic, integrated function that delivers expert data tools and insights to Finance across Kantar. Our primary focus is to empower business teams with seamless access to high-quality data while managing best-in-class business intelligence solutions. By enhancing data quality and streamlining BI processes, we drive operational excellence and elevate the overall business experience.

Why this job is important

As a Business Intelligence Analyst within Kantar‚Äôs BI team, you will play a key role in executing and supporting the company‚Äôs business intelligence strategy. Reporting directly to the BI Manager, you will be responsible for delivering high-quality reporting, analytics, and data-driven insights that align with strategic objectives. Your contributions will help transform raw data into valuable business intelligence, whether through reports, analyses, or by enhancing the team‚Äôs existing BI assets.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing


Project Ownership: Take charge of assigned projects, ensuring alignment with team priorities and strategic goals. Oversee the entire delivery process from inception to completion, adhering to deadlines and maintaining quality standards.
Data Analysis & Reporting: Create and sustain strategic dashboards, offering data-driven insights regarding performance across all financial dimensions.
Stakeholder Management: Manage stakeholder expectations throughout the project lifecycle. Provide regular updates on project progress, address concerns, and ensure deliverables meet stakeholder requirements.
Advanced Analytics Support: Facilitate the application of advanced analytics models, such as forecasting, collaborating with the BI Manager to ensure new models are seamlessly incorporated into existing systems and processes.
Continuous Improvement: Contribute to continuous improvement initiatives by identifying areas for process optimization and innovation. Support the team‚Äôs efforts to enhance reporting and analytics capabilities by facilitating automation of reporting with BI Tools.
Collaboration & Communication: Work closely with all team members to ensure effective collaboration. Communicate effectively to ensure alignment on project goals and deliverables.
Training & Education: Participate in training and education programs to enhance your BI skills and knowledge. Support the broader team‚Äôs efforts to promote a data-driven culture within the organisation.


The Skills & Experience Needed As Business Intelligence Analyst


Educational Background: Bachelor‚Äôs degree in business administration, engineering, data science, computer science, or a related field.
Experience: Previous experience in a business intelligence, data analysis, or similar role.
Technical Skills: Proficiency in BI tools (such as Power BI, Tableau, or MicroStrategy), data analysis techniques, and proficiency in Excel. Familiarity with ERP Reporting Platforms (Maconomy, SAP, Oracle) is a plus.
Analytical Skills: Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data and provide actionable insights.
Task Management: Ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously, ensuring timely delivery and alignment with team priorities.
Communication Skills: Strong written and verbal communication skills in English, with the ability to engage effectively with senior stakeholders.
Problem-Solving: A proactive approach to problem-solving, with the ability to identify challenges and develop effective solutions.
Collaboration: A team player with the ability to work effectively in a cross-functional environment.


What‚Äôs In It For You


Flexible hybrid working
Up to 25 days off, plus your birthday off and two days paid for volunteering
Meal card and flexible benefits where you are allocated funds to spend on a variety of benefits such as transport cost, education related and more


Country

Portugal

Why join Kantar?

We shape the brands of tomorrow by better understanding people everywhere. By understanding people, we can understand what drives their decisions, actions, and aspirations on a global scale. And by amplifying our in-depth expertise of human understanding alongside ground-breaking technology, we can help brands find concrete insights that will help them succeed in our fast-paced, ever shifting world.

And because we know people, we like to make sure our own people are being looked after as well. Equality of opportunity for everyone is our highest priority and we support our colleagues to work in a way that supports their health and wellbeing. While we encourage teams to spend part of their working week in the office, we understand no one size fits all; our approach is flexible to ensure everybody feels included, accepted, and that we can win together. We‚Äôre dedicated to creating an inclusive culture and value the diversity of our people, clients, suppliers and communities, and we encourage applications from all backgrounds and sections of society. Even if you feel like you‚Äôre not an exact match, we‚Äôd love to receive your application and talk to you about this job or others at Kantar.

Title: Finance Data Analyst
Description:
Decskill was founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company and their main mission is to delivery value through the knowledge. We enable companies to meet the chalenges of digital world by providing our clients with business models that ensure technological capacity, flexibility and agility. We are more than 500 consultants with offices in Lisbon, Porto and Madrid.




DECSKILL operates in 3 main areas:

DECSKILL TALENT, through which we provide our clients with an extension to their IT teams;




DECSKILL BOOST, through which we provide our client with software development models to increase capacity and optimize Time-to-Market, where we create and manage teams that deliver according to their needs, at the desired speed;




DECSKILL CONNECT, through which we provide our client with consulting services, as well as the implementation and management of information technology infrastructures.




Our practice results in the creation of value for our customers, either by delivering qualified and value-added services, or through highly qualified and motivated professionals, as well as technology solutions that allow us to operate and transform the business of our customers.




We are looking for an Finance Data Analyst!




Responsibilities:

Analyse and interpret financial data focusing on IFRS13.
Developing analytical models for Position, PnL and Mark to Market, valuation etc.
Build and maintain financial data transformation & reports and dashboards for internal stakeholders.
Maintain finance master data governance model. ¬∑ Ensure data accuracy and support automation of recurring reporting tasks.




Requirements:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in finance, Accounting, Economics, or a related field. ¬∑ 1‚Äì3 years of experience in financial or data analysis.
Working knowledge of IFRS 13 and financial instrument valuation. ¬∑ Strong analytical mindset and attention to detail.
Advanced Excel (formulas, pivot tables, Power Query).
SQL for querying and managing financial datasets. ¬∑ Basic knowledge of AI models related to Finance is a Plus.
Power BI or Qlik sense or Open source (Apache Superset..) for data visualization and reporting.
Familiarity with financial systems or market data platforms (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters) is a plus
Proficiency in English.




If you‚Äôre interested in this job, please send your CV to cesaltina.abreu@decskill.com with reference ‚ÄúCA/FinanceDataAnalyst‚Äù.




Thank You! üòä




Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being
